description:
Rob Beckett – Giraffe, Comedian, presenter and panel-show superstar announces new tour Giraffe for 2025.

Smashing the life out of the M25, M1, M5 and any other road that’s in my way. From Bromley to Brisbane, my new show Giraffe is going worldwide.

Expectations on me: put on 3 stone from takeaways and post-show drinking.

Expectations of you: leave the gig happier than when you arrived.

My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children/podcast content providers… but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.

What else is there to do? Sit next to your partner on the sofa, scrolling TikTok in silence again? You did that the last three nights. See you there!

Host of Sky’s Rob Beckett’s Smart TV and Rob & Romesh Vs. He’s also the unmistakable voice of Channel 4’s Celebs Go Dating and the smash-hit podcast Parenting Hell.

“Hilarious” – The Mirror

“Naturally funny” – The Times

“Hilariously observational comic… brings roars of laughter” – Arts Desk
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone)
Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.

From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.

Critics and audiences can’t get enough:

★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*ing funny hour of laughs!”


★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”


★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”

With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.

One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Lighthouse Trio, Join us as we explore some new interpretations of familiar melodies and unheard compositions! The trio will play original arrangements of favourite tunes as well as come brand new original songs. Expect mysterious ballads, soulful blues, and exhilarating bop.

The Lighthouse Trio is made up of three of Wellington's busiest players; Alex Trask, Jeremy Grant, and Elijah Mulheron. Alex is a highly regarded alto saxophonist who is seen all around town leading bands and playing for some of the leading musical organisations, including the RNZAF band and formerly the Rodger Fox Big Band. Elijah is the busiest bassist in town and often appears with Wellington legends such as Callum Allardice and John Rae. Jeremy is an extremely captivating guitarist and the creative force behind the arrangements you will hear.

The trio is celebrating the release of their debut EP with a tour of their own backyard, playing for the first time in Pito-one and Raumati, and finishing with a gig in central Wellington. Come along for an evening of fresh music presented in a relaxed setting, we hope to see you there!

Free entry, koha appreciated

description:
Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson, Saturday Laughs with Ben Hurley and Josh Thomson
Saturday Laughs returns to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club, with another great line up of top Kiwi comedy

With MC Ben Hurley
As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

And headline act Josh Thomson
Josh is a household name and a legend on the New Zealand comedy scene. He has been a mainstay on local comedy shows like 7Days, Have You Been Paying Attention, was the regular comedian on The Project and was the champion of Season 3 of TaskMaster NZ – which he now directs. He also directed and starred in a web series about his own father Subject:Dad.

As an actor he’s appeared internationally in Prime’s The Office Australia, Netflix’s The New Legends Of Monkey, NBC’s Young Rock and local hits Good Grief, Creamerie, Wellington Paranormal, Educators, Time Bandits and the Emmy winning INSiDE. His feature film work includes the How to Please a Woman (Australia), Don’t Make Me Go (US), and local favourites Gary of the Pacific, Pork Pie, & Guns Akimbo.

Josh continues to work as a live performer, whether gigging on tour with 7DaysLive, appearing on the Comedy Gala, hosting the Great Comedy Debate or as an MC for corporate events. He’s hosted the NZ Film Awards, the 48Hour Film awards, various Vodafone events and several spots for the NZ Music awards.

Support from
Li'i Alaimoana
Sera Devcich
Katy Borrows

Book early and often!

This event made possible with support from the Upper Hutt Creative Communities scheme, and Aotearoa Gaming Trust
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Michael Macaulay and Lana Walters, Saturday Laughs is a comedy showcase with top Kiwi comedians from around the country, right in the heart of Wellington at Fringe Bar!

This month features headline act Lana Walters
Winner of the Billy T award, Lana is a fabulous standup comedian, television writer and improviser. A regular panelist on 7Days and The Project, you may have also seen her in the Best Foods Comedy Gala or The Great Comedy Debate. As well as all this, Lana is a mum of two young kids giving her endless material and sleepless nights.

With MC Michael Macaulay
Michael started in comedy in the late 90s, eventually winning the Becks Beer award for Best Newcomer at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2001. After a nearly 20 year hiatus he returned to comedy in a totally different country and having learned no life lessons at all.
Since then he has twice been nominated for ‘Best MC’, in the Welly Awards; won his own Welly in 2020 for being an all-round nice person; and performs up and down Aotearoa.

Also featuring
Gabby Anderson
Ralph Hilaga
and more!

description:
Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington, Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington
https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance and theatre.

The story follows Ash (Ben Ashby), Morris (Ethan Morse) and Mary (Jasmine Susic), at their university graduation house party. As they deal with personal heartbreaks, surprises and betrayals they must also reckon with a climate disaster unfolding in their hometown and a global future filled with war and political unrest. Dance, Clown, Live Music, Film and Physical Theatre weave together to catch the feeling of hope in the face of oncoming doom.

Running into the sun was developed by a2 Company; The Dance & Theatre production house co-directed by Nadiyah Akbar (Footnote NZ Dance, Joel Bray Dance) and Ben Ashby (Artistic Director of Long Cloud Youth Theatre 2020-2023).

“messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.” - Melbourne Fringe Festival: Judges’ Picks.

“...suffocating and comforting …exhausting but exhilarating” - My Melbourne Arts

https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

Credits

description:
Split Bill: Sohn Zone & D.E.I.'s, Sohn Zone - Rich & Rebecca Sohn

The Sohn Zone is a half hour of comedy, improvised in form and content, from Second City, Annoyance and iO Chicago veterans, Rich and Rebecca Sohn.
This show is organic. They trust each other, the audience, improv, and the moment to find their form. Nothing is decided beforehand.

Rich and Rebecca Sohn met as improvisers in Chicago over 30 years ago. As long-time teachers, this duo show began when former students asked them to headline a new evening of improv. Students often expressed surprise at how different their teaching styles were and took to saying “you’re in the Sohn zone” when seeing the couple work together.

D.E.I.'s - Mo Munn & Ralph Hilaga

When two besties land jobs at a prestigious company, they discover they’re not there for their skills — they’re the token hires. What follows is an improvised journey of chaos, corporate jargon, and an earnest attempt to prove they’re more than just the diversity checkbox.

From the chaotic minds of Wellington improv duo Mo and Ralph, D.E.I.’s is a sharp, satirical, improvised workplace comedy about tokenism, identity, and the conundrums of modern day allyship. If you’ve ever wondered what happens when the diversity quota starts talking back — this is it.

As the Sohn Zone is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. D.E.I.'s contains strong language and adult themes, and discussions of topics like racism, queerness, and tokenism. Some material may touch on lived experiences of marginalisation and may be confronting for some audience members.

Both shows may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like
THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Visit ANZ Bank archives and museum, Visit ANZ Bank archives and museum
Get a different angle on Wellington history, through items ranging from Wakefield cheques to comic commercials featuring Clive James.

Hear about the origins of the first bank in New Zealand, see some of its oldest records, displays of banking equipment, early television commercials from various banks, and stories from 185 years of banking in this country. Learn about the rich research resources held by the Archives covering many important organisations (including the Union Bank, Bank of Australasia, National Bank, Countrywide).


Booking is REQUIRED.
Cost: Free
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/visit-anz-bank-archives-and-museum/

None

Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI (Kids)– Pop-up Parlour 2025, Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI (Kids)– Pop-up Parlour 2025
The Rotten Luck Club is at the Pop-up Parlour!

SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI - SCHOOL HOLIDAY EDITION

Learn how to make kimchi and sauerkraut with locals Kelly and Catherine from Pukerua Bay Fermentation Club. This will be a hands on session!

Event Details

• What - 2 hr workshop
• When - 11am-1pm, 23 September 2025
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay (opposite school)
• Cost - $10 per person and you will head away with jars of beautiful kimchi and sauerkraut to continue the fermentation process at home. Salt, sugar and fish sauce and gochugaru chilli flakes for kimchi and caraway seeds for the sauerkraut will be supplied.

BOOK NOW https://tinyurl.com/4hdapf3b

• What to bring? BYO knife, wooden spoon, chopping board, big mixing pot/bowl and glass jars! If everyone contributes a couple fresh vege/fruit ingredients to share, we will have some options to play with on the day (e.g. Green/red/Savoy/Chinese cabbage - Daikon/Chinese radish - Red chilies - Apple - Mushrooms - Carrot - Beets - Cucumber- Ginger - Onion - Garlic - Garden greens like kale, bok choy, spinach).

• Who - Kids encouraged to join but must be supervised by a caregiver at all times and will need their own ticket.

Other Rotten Luck Fermentation Club events at the Pop-up:

- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Rangatahi & Adults) $10. https://tinyurl.com/7myhk5v9
- Bread-making $10 https://tinyurl.com/yfkderv7

- Cheese-making $10 https://tinyurl.com/5n7twce7

All paid events are helping to fundraise for the Pop-up Parlour.

A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Let us keep close together, not far apart.

description:
The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf, Experience the world through the lens of award-winning photojournalists at The World Press Photo Exhibition at Tākina. This event showcases this year’s best visual journalism, featuring powerful and thought-provoking images from New Zealand and around the world.
Additionally, visitors can view "The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf: The Friends, Influences and Inspirations Exhibition," curated by Simon Woolf.
Photos on display will feature images by Ronald Woolf and Spencer Digby (Te Papa Tongarewa Collection), alongside works by Wellington’s own Simon Woolf, internationally renowned photographer Brian Brake, and legendary sports photographer Peter Bush. The exhibition will also display images by Barry Durrant, former chief photographer of The Dominion, as well as photographs by acclaimed recent talents, including Pulitzer Prize winner Melanie Burford, celebrated international photojournalist Simon Townsley, and esteemed photo historian Graham Stewart.
Don't miss your chance to see Kiwi photographers on show at Tākina.
Epson NZ sponsors the 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf.
Event Details:
• 5 September – 5 October: 10 am – 5 pm
• Tākina Exhibition Space
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Tickets available online or at the door.
Photo: © DAVID UNWIN / The Post.

The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present The Grand Kiki House Of Marama Ball.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.
With a fabulous line-up of categories, judges, commentators, and a DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap, dance, and cheer the night away.
CATEGORIES AND THEMES:
Virgin Vogue – A Marama Storm (Treasure Chest)
Bizarre – Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (Femme Queens, Trans Men, and Butch Queens) – Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance – Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) – Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem – A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (Female Figures, Male Figures, and Gender Non-Conforming) – Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA (Open to All) Best Dressed – Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator – Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance – A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway – The Phases of Marama
House of the Night
JUDGES:
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the House of Miyake-Mugler)
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman
Trailblazing Founding Mother Ella Alexander
Legendary Founding Father Tamatoa Aitu
Founding Fatheir Fang Coven-Aucoin
COMMENTATORS:
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Orijah Marama
DJ:
ATARANGI
BALLROOM COMMUNITY WALKERS & SPECTATORS TICKET ACCESS:
Contact the House of Marama on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code that provides FREE access for Femme Queens who are not walking or competing. Contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball is hosted by the Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama and proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.
This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.

description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays, Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

description:

Lord of the Rings played with the Friends theme tune on repeat?

Music can make or break a blockbuster.

Let's see what happens when we devilishly mess with the soundtrack for an hour featuring some of the world's best visiting improvisers!

Expect awkward silences, melodramatic moments, powerful pauses, and guffaws galore as the music makes everything better (we hope).

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
The Dave Wilson Quintet, Dave Wilson presents his quintet in a special performance of newly arranged material from his two most recent projects: Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation (debuted in 2025), and Ephemeral (Thelonious Records, 2023).  

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like. Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, explores the transience of human relationships with one another and the natural world through alternatively floating and driving improvisatory impulses of Wilson and his ensemble.

The quintet for this performance will present the music of Free, Free and Ephemeral in a brand-new configuration: Wilson on saxophone and bass clarinet, Mana Waiariki on violin, Seth Boy on bass, Callum Allardice on guitar, and Abe Baillie on drums.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money. 
Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...
The Monopoly Man!
Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes).
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.

description:
Brant Bjork Trio - NZ Tour 2025, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers dancers and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington she started this project in 2024 and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency Kiwiburn Earthbeat Cuba Dupa Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines blending soulful tech garage and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love **
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic
https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj

BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol UK Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's producers and musicians in Aotearoa Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival Cuba Dupa Kiwi Burn Little Monsters Insomnia Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub Laughton Kora Pheonix Foundation) Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia Y SorchalulaYoung Gho$t House MD) Cuba Dupa Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne) Cafe Blue (UK) Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Simon Watts, Join us on Thursday 18 September for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Simon Watts, Minister of Climate Change, Minister for Energy, Minister for Local Government and Minister of Revenue.
With local Government decision making in the spotlight as we head into local body elections, there is no better Minister in the Government to hear from than Minister Watts.
Minister Watts is at the forefront of some of New Zealand’s most pressing issues – be it the energy market, water service delivery, or taxation, the decisions Minister Watts heads up are pivotal to New Zealand – and your business.
A recent Cabinet promotion, Minister Watts is seen as a critical cog in the executive Government – a chance to engage with the Minister on the issues that matter to you most is not to be missed.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.
Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes
Can't make it? Click here to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

description:
Behind the Scenes with VicASA: BDO Wellington, 🔥 Behind the Scenes with VicASA x BDO 🔥
Exams are coming - so why host events now?
Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.
Exams test your memory, but these events sharpen your career. While exams last weeks, the connections you’ll make at BDO last a lifetime.
Here’s the truth: top firms don’t just recruit; they provide support, advice, and insider tips to help you thrive as a student and future professional. These events aren’t distractions - they’re an investment in your success.
Therefore the VicASA exec made sure these events (just like the rest) are taking you beyond the lecture halls and giving you exclusive access inside the most influential firms in the accounting world. And yes, it’s all completely free.
Wednesday 24 September – BDO Open Office & LinkedIn Headshots from 2:30pm to 3:30pm! Arrive at 2:15pm to get the full experience!
Join us for an hour long experience to talk one-on-one with the most professional bodies from both the capital and international offices. And of course, 🍴 free food — because good conversations happen best over kai.
✨ What makes this event different from any other?
Most student events stop at surface-level networking. This goes further:
At BDO, you’ll step into an open-office tour led by BDO reps, chat one-on-one with professional buddies, and even get a professional LinkedIn headshot for free by selecting the "BDO - LinkedIn Headshot" option alongside your ticket (first in, first served!) to boost your personal brand.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
First-in, first-served — spaces are extremely limited
Genuine behind-the-scenes exposure you won’t find at standard info sessions
Practical takeaways: real answers, real connections, and a polished LinkedIn profile
💡 These are not your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic inside look at the top firms, preparing you for your next steps in a way that’s practical, personal, and powerful.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Scott Simpson, Join us on Tuesday 7th October for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Scott Simpson, Minister for ACC and Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs.
The newest Minister in the coalition Government, but not a first time Minister – Minister Simpson brings 13+ years of experience in politics to his new roles.
As the Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs, Minister Simpson sits at the heart of some of the most significant economic questions facing the business community and the country - regulation, financial markets and of course, competition, are all areas in the spotlight for which he is responsible for.
From Minister of Statistics to Chief Government Whip, to his current portfolios - Minister Simpson is more than well equipped to bring the insights of the Beehive to Business.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

7:45am- Address

8:30am- Event concludes

description:
Build your Professional Board of Directors, You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.
label: Business & Networking

📍 Where: RHLH1, Rutherford House, Pipitea Campus
The event will run as follows:
5:30–5:40 pm: Opening Remarks
5:40–6:10 pm: MFAT Panel
6:20–6:50 pm: Breakout Session 1 (choice of 3 panels)
7:00–7:30 pm: Breakout Session 2 (choice of 3 panels)
7:30–8:00 pm: Light Catering & Networking 🍕
Following the MFAT panel, the three specialised panels from which students can choose to attend two include: Trade & Commerce, International Development, and Defence & Security.
The following are our confirmed speakers for each panel:
MFAT: James Lester (Senior Policy Officer, Middle East & Africa Division; former WTO posting, Trade Law Adviser), Thandiwe Keet (Niue Desk Officer; previously NZ-UKFTA & IPETCA roles), and Anya Donohue (Deputy Secretary’s Office, Pacific & Development Group).
Trade & Commerce: Ailish Dodd and Brenna Burch (Wellington Chamber of Commerce, International Engagement Officers), Phil Quinn (MBIE, International Trade Negotiator), and Gregor Thompson (Business Desk, Economic Affairs Writer).

Defence & Security: Ministry of Defence representative and Kevin Moar (Director of National Security Policy, DPMC). Additional speakers TBC.

description:
Business Strategy & Growth Planning Interactive Seminar, Are you ready to take your business to the next level?
Join us for an interactive seminar designed to help business owners like you create clear, actionable strategies for growth without the guesswork.

Your Speakers:
Ron Lal – With over 25 years of experience across entrepreneurship, consulting, NGO, governmental, and corporate sectors, Ron has helped business leaders solve complex challenges, discover new customer segments, and achieve 7-figure results through innovative Design Thinking strategies.
Learn more about Ron: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ron-lal-20168041/
Maria Pooley – A business operations and management expert with over 20 years of international experience across eight countries, Maria specialises in identifying business obstacles and delivering practical solutions that drive sustainable success.
Learn more about Maria: https://www.linkedin.com/in/pooleymaria/

In this 3-hour session, you will:
Learn actionable strategies that have worked for other business owners
Discover fresh perspectives to tackle your biggest growth challenges
Connect with like-minded business owners in a supportive environment
Leave with new insights and ideas to implement into your business

What’s included:
Hot beverages and snacks
Free parking
Networking opportunities with fellow business owners

Activities:
Networking & Icebreaker – A chance to connect with like-minded business owners.
Business Session – Ron and Maria share insights and strategies for sustainable growth.
Strategy Insights Session – Gain strategic ideas tailored to your business, learn the difference between strategy and planning, and understand how to identify the right strategy for your goals.
Closing & Networking – Share ideas, ask questions, and connect with potential collaborators.

Normal price: $50

Ready to take your business analysis career to the next level? The CBBA course is Wellington’s practical, industry-recognised certification for anyone serious about growing their BA capability and impact.

The Wellington Calling Open Mic: Daylight Savings Theme!, Wellington's premier event venue Whisky and Wood is hosting its 5th open mic event: Wellington Calling and we're looking for diverse acts to contribute!

Our last event event had 15 performers and we want you to contribute to the next!

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. It's a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 7pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before May 25.

The feature act is Mustang a upcoming three-piece with dreamy harmonies. Their songs are emotional tributes to clarity, light and wonder. Expect to be moved!

Their music can be heard at: https://www.instagram.com/mustang_band24/

Entry is with Koha.

Light food and drinks will be available to purchase.

description:
Chain Maille Workshop, Chain Maille Workshop
Learn the ins and outs of chain maille and create your own piece in this seven class course!

About this Event

Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:Week 01 - 18th September101: Basic Skills and DiscoveryAt this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.Opening & closing rings properlyTrying out some simple structuresBegin exploring material options and how to make your own ringsHomework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th SeptemberPlay and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projectsPlaying with recycled & foraged materialsHomework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd OctoberMathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.Math of designing chain mailleTheory & pre-planningDiscussion about ideas for individual projectsIdentify materials needed to execute individual designsHomework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th OctoberBy this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th OctoberThese classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th NovemberAt this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington
Register Today by contacting Crown Leadership International Group: Website: www.crownleadership.com.au Phone: +64 9 889 7217

About this Event

Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Hataitai community centre Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Centre & Community House, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:30pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 22-24 September 2025, The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.

"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.

We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.

After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient

This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz

Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy

description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne, Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right". What does it mean to make things right? Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges. But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer. Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust. This talk will describe the potential for bioethics to help clarify and navigate ethics dilemmas; pragmatically inching us closer to making things – if not right, then at least – better.

description:
Rongotai Labour Film Evening, For everyone who missed the showing of "Prime Minister' - a film about the extraordinary term of Jacinda Adern's leadership of New Zealand - at the NZIFF, Rongotai Labour is pleased to secure a showing to help to raise funds for the 2026 election campaign.
This film chronicles Jacinda Adern's tenure as Prime Minister and provides an insight into both the political and personal challenges Jacinda faced during those six years. The inclusion of considerable footage from Jacinda's partner Clarke Gayford provides a deeply personal view of life as the Prime Minister in very challenging times.
(Los Angeles Times review) 'Prime Minister' is not interested in wrangling, dealing and lawmaking, or even the nuts and bolts or her progressive views. .. But in the fleet, pacey manner of the editing, toggling between private and public moments with highlight-reel efficiency, the film is a stirring glimpse of top-down kindness as a winning leadership style.

description:
Epigenetics Congress, Sciinov Group is elated to announce the Epigenetics Congress, scheduled as a hybrid event on October 23-24, 2025, in San Francisco, CA, USA.

The Epigenetics Congress 2025 is set to be a transformative international conference, bringing together a distinguished group of researchers, scientists, clinicians, and industry professionals to explore the rapidly evolving field of epigenetics and gene regulation. This prestigious event will serve as a collaborative platform for exchanging innovative ideas, discussing groundbreaking discoveries, and fostering interdisciplinary partnerships that drive scientific advancements and therapeutic innovations.

With a focus on cutting-edge research, emerging technologies, and translational applications, this congress will cover key topics related to epigenetic mechanisms, chromatin dynamics, DNA methylation, histone modifications, non-coding RNAs, and their implications in human health, aging, cancer, metabolic disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, and regenerative medicine. Attendees will gain insights into how epigenetic modifications influence gene expression and disease progression and explore novel therapeutic strategies, biomarker development, and precision medicine approaches based on epigenetic profiling.

You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls

Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers

Anyone considering export as a growth strategy

Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

description:
Yoko-Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA, Yoko-Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA
This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI.

Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.

Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidified his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.

Tickets on-sale 12.00PM Friday 4th July from meownui.com

Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups

Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing

This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.

Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 30 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
AI in Education: Part 1, Sovereign AI in NZ Education is a two part series that invites educators, AI developers, wh`ānau, students, and other interested people to consider how we - in Aotearoa - can design, build, and use AI tools. The goal of these sessions is to spark and support the creation of AI tools and practices that best serve the aspirations of our students and whānau, and blend well with the skills and insights of New Zealand's educators.
Part 1:
Generative AI is already in Aotearoa’s primary classrooms.  It is used by many teachers for planning and by ākonga both in and out of school.  However, policy, training, and culturally safe practice haven’t always kept pace.
In this talk, David Coblentz will provide research-based insights into:
teacher adoption patterns,
what students say they’re doing (and worrying about), and
where schools are missing guidance.
We'll also discuss what AI sovereignty could mean in education in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Then we can close with some practical steps for boards, leaders, kaiako, and whānau to support constructive and equitable AI use in Years 5–8.
*While the formal (and online) event will finish at 5pm, those attending in person are encouraged to stay on for snacks and drinks to share. Stay till 6pm or later, and get into the ideas more deeply, in a room full of good people.
David Coblentz is a Senior Statistician at NZCER. In addition to an undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Physics, David holds advanced degrees in Biostatistics (MS), History (PhD), and International Studies (MA) from the University of Washington in Seattle. Prior to coming to NZCER and transitioning into an educational research career in 2021, David worked as a biostatistician, data analytics director, and statistical consultant. David also has university teaching experience in history. His areas of interest include data analysis and data science, history education, evaluation, and AI in education.
Part 2 will follow within two weeks of David Coblentz's presentation. It will be an online event that features two or three local AI in education developers, talking about their current development projects.
We intend to record both parts and make them available via our community site - https://community.sovereignai.nz/
label: Education & Learning

description:
Resilient Leadership, Resilient Leadership
Wellington Chamber of Commerce and JacksonStone & Partners present: Future Fluent: Navigate What’s Next – A New Series

About this Event

Resilient Leadership
Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
Leadership shouldn’t come at the cost of your wellbeing. Yet too often, high performance is confused with running on empty.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll cut through the clichés and have a real conversation about resilience, balance, and what it takes to sustain yourself - and your team - over the long haul. Walk away with practical strategies to embed wellbeing into daily work, recharge team culture, and lead in a way that keeps your spark alive.
Because the best leaders don’t just survive pressure - they model how to thrive through it.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who’s the speaker?
Jude West, Team & Clinical Lead from EAP Services/Habit Health

What’s in-store:
11:00am – Arrival/networking
11:30am-12:15pm – Speaker session

description:
Resilient Leadership, Resilient Leadership
Wellington Chamber of Commerce and JacksonStone & Partners present: Future Fluent: Navigate What’s Next – A New Series

About this Event

Resilient Leadership
Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
Leadership shouldn’t come at the cost of your wellbeing. Yet too often, high performance is confused with running on empty.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll cut through the clichés and have a real conversation about resilience, balance, and what it takes to sustain yourself - and your team - over the long haul. Walk away with practical strategies to embed wellbeing into daily work, recharge team culture, and lead in a way that keeps your spark alive.
Because the best leaders don’t just survive pressure - they model how to thrive through it.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who’s the speaker?
Jude West, Team & Clinical Lead from EAP Services/Habit Health

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

description:
Smart Property, Smarter Retirement, Are you between 30 and 55 years old?
Do you have a clear plan for a financially comfortable retirement?

At our free property investment seminar, you’ll discover how smart strategies can help you:
* Build reliable income streams
* Protect your financial future with debt reduction
* Live comfortably in retirement from long term rental income

Bonus for Attendees
You’ll be entitled to book a FREE one-on-one consultation with our licensed financial advisers and if qualified, a full financial plan (valued $995 - $1999). This starts with a discovery session to understand your financial situation and goals. From there, our property team can assess the best available property options and present those that align perfectly with your objectives.

Seats are limited — don’t miss this opportunity.

Our Speakers

Lara Maloney
Director of MyFutureNZ Ltd and a Qualified Financial Adviser, Lara has an MBA (First Class Honours) specialising in Finance and Marketing. She has completed her NZ Certificate in Financial Planning (Level 5) and is authorised by the Financial Markets Authority to provide financial advice and investment planning services. Lara is committed to shifting the paradigm around the traditional 30-year mortgage and helping others create personal wealth.
FSP 529864

Campbell Venning
An esteemed residential investment specialist, Campbell brings an impressive three decades of extensive property knowledge. He has led a property-education franchise network, an investor-focused property development company, and a technology start-up offering specialised investor tools. Campbell's passion for real estate motivates him to assist others to build wealth through property and secure a strong income into retirement.
Licensed REAA 2008

description:
Strengths & Superpowers, Strengths & Superpowers
Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest.
Welcome to the second conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
This conversation is led by two experts who are empowering other women, and will focus on an often-overlooked asset: personal branding. Whether your sights are set on a project or a promotion, this powerful tool can put you on the radar for the opportunities you want.
Why be part of this conversation?
When you control your narrative, you can ensure that it's accurate, compelling, and unique. Join our interactive session to uncover and learn how to convey the unique value you bring to the table. It isn't about crafting a fake persona, it's about making sure your superpowers get noticed.
You’ll get expert insights into:
Strengths: Understand and use your strengths for impact.
Superpower: Take control of what you want to be known for.
Story: Quick ways to naturally share your value.
Who’s the speaker?
Natalie Ferguson & Kristen Luman are the founders of Powrsuit - a career accelerator for every woman that takes professional development out of to-do lists and into weekly routines. With over 700 members across NZ, Australia, North America and Singapore, Powrsuit's research-backed approach delivers a tangible return on investment. After six months, 82% of members increase self-leadership skills, and 28% take a tangible step forward in their careers.
This interactive workshop is a must-attend for anyone who wants to maximise their visibility and value, regardless of job title.
**All attendees will go into the draw to win a annual Powrsuit membership**
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Powrsuit mini-masterclass
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
18 September: Impactful Leadership - What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.

Drinks: FRIST DRINK IS INCLUDED IN THE TICKET PRICE

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

description:
Friday Laughs with Itay Dom and El Jaguar, Friday Laughs is a comedy showcase featuring top local and national comedians at the capital's favourite comedy venue

Featuring headline act - El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

With MC Itay Dom
As seen on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and The Bachelorette New Zealand, brings his signature mix of laidback crowd work and observational comedy to the stage.
Itay has cemented his reputation as one of New Zealand’s brightest comedic talents. In 2024, he won the Breakthrough Act award at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards, following his 2023 win for Best MC. His sharp humor and quick wit have delighted audiences across the country, from opening for top acts like Joe Daymond and Ray O’Leary to his appearances on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and writing for 7 Days.
“Feeds off the energy of the crowd with quick wits” - The Post

Brent McGuinness
Jenice Goveas
Jundas Capone

description:
The Inevitabilism Panel, We're told AI is Progress, progress that cannot be stopped, that it will change the way we work and live, from business to education and the commons. But who says? Whose progress and whose AI is it anyway? Is societal progress really bound to technological innovation, or are there other ways of reading - and even shaping - positive social change?
Technological Determinism is described as the belief system that social progress is driven by technological innovation, which in turn follows an "inevitable" course." This panel will take a good hard look at this 'inevitabilism' - its forces and politics - with a view to our shared future in Aotearoa and the Pacific.
Join us for a rigorous evening of discussion with a view to how we might gain more understanding - and more say - as to the reach and influence new technologies have over our autonomy, dignity, communities and cultures.

description:
Improv On a Plate - a Comedy Show, Welcome to Improv on a Plate, the comedy tasting menu no one ordered and everyone regrets. In this unholy fusion of high-stakes improv and low-stakes judgment, three deranged guest chefs (aka format-pitchers) take the stage with one mission: serve up the most unhinged, impossible improv formats they can dream of.

Enter: Catfish Trifecta — your unsuspecting improv victims — who must swallow each cursed format whole and perform it on the spot. No script. No escape. Just raw, unfiltered chaos served à la mode.

The pitchers then get to sit back, relax, and judge the madness they’ve unleashed. It’s improv. It’s pain. It’s Improv on a Plate.

One night only. No refunds. BYO palate cleanser.
