description:
The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 18th & 19th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation

Well-known journalist and presenter Mike McRoberts opens up about his experiences of reconnection to te ao Maori and learning te reo, and encourages others to do the same.
In Speaking My Language / Te Korero i Toku Reo Mike shares his story of that journey to speak te reo Maori and reclaim his identity. His book is an invitation for all New Zealanders to take the first step to understand why speaking our Maori language and treasuring our culture matters.

description:
The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.
Ticket Options:
Masterclass Only – $299 NZD
Masterclass + WRD Deck – $529 NZD (Deck provided on the day at in-person events.)
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break.
Date and time
29th October 2025
9:00 AM – 12:30 PM NZST
Location
Willeston Conference Centre
Level 11  
15 Willeston Street
Call Active House
Wellington 6011
New Zealand 
View Map
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately we do not offer refunds for this workshop.
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify the host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop and have purchased a deck we will send that to you along with the digital toolkit.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
WaiHost - Outstanding Customer Experience, Identify key moments in the customer experience, and provide Service Excellence to each and every customer.
This workshop covers a wide range of core customer service skills that will equip your staff with the expertise and techniques required to provide superior customer service every time.   
Every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not.  Together we will look at all types of customers and how we can serve them better and improve ourselves in the process.  
State what customer service means in relation to all your customers.
Recognise how your attitude affects customer service.
Identify your customers’ needs.
Create a great first impression
Use active listening skills
Use outstanding customer service to generate return business.
Build good will through in-person customer service.
Handle customer issues, complaints and concerns.
The WaiHost Outstanding Customer Experience workshop is the only customer service training course on the market that is based on 8 years of research & data looking into what Kiwi consumers expect from companies they do business with.

COST: Members* $99+GST pp Non-Members $385 +GST pp

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Island Bay Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.
label: Festivals

description:
Wellington - Empower Her Networking - Powerful Email Marketing, WELLINGTON - The Arborist, Private Function Room
Monthly Topic: Powerful Email Marketing
Hosted by: Tabitha Arthur
This month, we’re diving into Powerful Email Marketing, because your inbox might be the most underestimated goldmine in your business. Whether you’re building community, driving sales, or nurturing long-term clients, email marketing allows you to connect on a deeper level (without having to battle the unpredictable social media algorithm).
In September, we’ll be sharing ideas, swapping tips, and uncovering what makes a newsletter not just opened but loved. From juicy subject lines to irresistible calls-to-action, get ready to rethink the power of your email list.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.

Join the Inner Circle now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.

Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Women in finance lunch, with speaker Christina Leung, CFA, Welcome to the Women in Finance Lunch event! Join us for an inspiring talk by Christina Leung, CFA at Forsyth Barr. This in-person event will bring together women in the finance industry to network, learn, and empower each other. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from a successful professional and connect with like-minded individuals. Reserve your spot now!
We're pleased to invite our members and CFA candidates to another Women in Finance lunch, this time with guest speaker; CFA charterholder, Christina Leung, CFA, Deputy Chief Executive & Principal Economist, NZIER
About our presenter
Christina Leung, CFA is Vice Chair of the CFA Society New Zealand and Deputy Chief Executive (Auckland) and Principal Economist at the NZ Institute of Economic Research (NZIER), where she looks after economic forecasts and analysis of the Quarterly Survey of Business Opinion. Christina also works with many clients looking at topical issues, including the wider economic impact of particular industries and investments. She previously worked at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and ASB. Christina holds a Bachelor of Commerce with first class honours in Economics.
Christina will talk about her career journey and share her experiences of being a woman in the world of economics and finance.
Bring a friend
We invite members and candidates to bring along a colleague, please register for catering purposes.
Men are very welcome too!
As with previous events, we understand you're busy. It's okay to arrive late, or leave early, we'd just like to see you.
Many thanks to Forsyth Barr for hosting this event.

description:
Ring Making Workshop in Wellington, Limited Spaces! One Date Only – Book Now!
Monday, 3 November
Create a unique piece of jewellery using wax and set with gemstones. After the session, each participant's wax piece will be cast in silver, meticulously filed, polished, and mailed to them in a gift box.
In this single-session workshop, you'll be introduced to the lost wax casting process and be guided by a certified jewellery maker in creating a custom-designed ring from wax.
WORKSHOP HIGHLIGHTS:
Creative Experience: Design and create your own sterling silver jewellery with cast-in-place gemstones.
Expert Guidance: Learn from a certified jewellery maker in a supportive and inspiring environment.
All-Inclusive: The workshop provides all the necessary tools and materials, ensuring a seamless experience.
Finished Product: Receive a beautifully handcrafted piece of jewellery, creating lasting memories and a unique keepsake.
WHO SHOULD ATTEND:
Hobbyists and craft enthusiasts
Individuals seeking unique, handmade jewellery
Couples, friends, or mothers & daughters looking for a creative bonding activity
Anyone searching for a unique and thoughtful gift
WHAT TO EXPECT:
Guidance on creating a simple wax band
Stone setting in wax using mixed gemstones
Support in creating a personalised design with stones
INCLUDES IN THE WORKSHOP:
Use of all necessary tools
A selection of gemstones (precious stones available for an extra fee)
Wax for creating jewellery pieces
Sterling silver (up to 15 grams per piece)
Option to order your piece in gold (for an extra fee)
Casting, filing, and polishing of your wax piece
Final product mailed to your provided address
ADDITIONAL INFO:
If you have a specific design or material in mind (perhaps a diamond for an engagement ring?) and would like to discuss it beforehand, please email craftyfingersworkshop@yahoo.com.
Join us for a unique and unforgettable jewellery-making experience. Create a piece of jewellery that reflects your personal style and creativity!
Please bring your glasses to see the small details well, or an additional light (headlamp).
PLEASE NOTE: We reserve the right to cancel or postpone the workshop if the minimum number of attendees is not met.

description:
Xero Basics + Workshop, Xero Basics + Workshop
👉 #XeroBasics+ Workshop - Blenheim - Tuesday 09 September, 9am to 11.30am - Rangitane House, Level 4

Refreshments included.

📣 Want to navigate Xero like a pro and save valuable time?
📣 Looking to gain the confidence to manage your accounts with ease?

This is a Xero basics course with an edge. This course is suitable for beginners through to current users of Xero who want to learn how to use Xero properly – you don’t know, what you don’t know.

Gain a basic+ knowledge and learn how to use Xero efficiently. This course will set you up with a strong understanding and practical knowledge of Xero to advance your business. We will also offer you extra hints and tips on Xero features and best practices for bookkeeping that other beginner Xero courses may miss out.

Ideal for small business owners who manage their own bookkeeping or to empower your staff by offering hands-on training. Perfect if you have a new accounts person starting or a current staff member that would benefit from a refresher course.

YOU WILL LEARN:
- Dashboard Overview
- Banking Essentials
- Sales Management

description:
123 of Painting, In this introduction to painting, tutor Melissa McDougall, will start the class on a journey through the basic elements of painting in acrylic and oil paint. This class is structured for students new to painting as well as returning students from prior 123 of Painting classes or the like.

The class is structured around a series of exercises that explore the foundations of still-life and portrait painting. New students will be informally assessed in order to create a programme that best meets their needs.

With an emphasis on simple beginnings, the lessons will include colour theory, skin tones, structure and composition.

Teaching is done by analysing and copying master paintings in order to improve observational skills while learning the components of structure and composition.

Class is suitable for all levels of experience; we start from where you are. Melissa focuses on a personalised approach for the student with an emphasis on finding that person’s passion in art.

All basic materials provided.

Monday evenings, 13 Oct - 8 Dec (no class on Labour Day, 27 Oct), 6:30-8:30 pm.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go behind the scenes, Join us for a unique full day experience immersing yourself in the viticulture, wine making and wines of Te Muna valley. This spectacular valley lies nine kilometres east of Martinborough. Visit the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste the wines where they are made.

We will pick you up from the Martinborough Square at 9.30 am to start your day at Big Sky Wines. Founders, viticulturists, and winemakers Katherine Jacobs and Jeremy Corban will give you a first look at their 2025 ferments, which have been produced from their organic vineyard. We will then take you to tour Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove and enjoy a long lunch, accompanied by a glass of wine of course. From there we will take you to the stunning winery at Escarpment, and then to explore the beautiful terraced Craggy Range vineyard and taste their wines among the vines, both of which are not normally open to the public. We will finish the day with some of the other Te Muna producers joining us to share their wines and their stories. It will be a day of discovery - the place, the people and the wines of the beautiful Te Muna Valley.

Tickets are strictly limited to 18 people.

description:
Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston, Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston
In 2025, thanks to our generous funder Mercury, the course is FREE to Manawatu students aged 14 to 18.

The In-House Vocal Coach and Bookings Agent at BigMouth Voices, excels in Demo Reel Production, Audition Management, and provides comprehensive Accent and Voice Coaching for the agency's talents. Tessa is the newest tutor addition to 'The Voice Academy', and prior to this she has developed online courses focused on Vocal Stamina, Projection and Health. With a rich professional background spanning roles as a speech pathologist, vocal coach, voice-over artist, actress, podcaster, and content creator, Tessa brings a wealth of expertise to her multifaceted career. She is the creator of ‘The Good Talkers Podcast’, an entertaining and educational podcast dedicated to the lives of voice over artists. Her commitment to excellence underscores her reputation as a dynamic professional in the realm of voice and performance arts.

Learn how to use your voice to its full potential and spend the afternoon in the recording studio recording a piece for a show reel. Fun character voices, accents and using your voice to its fullest with confidence!

description:
Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston, Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston
In 2025, thanks to our generous funder Mercury, the course is FREE to Manawatu students aged 14 to 18.

The In-House Vocal Coach and Bookings Agent at BigMouth Voices, excels in Demo Reel Production, Audition Management, and provides comprehensive Accent and Voice Coaching for the agency's talents. Tessa is the newest tutor addition to 'The Voice Academy', and prior to this she has developed online courses focused on Vocal Stamina, Projection and Health. With a rich professional background spanning roles as a speech pathologist, vocal coach, voice-over artist, actress, podcaster, and content creator, Tessa brings a wealth of expertise to her multifaceted career. She is the creator of ‘The Good Talkers Podcast’, an entertaining and educational podcast dedicated to the lives of voice over artists. Her commitment to excellence underscores her reputation as a dynamic professional in the realm of voice and performance arts.

Learn how to use your voice to its full potential and spend the afternoon in the recording studio recording a piece for a show reel. Fun character voices, accents and using your voice to its fullest with confidence!

Argentine Tango course -Monday in Wellington, New Argentine Tango course in Churton Park, Wellington.
Term four 2025 starts: 22nd September to 27th October 2025
*Must register before 18th September*
Back from Buenos Aires!
with intensive training from the best of the best!
Denise & Alex White with over 25 years teaching experience!
Course bookings essential as numbers are limited.
Held at George's Garage Milonga Studio, 25 Silverbirch grove, Churton Park, Wellington.
(parking is available down driveway, on-site next to the studio)
7:30pm to 8.30pm Open to all Levels
* Beginners to Advanced Argentine Tango
fees:
Casual/per class $20. (Provided not fully booked)
6-week course $110
Argentine Tango:
Courses mainly focus on Argentine Tango. Other Tango dance styles Milonga and Vals (aka tango waltz) are also taught, with a mix of traditional with modern styles of Tango music - no screechy ones!
A suitable foundation for both social dancing and performance/stage tango dancing developed more as you advance to be a versatile dancer able to dance each style with ease.
Other useful info:
Please wear clean socks or suitable smooth soled shoes with good ankle support. highly recommend a drink bottle as well.
This course has a minimum number to go ahead, also a maximum number of students to ensure quality of teaching. Bookings are essential.

description:
Storytelling On Stage, Do you love storytelling shows like The Moth? Come join the growing art of live storytelling. Learn how to find ideas from your life, craft a compelling narrative, and deliver your story in a confident and entertaining way.

Description
Live storytelling is an artform unto itself, requiring different skills and techniques from standup comedy or prose writing. In this four-part workshop, you’ll learn:

- Creative writing exercises and daily practices to to find meaningful stories from your life
- Tools for crafting a compelling personal narrative
- Techniques to build suspense, drama, and humour into your stories
- Stagecraft and performance skills to heighten and polish your delivery

By the end of the class you'll have
- One or more polished 5-10 minute stories to showcase on stage
- Dozens of ideas to expand upon for future stories
- Writing practices to improve your life as a creative
- Less stage fright and more confidence as a speaker

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Balfolk Class - Newtown, Balfolk Class - Newtown
Balfolk is a folk dance and music movement from Europe that gives new life to traditional dances. A ‘Bal Folk’ is a social dance event that brings people of all ages and walks of life together through group and partner dances to have fun and connect. It's a friendly, social and energising space.

The class will run over 6 weeks. We will learn and practice different group and partner dances you would commonly find in a Bal Folk.
Dances are simple and easy to learn but also have depth so once you have learnt the basics, we can explore and play around with variations.
Balfolk is accessible to people with all skill levels. You don’t need any previous dance experience, curiosity is all you need 😊

When: Wednesdays from 6:00 to 7:30pm

Location: Newtown Community Centre

Price: $60 for the block of 6 classes
$15/class for casual attendance
Students/concession/unwaged: koha

description:
Beginner's Knitting Class - Hataitai Community House, Beginner's Knitting Class - Hataitai Community House
Thank you for your interest in attending the 6-week Beginner's Knitting Class being run at Hataitai Community Centre.

In the workshop you will learn the basics of the craft of knitting.

Your facilitator will be Stella Peg Carruthers, a textile craft artist and eco-lifestylist who sees crafts as being a way to affect positive change in the world as a creative gesture against apathy.

Her practice is centered around sustainable materials re-use and slow creativity processes.

She is also interested in creating supportive community workshops that mirror the history of sewing in social spaces.

DATES: 27 September - 1 November 2025
TIME: Saturdays 2-4pm
PLACE: Hataitai Community House, 112 Waipapa Road, Hataitai

Basic materials will be provided including an initial pair of knitting needles and a ball of yarn to practice with. More detail about what to bring will come in an email closer to the date of the first workshop.

PLEASE NOTE: ALL ATTENDEES NEED TO REGISTER AND PAY USING THE GOOGLE FORM LINK BELOW:
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Biochar Big Day Out 2025, Char curious? Keen gardener? Orchardist? Lifestyler? Climate Champion? BBQ enthusiast? 
Come one, come all to this one-off opportunity to spend a day making biochar in a magical orchard, forest and garden. Thank you Kapiti Coast District Council (KCDC) and Paekākāriki Orchards and Gardens (POG) for sponsoring this event so we can offer subsidised tickets as part of Sustainable Spring!
You will:

Morning sessions (9.30-12)...
Sipping coffee and learning the basics of Biochar. 
Getting hands-on exploring the property and learning to source good burn material (stuff you can find in your own backyard or lifestyle block).
Building a char toilet - great skills for civil defence emergencies, or just camping!
Ignite the Char-B-Que and BIG 600l kiln, learn how to feed the flames and trap the carbon.
Cooking using char!
At lunchtime (12-1)...
Enjoy a BBQ lunch cooked on the Char-B-Que. 
Learn all about the magic of biochar and how to use it to fight climate change, feed your garden. 
After lunch sessions (1-3)...
Quenching (pour cold water on) a kiln and processing char by drying and crushing it.
Making a home fireplace mini kiln using a biscuit tin (please bring a tin if you have one or koha for some extra we will source and bring from op shops).
Making a char water filter.
At the end of the day (3 pm)
Grab some biochar to take home (BYO container e.g. ice-cream tub or a small bucket
The big kiln will be quenched later in the day (around 4pm). For those keen to level up their learning on the kind of kilns used for large lifestyle blocks and small farms you are welcome to stay on and participate in a small advanced group dicussion and actvities between 3 and 4.30pm. 
Important things to note: 
Sustainability: 
We encourage carpooling to the event. Please bring your own reusable cup for hot drinks
Health and Safety:
 Please note there will be tree nuts and hazards onsite such as hot kilns and flames. So please take the necessary precautions by wearing non-flammable (cotton, wool, natural) materials and bring any personal medication that you need. We will have a health and safety volunteer onsite.

Family Friendly:
 It is a family-friendly event (kids under 18 are free) but they must be supervised by their parent or guardian at all times due to the hazards on site. 
Workshop Leaders 
John Wraight - CharPae 
Our CharPae Operations manager and ‘inhouse’ Biochar subject matter expert John Wraight has been making and using Biochar for many years and has delivered a number of successful workshops using these kilns. He is a BioChar Network member. He leads local CharPae burns, Char-B-Ques and kiln hire.
Holly Norton - CharPae 
Our CharPae Project manager has been making and using Biochar for the past 2 years. She co-leads these workshops and has additionally been exploring char use in sustainable construction and civil defence. She is currently on a mission to use Biochar to transform a tennis court into a thriving kai production space. She is this event's coordinator should you have any questions.

description:
Being Tangata Tiriti: a Pākehā Project Taster #2—Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Being Tangata Tiriti: a Pākehā Project Taster
A one-day workshop exploring the beautiful restorative work of being tangata Tiriti in Aotearoa.
Who can we be for each other?
———————
We live in discombobulating times. And cracks are showing everywhere. So much that we thought was secure is shifting and changing. 
But here in Aotearoa, we have an extraordinary pou—Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
Come along for a day of depth; exploring the amazing potential that the relational space of Te Tiriti has for us all. This one is for tangata Tiriti who are deeply committed to an ethic of restoration in Aotearoa and want to go beyond an intellectual understanding.
Join Rebecca and Mel from The Pākehā Project for this one-day workshop exploring the mahi we as tangata Tiriti can do in the journey towards a Tiriti-led future. Using practices of Haumanu, a healing-centred approach to systems change, we’ll be inquiring into our own roles in reweaving the relational fabric that Te Tiriti o Waitangi offered to all people in Aotearoa, but that did not happen at the time.
We invite you into a space for gently inquiring into your unique place in the system rewiring itself. How do we show up where Māori are calling us to be? We'll be exploring relationality and worldview; the nervous system as map for working with activation; systemic racism, the orthodox Western worldview—its whakapapa and how it shows up in ourselves, our systems and society; and our roles in restorative systems change for a Tiriti-based future. It will be interactive, embodied, and nourishing.
Let's create islands of coherence in this turbulent world.
We'll host you upstairs at Vogelmorn Bowling Club, in the beautiful hills of Brooklyn, Te Whanganui-a-Tara. There'll be delicious kai, and a chance to resource yourself, in communion with others. We are so looking forward to welcoming you.
—————————————————————————
About the facilitators
Rebecca Sinclair (Pākehā—Scottish, English)
Rebecca is a facilitator, coach, and complex systems geek - helping her fellow Pākehā come back into the flow of life, and let go of colonial patterns that separate us from ourselves, each other, and te taiao. She is fascinated by the intangible, the improper and the in-between and how everything is always so much more extraordinary than we might think. She is an experienced tertiary educator, Co-founder of The Pākehā Project, Haumanu coach with Centre for Social Impact, a certified Warm Data Lab Host with the International Bateson Institute, and Honorary Research Fellow at Toi Rauwhārangi, College of Creative Arts, Massey University.
Mel Hare (Pākehā— Irish)
Mel is a highly experienced facilitator, consultant and leadership coach. Trained through Sydney-based IECL, Mel is an alum of the Pākehā Project Leadership Journey and a Haumanu coach, and weaves this critical perspective into her practice. She is deeply committed to restorative and relational ways of working and being. Mel was born in Sydney Australia, and her ancestors immigrated from Ireland. She acknowledges the Gadigal people of the Eora Nation, the traditional custodians of the land on which she grew up. Now her heart is in Aotearoa, where she lives in Wellington with her family.
Workshop prices
We are offering choice around what you pay for this workshop. 
Consider Option A ($250 + GST), if you:
own the home you live in
have investments or a retirement account
travel recreationally
have access to resources in times of need
work part time by choice
have a relatively high degree of earning power due to level of education (or gender and racial privilege, class background, etc.) Even if you are not currently exercising your earning power, we ask you to recognise this as a choice.
Consider Option B ($400 + GST), if you:
can access professional development budgets from your workplace or organisation for this workshop
are in a position to ‘pay it forward’ to cover the cost of those who are paying what they can
Consider Option C (pay what you can),  if you:
have significant personal levels of debt
are an elder with limited financial support
are an unpaid community organizer
are out of work, a student or otherwise limited financially.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton, GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton
General Kala - Described as "Ultravox meets Kate Bush"
Founded in 2013, Wellington-based General Kala's first live performance was two years later, by which time they had a 90-minute set of original, synthesiser-driven music. The original lineup of Cusiel (vocal and synth), Spence (synths and vocal) and Mathiassen (drums) is still in place for 2025, with six EPs to be released this April and May (plus another six by 2026) through Pulse Science Recordings.
Taking their lead from classic analog-synth acts of the late 1970s and early '80s, as well as progressive and rock luminaries of both decades, Kala infuses visceral, soaring, melodic dance composition with vintage synthesis and syncopated rhythm
Now based in Auckland, the band will bring their singular sound to Le Cafe in Picton.
https://www.generalkala.com/
https://generalkala.bandcamp.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Musicality Workshop Series Part II – Understanding the Music, Come to this workshop and look at the relationship between the dance and the music. Find out what makes the different dance types unique and how the music contributes to these distinctions.
The workshop will also look at how musicians think and how dancers can better relate to the music through this thinking. Simply put, come and learn the language of "Musician"!
Date: Saturday, 13 September 2025
Time: 2:30-5:30pm
Cost: $40
Location: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
Afternoon tea included
This workshop is the second of our four-part series in Musicality. The other workshops cover musical appreciation, engaging the music, and finally embodying the music. While all parts build on the learning of the other parts of the series, they also stand alone. The first part is not a prerequisite for attending this course.
Partners not required although always most very welcome.

description:
CHEERS DAD!, Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew.
This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).
Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.
If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!
You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!
Ticket price includes:




Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating


One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)


All the materials needed


Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever


1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

description:
Breaker bay Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
The Challenges of Peacebuilding, In this conversation, Dr David Harland will reflect on his experience working as a mediator and negotiator in conflict zones and his role as Director of the Geneva-based Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue. The Centre was awarded the Carnegie Wateler Peace Prize in 2022 “for its track record of finding the means, including mediation, to bring parties together and end conflicts”. Its work has included involvement in Aceh and Mindanao, assisting with the disbanding of the Basque separatist group ETA, and the Black Sea Grain Initiative. David will share insights on the challenges of peacebuilding in an era of growing competition and contestation.
Dr David Harland is a former New Zealand diplomat and Executive Director of the Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD), a Geneva-based foundation that specialises in the mediation of armed conflict. He previously worked for the United Nations, including in Bosnia, Kosovo, Haiti and Timor Leste, and he wrote the UN Secretary-General’s landmark report on the fall of Srebrenica. David serves on the UN Secretary-General’s high-level advisory board on mediation. He has degrees from Harvard University, Tufts University, Beijing University and Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington.
The event will be followed by light refreshments.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Chain Maille Workshop, Chain Maille Workshop
Learn the ins and outs of chain maille and create your own piece in this seven class course!

About this Event

Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:Week 01 - 18th September101: Basic Skills and DiscoveryAt this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.Opening & closing rings properlyTrying out some simple structuresBegin exploring material options and how to make your own ringsHomework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th SeptemberPlay and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projectsPlaying with recycled & foraged materialsHomework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd OctoberMathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.Math of designing chain mailleTheory & pre-planningDiscussion about ideas for individual projectsIdentify materials needed to execute individual designsHomework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th OctoberBy this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th OctoberThese classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th NovemberAt this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Chain Maille Workshop, Chain Maille Workshop
Learn the ins and outs of chain maille and create your own piece in this seven class course!

About this Event

Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:Week 01 - 18th September101: Basic Skills and DiscoveryAt this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.Opening & closing rings properlyTrying out some simple structuresBegin exploring material options and how to make your own ringsHomework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th SeptemberPlay and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projectsPlaying with recycled & foraged materialsHomework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd OctoberMathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.Math of designing chain mailleTheory & pre-planningDiscussion about ideas for individual projectsIdentify materials needed to execute individual designsHomework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th OctoberBy this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th OctoberThese classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th NovemberAt this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Wairarapa Youth Orchestra: Around The World With Music, Get ready for a global classical musical journey as the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra presents their special concert, “Around the World with Music”!
The vibrant sounds of violins, flutes, cellos, trombones, and more will fill the Wairarapa Events Centre, Carterton as our young musicians from across the Wairarapa share their hard work. These talented tamariki and rangatahi are now ready to take you on an unforgettable adventure through sound.

Under the expert guidance of conductor Andrew Atkins and our dedicated tutors, the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra has been diligently preparing a diverse program that celebrates music from various continents. Prepare to be captivated by everything from the rhythmic pulse of African drums to the sweeping melodies of European symphonies, including the grandeur and pomp of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, and evocative folk tunes echoing the sounds of Asia. It’s a unique opportunity to experience a rich tapestry of sounds, all brought to life by the passion and talent of our local youth.

This inspiring event is more than just a performance; it’s a vital fundraiser. The Wairarapa Youth Orchestra offers free orchestral music learning to young people throughout the Wairarapa, and we rely entirely on fundraising and donations to keep this invaluable program thriving. Your attendance directly supports the continued musical education of our community’s youth.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day, The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day
We’re super excited to be collaborating with the lovely Radha Iveta from Heart Awakening. Plus - there will be an amazing plant based dinner included in your ticket!
This will be insightful, down-to-earth and inspiring.
It’s the art of aligning with the natural rhythms. And see how your wellness takes shape with just a few simple adjustments. It’s the small things that compound to develop your wellbeing!
This workshop is an introduction to Dinacharya, the Ayurvedic practice of daily self-care routines that harmonise mind, body, and spirit.
In the workshop, we will cover:
Understanding Dinacharya: What it is and its importance in Ayurveda.
Morning Routine: Simple, effective practices to start your day with balance.
Evening Routine: Techniques to wind down and promote restful sleep.
Eating & Digestion: Ayurvedic recommendations for meal timing and digestion.
Self-Care Practices: How to incorporate oil pulling, tongue scraping, and more into your day.
Seasonal Adjustments: How to tweak your routine according to the seasons.


Meet Radha, your host
Radha Iveta is a meditation and yoga practitioner, certified teacher, Ayurveda practitioner and therapist, cacao lover, and the founder of Heart Awakening and True Nature Ayurveda. Her work was born out of a profound love for these teachings and her desire to invite others on a journey toward more meaning and fulfilment, guided by the direct experience and knowledge that Love is our true nature.
Her heart is invested in helping people reconnect to their hearts and reveal their true nature by bringing sacredness and simplicity into all aspects of life.

description:
Cheers Dad! Pottery, Paint & a Pint!, We're excited to bring you a Father's Day pottery painting event in collaboration with the finest brewery on the coast, Duncan's!

Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew. This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).

Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.

If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!

You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!

All materials supplied. 
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!

Ticket price includes:
Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating 
One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)
All the materials needed
Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever
1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

Please note: Your piece will be carefully taken back to my studio and glazed with a clear glaze, this will not only make it look profesh but will make it safe to use everyday.  You can then collect your finished piece from Duncan's the following Friday (05.09)

Disclaimer:

I will take every care with your finished piece but I can not be held responsible for cracks or glaze issues once fired...I'm afraid we put our trust in the kiln gods.

description:
Colourful Torch-Fired Enamels - Taster, This exciting 3-hour class uses the transparent Enamel technique to focus on beautiful enamels on copper and silver. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work!

Create a simple yet beautifully textured pendant or earrings in metal, and learn how to add a pop of colour to your piece!

Beginners to metalwork can use pre-formed shapes, so they can focus on creating bright funky patterns. Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced textured piece.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany any person under the age of 16.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight, When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

description:
Drawing And Painting For Beginners, Explore a range of painting and drawing techniques from ink and watercolor to impasto and realism using acrylic paint. Each week we will explore a different medium and subject to expand your knowledge, and confidence in your own artistic ability.

Bring along your own sketchbook (A4 or larger) All other course materials will be provided.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Use a variety of painting and brush techniques in your own work
Understand how light moves around an object
Blend and shade using wet and dry media
Mix and apply colour to your painting and drawings
Further develop your own painting and drawing style

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Draw it Out - Re-finding Your Spark, Guided drawings to re-find your spark and what it is that's driving you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making. Materials supplied.

description:
ESC September Asian Artist meetup, The Eastern Sound Collective is a growing community of creatives with pan-Asian roots, coming together to connect, collaborate, and support each other.
We’d love for you to join us for our next gathering on Thursday, September 4th at 6.30PM!
The evening will kick off with a workshop on Building Sustainable Art Practices with Jem Yoshioka:
About Jem:
Jem Yoshioka is an illustrator, writer and comic artist based in Pōneke, Wellington. Jem's debut graphic novel Folk Remedy Book 1 releases in September 2025, and she's busy working on Book 2. When not making comics you can find Jem dreaming up more story ideas and hanging out with her black cat. You can find her on social media @jemyoshioka most places (Instagram, BlueSky, TikTok, X)
Building Sustainable Art Practices:
In 2025 it feels like it's challenging enough to survive as a person, let alone thrive as an artist. But art has the unique power to nourish us in ways nothing else can. In this workshop Jem will share some of the strategies, habits and tools she uses to fit in making graphic novels alongside full time employment without burning out. This session is practice-agnostic, and is designed to facilitate discussion about what a sustainable art practice can look like, how to build one, and how we can support each other when things are tough. No resources required but feel free to bring any notebooks or tools you use to manage your art or your time

After that, we’ll share some kai (potluck style), have a relaxed kōrero
The gathering will be held at a cozy private space in Wellington CBD, easily accessible by public transport.
Message us for the exact location: easternsoundcollective@gmail.com
Or reach out on Instagram/Facebook: @easternsoundcollective

description:
Family Watercolour Art Class - Island Bay, In this class all the family can share 2 hours of creative fun together and grown ups can join in for youth price of $25. All materials supplied including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty handed and two hours they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing as this will be done so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by step teaching style is used and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes, each has a different subject to choose from, Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.

description:
Soft Bait - Life Advice Album Release Tour (Wellington), Tāmaki Makaurau post-punk outfit Soft Bait are hitting the road this September in celebration of their new album Life Advice, out July 25 via Flying Nun Records.
Known for their sharp lyricism, driving basslines and chaotic-but-considered live shows, the four-piece are bringing their wiry energy and weird charm to stages across the motu. Life Advice is a hook-heavy record full of tightly wound rhythms, jagged guitars and lines that sound like overheard wisdom from a mate you probably shouldn’t be listening to.
Tickets on sale now.
With support from Buffcat and True Mets.

description:
Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau, Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau
📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Stuffed Tofu with Tomato Sauce (Đậu hũ dồn thịt sốt cà) – Soft tofu stuffed with a savoury minced pork filling, simmered in a rich and tangy tomato sauce for a comforting and flavourful dish.

• Vietnamese Fish & Dill Soup (Canh riêu cá thì là) – A light yet robust soup made with fresh fish, tomatoes, and fragrant dill, delivering a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savoury flavours.

• Stir-Fried Squid with Pineapple (Mực xào thơm) – Tender squid stir-fried with juicy pineapple, bell peppers, and aromatics, creating a deliciously sweet and tangy seafood dish.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨

description:
Gin and Clay Emerald Green and Turquoise Blue Wall Art Workshop, A fabulous and fun workshop that combines creativity and gin tasting for a unique experience. Create one stunning large wall art piece or two smaller pieces that will be fired and glazed in either a striking emerald green or a vibrant blue around 5 weeks after the session, making it perfect for displaying in your home or as a thoughtful gift. Alongside that sip 3 delicious Gin samples from the Bond Store distillery where we will be working.

My clay classes are suitable for complete beginners or those with experience and are a wonderful way to relax, replenish and have fun. Working with clay is good for the soul! Immersing in a gentle creative activity helps to switch off a busy mind, and making tiles is fun and achievable even if this is your first time using clay.

All materials are provided so all you need to do is turn up ready to have some fun and creativity. Booking is essential so please use this ticket link: https://forms.gle/PRLZ1JH9awDYjoNk8 or email clpates@hotmail.com.

Price includes all materials, glaze, double kiln firing and a gin tasting tray with 3 gins from The Bond Store.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Fresh Summer Rolls – Healthy Cooking Workshop (FREE), Fresh Summer Rolls – Healthy Cooking Workshop (FREE)
📢 Registrations open one week before the event – don’t miss out on your spot!

Roll into Flavour with Us!

Light, fresh, and packed with vibrant Vietnamese herbs – Gỏi Cuốn (Fresh Summer Rolls) are the perfect summer treat. Join us for a fun and hands-on class to learn how to make this iconic dish from scratch.

🌿 What You’ll Learn:
• Prepping and handling delicate rice paper
• Rolling techniques that hold up!
• How to layer herbs, protein, and veggies for balance and flavour
• Making your own traditional dipping sauce

👩‍🍳 Facilitator: Yung Nguyen – a passionate home cook and cultural storyteller from Viet Hub NZ who loves sharing recipes that connect people across cultures.

✨ Perfect for:
✅ Foodies & beginners alike
✅ Families, students, and community members
✅ Anyone curious about Vietnamese culture or healthy cooking!

⸻

🎉 Come roll, dip, and taste the magic of Vietnamese cuisine in a welcoming and relaxed setting.

📢 Remember: Registrations open one week before the event. First come, first served!

#VietHubNZ #FreshSummerRolls #VietnameseCookingClass #GoiCuon #CommunityKitchen #FreeWorkshop #YungNguyen #TasteOfVietnam

description:
Gorgeous Texture Earrings and Pendants Taster, A quick taster class that’s ideal as a festive outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

The earrings will be made with silver bonded onto copper, giving the bright flash of silver on one side and the dark tone of copper on the other.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Hands-on Sourdough Workshop (Neil's), Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
*Payment to clear in bank account two days after ticket bought, after which time your ticket will be released on to someone else. Please pay immediately upon purchasing ticket.
**All workshop info you need to know ahead of time is in the confirmation email. Please ensure you read this down to the bottom.
***I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).
"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan
"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight! From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody

Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

Bookings are essential. Email Tania:

description:
Integrating Creative Writing Into Painting - 4 Week Course, Creative writing and painting are both powerful forms of artistic expression. By integrating creative writing into your painting practice, you can enhance your imagination, storytelling abilities, emotional expression, attention to detail, and personal style on the canvas. Please bring along a journal or laptop.

COURSE CONTENT
Each session presents a key idea backed by research or concrete examples, followed by practical writing exercises with optional sharing. We learn by doing and from each other.

1. Generating work from the interior: tapping into memories, conflict, emotion, and observation to generate art.
2. Figuring out what matters to you, then learning how to grow your fragmented ideas into something whole. For example, how do you turn a feeling, or a fleeting moment in time into a story? Into a painting? Into a work of art? What are the building blocks you need?
3. Inspiration from other creative sources: people, music, poetry, reading, random incidents. Ways to generate fresh ideas. How to clarify and focus in writing and art.
4. Structure and boundaries. Dreaming big but being real. How do you find and stick to a creative process? Understanding how you learn and what kind of feedback you need. Designing your next project.

Thursday mornings, 9:30 - 11:45 am.
4 - 25 September.
