Learn the art of palmistry and enjoy a plant-based dinner afterwards - all included in your ticket!
In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.
By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life
Whether you're new to palmistry or looking to broaden your knowledge, this workshop will offer valuable insights into the planetary dimension of palm reading.
Plant-based dinner included in your ticket!

description:
Tom Cunliffe and Ali Whitton, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.

Doors at 7
Music at 7.30

The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.

Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.

Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.

Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

description:
Kāpiti Crop Swap RAUMATI, Kāpiti Crop Swap RAUMATI
This invite is for Crop Swap in Raumati 🌱

Everyone is welcome to our CROP SWAP meetings!

1st Saturday of the month – Otaki (1-2pm)
2nd Saturday of the month – Raumati (1-2pm)
3rd Saturday of the month – Pukerua Bay (3-4)
4th Saturday of the month – Waikanae (2-3pm)

To be clear, at Crop Swap, we swap more than just crops! We share everything homegrown and homemade: Vegetables, fruits, herbs, plants, seedlings, flowers, seeds, baking, preserves, sauces, jam and all things yummy! You can also bring everything garden and kitchen related like empty containers, tools, labels, planting pots, worm juice, coffee grounds, gardening magazines, cook books, recipes, a SKILL…possibilities are endless.

The key is that this is a cashless event, no koha can offered or accepted.

This is generally how a Crop Swap will run:

1-1.30pm
• People arrive with their crops and put them out on the tables provided.
• You are then free to chat and mingle with your fellow garden enthusiasts, exchange tips, make new friends or just wait until it starts.

1.30-2.00pm
• We conduct a quick briefing outlining the guidelines for swapping.
• If there is not a lot of people, we can listen to anyone who wants to introduce their crop.
• Once everyone has placed their crops we like to do a Karakia to bless the kai. We want to emphasise our values regarding generous giving and mindful taking.
• We are an inclusive group and all members and sectors of our community are welcome.

2.00-2.30pm
• Close out, put away tables and clear the hall.

The meetings will be held regularly on the 2nd Saturday of every month.

Further information:
1. There will be a koha food box for anyone who wants to donate food or seedlings in addition to their swaps. The Crop Swap team will distribute any koha crop and left over crops to local food pantries.

2. If you do not have any crops to swap but need fresh fruit or veges for the next week, you can bring plants, flowers, seedlings, herbs, eggs, preserves, jams, baking, liquid manure, gardening books, magazines, planting containers, sometimes even chooks who need a new home! We want this to be accessible to everyone, especially those who are struggling to put fresh fruit and veges on the table!
label: Community & Culture

description:
Reigniting the Spark - lets connect, recharge, and reignite the flame, Hi all you lovely teachers! �
Jitbug is hosting a** FREE** PD in person workshop for our past and current relievers but decided to open it up to **all** ECE teachers, since it wouldn't cost much more anyways. So invite your friend/s and come along! This workshop is being held in Wellington so for those living outside the region, why not make it a weekend away to learn, explore new ideas, fresh inspiration and make lasting connections �
Link to sign up below. Be quick as the venue has limited spaces!
[https://forms.gle/Rm42pgFLCadBZFVQ7](https://forms.gle/Rm42pgFLCadBZFVQ7)
We probably don't say this enough - but we truly believe our work as ECE educators matters. It matters because the formative years of a child is very important- it influences their mental and emotional wellbeing. What you do as ECE educators shape our next generation and our future society.
So.. in a way, this is our way of expressing our gratitude and saying thank you for all that you do. We'd love to see you there! �

description:
Science Bites School Holidays Science Workshops, Get hands-on with some tasty, edible science these school holidays! Science Bites is an edible science workshop for tamariki aged 8-12 years old.

Learn about rainbow diffraction chocolate, make your own gummy worms, explore some glow-in-the-dark jelly, and more! All the projects in this workshop are safe to eat, meaning kids can taste their creations as they learn.

Tamariki will be excited to come home and share their new understanding of how science can be found in our everyday lives, even our kitchens!

Workshops include a complimentary planetarium show.

Tamariki can be dropped-off in the morning and picked-up afterwards; caregivers are not required to stay for the duration of the workshop. Tamariki should bring a packed lunch.

This workshop will involve handling and consuming some known allergens and substances your child may be sensitive to. Please refer to the list on the Space Place website.

Best suited for children aged 8-12. $65 per tamariki - 9am-1pm.

description:
Tawa is 50 - Past Student Reunion, Tawa is 50 - Past Student Reunion
Students from 1976 to 2005 are invivted to come celebrate Tawa Intermediate School's 50th birthday with old classmates at our Student Reunion event! Join us for an evening of reminiscing, catching up, and creating new memories. The event will be held on the school grounds, so get ready to walk down memory lane! Ticket prices include live music, nibbles, and one drink token with the option to buy more beverages.

This is an 18+ event.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Rainbow Wellington October Social Mixer, Join us for our monthly mixer at Southern Cross Garden Bar from 5:30pm
This is a great way to meet other LGBTQ+ people from around Pōneke. Make new friends, or meet up with old mates.
This is a free event, at one of our regular venues, who are always happy to host LGBTQ+ events.
The ground floor of the venue is accessible, but quite skinny. There are stairs to a downstairs area. The nearest mobility car parks are on Bute Street near Z Energy petrol station.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Science Bites School Holidays science workshops, Get hands-on with some tasty, edible science these school holidays! Science Bites is an edible science workshop for tamariki aged 8-12 years old.
Learn about rainbow diffraction chocolate, make your own gummy worms, explore some glow-in-the-dark jelly, and more! All the projects in this workshop are safe to eat, meaning kids can taste their creations as they learn.
Tamariki will be excited to come home and share their new understanding of how science can be found in our everyday lives, even our kitchens!
Workshops include a complimentary planetarium show.
Tamariki can be dropped-off in the morning and picked-up afterwards; caregivers are not required to stay for the duration of the workshop. Tamariki should bring a packed lunch.
This workshop will involve handling and consuming some known allergens and substances your child may be sensitive to. Please refer to the Space Place website.
Best suited to ages 8-12 $65 per tamariki.
label: Family Friendly

description: Book Launch | How to Save Democracy in Aotearoa New Zealand, Join us to launch a vital new book by Sir Geoffrey Palmer: How to Save Democracy in Aotearoa New Zealand. The book will be launched by Jonathan Boston.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Spooky Wednesday's Slime Lab, Spooky Wednesday's Slime Lab
Celebrate the first day of October, the month of Halloween, with Wednesday Addams’ delightfully dark slime lab!

About this Event

Spooky Wednesday’s Slime Lab: A Creepy-Cool Workshop (1.5 hours)

Celebrate the first day of October, the month of Halloween, with Wednesday Addams’ delightfully dark slime lab! Guided by everyone’s favourite gothic icon, young scientists (ages 5+) will mix potions, stir eerie colours, and conjure up their own squishy, spooky slime to take home. 🖤🧪
This 1.5-hour experience is packed with creepy fun, morbid giggles, and just the right touch of weird — with gooey surprises, chilling stories, and plenty of hands-on slime play.
Includes:🖤 Slime making with Wednesday Addams🧪 Take-home spooky slime📖 Creepy-cool stories and gothic games✨ Perfect for kids aged 5 and up
Optional Add-on: $5 “Graveyard Goo” — a gloopy, colourful kids’ mocktail to add to the eerie experience 🍹
A slimy, spook-tacular time for every little misfit and monster-in-training! 🕷️👻

Please note that we are not registered childcare providers, which means an adult responsible for each child must remain on the premises. The venue is also a café restaurant with other areas where parents can chill while the workshop is running.
label: Family Friendly

St Michael’s Holiday Programme, 1–3 October 2025, 9am–12.30pm
For 5–11 year olds
Join us for a fun three days of fast-paced song and dance, stories, games and crafts!
Venue: St Michael’s Church, Kelburn

description:
Street Dance Foundations with Shifting Centre at Māoriland, Manu Wairere is a school holiday programme at the Māoriland Hub in Ōtaki, designed to ignite the creative potential of tamariki and rangatahi Māori aged 5–18.

Rangatahi are invited to join Shifting Centre, a Wellington-based artist collective, for a 3-day Street Dance Foundations Workshop.

Participants will explore the foundations of street dance through cypher and Talanoa, building confidence, creativity, and connection.

The workshop will conclude with a performance for whānau and friends.
label: Family Friendly

description:
Tamariki Time: Toi Art, A free interactive drop-in session for tamariki aged 5 and under. This month, explore the new exhibitions in Toi Art
As hōtoke (winter) draws to a close, we will be exploring the new Te Whare Tapere, or house of entertainment, in the art studio in Toi Art.
Follow prompts to find seasonal stories in our exhibitions and make shadow plays using puppets.

Entry to Te Papa is free for all New Zealanders and people living in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Don’t miss out on our other whānau-friendly events! Stay in the loop at tepapa.nz/newsletter
label: Family Friendly

description:
Take A Kid Tramping - Maketawa Hut Overnight, Family tramping.
Take a Kid Tramping Trip for our kids with extra stamina and ability to carry an overnight pack, this one has a lot of climbing. We will head up the translator track from North Egmont, turn off and follow the ridge down to the hut. The next day we will return via the Makatawa track down through the bush and across a few streams.
All participants must be equipped for tramping in alpine conditions. Overnight tramping equipment required.
Children must be accompanied by a parent or caregiver approved by their guardian.
Shared transport costs apply, unless own transport is provided.
$10 per adult passenger, kids or own car free + hut fee.
Hut Tickets or annual pass required.
If interested, please register by Thursday 11 September:
Jo-anne Mowat | takt@nptc.org.nz
label: Family Friendly

description:
Sandwich, Sandwich
Sandwich is a combination event between creators of sculptural artwork and creators of experimental sound-work. Sandwich is also a fundraiser for Radioactive.fm, your local alternative radio station. Sandwich is taking place on Wednesday the 15th of October at Valhalla.
Sculpture:
Emily Mahoney
Belle Evans
Lucas Kingsford-Tinling
Phoebe Laird
Indio AB
Sound:
Garden Faerie
Charmort
Synthia + Ghanjee (Live Analog Synth)
kvokil
Kindekel II
This event is in two parts:
2pm - 5pm
Daytime gallery exhibition with ambient sound
Koha entry
Feel free to walk around, engage with the art work, grab a drink and hang out.
2pm - 3pm: Ghangee + Synthia (Ambient Live Analog Synth)
3pm - 4pm: Charmort (Ambient Set)
4pm - 5pm: kvokil, (Ambient Set)
7pm - 12am
Nighttime party exhibition with club sound
Ticketed entry
Return at nighttime for heavy club sounds chosen and created in collaboration with sculptural artists. Each sculptural artwork is paired with a music set.
7pm - 8pm: Garden Faerie with Emily Mahoney
8pm - 9pm: Charmort with Belle Evans
9pm - 10pm: Gangee + Synthia with Lucas Kinsford-Tinling
10pm - 11pm: Kvokil with Phoebe Laird
11pm - 12am: Kindekel II with Indio
Follow Bubble Stop at https://www.instagram.com/bubble.stop_/ for more information and events.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Twin Peaks Meetup Wellington: Season 2 - Episodes 8 & 9, If the sound of watching Twin Peaks together with a bunch of like minded fans sounds like a good idea, then you've come to the right place!

Last time we met we celebrated completing all of Season 1 together.

I am excited to announce we are now going to watch Season 2! Starting off with the special double length "Episode 8: May the Giant Be With You". Written by Mark Frost, David Lynch and directed by David Lynch. Followed by "Episode 9:Coma". Directed by David Lynch.

This is what we will be watching :

-Short Recap "Previously...on Twin Peaks"

-Episode 8: "May the Giant Be With You" (93mins)

-Intermission

-Episode 9: "Coma" (46mins)

With all Log Lady Intros!

WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.
https://www.teauahaevents.com/our-spaces/cinema

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 6th Sept. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.

Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat. Every single screening so far has sold out well in advance, so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing the epic start to Season 2 in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!


RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please.

2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +

3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.

4. Please clean up after yourself if you are snacking and help keep the mini cinema clean as a whistle.

Thank you! And hope to see you there.
label: Film & Media

description: High Tide, High Tide is back and bigger than ever. The genre-bending, multi-stage music festival is heading to Waitangi Park in November. Festival-goers can hear a mix of music from drum & bass, to house, grime, and hip-hop, all among Wellington’s beautiful waterfront.
label: Festivals

description:
The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella, The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella
Glass slippers, royal balls, and a Fairy Godmother who’s still on her learner’s licence, what could possibly go wrong?

Prince Percy is hopelessly charming (emphasis on hopeless), the Queen is busy approving new royal wave techniques (it’s very hard work being a Queen!), the step-sisters are causing chaos in couture, and Buttons has big dreams!

Will true friendship win over fairy-tale romance? Will Buttons dreams come true? And who is behind the kingdom’s mysterious gossip vlog? Packed with music, mischief, and magical mayhem, this is Cinderella with a twist, a tune, and a whole lot of sparkle! Step into a spellbinding world of wonder where dreams shimmer, magic floats on the breeze, and anything is possible… but only until the clock strikes twelve!

REVIEWS FOR RED RIDING HOOD

“You guys were amazing, thank you so much. Me and the kids had an amazing time. We can’t wait for the next holidays t come see you again.”

“My kids had a blast! My little man was in hysterics at Mr Moa.”

“Love everything that you do and each time gets better and better.”

SEATING LAYOUT: LARGE TIERED SEATING BLOCK. For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email or call 06 379 4081 during office hours.
label: Family Friendly

description:
From Source 2025, From Source 2025
From Source
A space to activate and remember your innate, divine connection to Source. This is an invitation to access your unique blueprint and align with what is required for your evolution. Through alchemical technology, sound vibrations, and breathwork, we inspire a divine collaboration within the cells of your mind, body, and soul.

Our last event was an incredible success, and due to the deep transformations that unfolded, we are bringing it back in October 2025 for another powerful gathering.

We are honored to have an incredible lineup of contributors, each weaving their threads of wisdom and magic to co-create a weekend of deep activation and restorative integration. The modalities and offerings will include:

✨ Triple Cone Orgonite Technology, Merkabar Activation & Sound Healing – Jason Hotton

✨ Voice Activation & Live Medicine Music – Joydah Mae

✨ Breathwork & Meditation – OM Shanti Shanti

✨ Crystal Bowls – Lucine Sounds

✨ Cacao – Awa Aroha

✨ Nourishing Food – Anthea Carr

✨ Space Holder – Leah Pomeroy

Together, we will journey through these realms of wisdom—let’s see what Source has in store for us this weekend.

Event Details
📅 Two-Day Immersion – Your ticket includes both days
🕚 Saturday, Oct 11 | 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM
🕙 Sunday, Oct 12 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Ticket Tiers
🎟 First Round – $222 (15 passes only) - SECURE ASAP
🎟 Second Round – $333
🎟 Final Round – $444

What to Bring
✅ Yoga Mat
✅ Cushion/Blanket
✅ Journal
✅ Water Bottle
✅ BYO Cup for Cacao
✅ BYO Plates, Bowls & Cutlery for shared meals
✅ A plate of nourishing kai to share at the end of Saturday as we ground together

Please Note
This event is designed for deep inner work and integration, making it unsuitable for young children and no dogs are permitted in the hall. We encourage you to take this time for yourself to fully immerse in the experience.

💌 Any questions? Email us at
📍 Stay connected – Follow us on Facebook (@FromSource) for updates!

We can't wait to share this sacred space with you once again. 🌿✨
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Āhuru Mōwai Trust Low Sensory Session, Āhuru Mōwai Trust Low Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Chipmunks Playland Tawa.
Session Details:
When: Tuesdays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30-8:00pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: children/young adults with special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
On Tuesday's we also host a Brick Therapy session with Dan from Brick Engaged and there is an additional activity fee of $5 per child to participate in that activity.
If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)
Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.
Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.
Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO.
label: Family Friendly

description:
Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants, A quick taster class that’s ideal as a weekend outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.”
Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland - The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favorite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance
label: Festivals

description:
BOWIE-OKE at The Last Post Restaurant & Bar, BOWIE-OKE at The Last Post Restaurant & Bar
BOWIE-OKE – David Bowie Karaoke 🎤

Calling all starmen, space oddities, and heroes (even if it’s just for one day) — it’s your time to shine! Step up to the mic and unleash your inner Ziggy.

💥 Venue: The Last Post Restaurant & Bar, 57 Fox St, Featherston RSA
💥 Date: Friday 26 September, 7.30 pm ‘til late

Dress loud, sing proud, and channel your favourite Bowie era — from glam and soul to Berlin cool or ‘90s brilliance. It’s karaoke, but make it Bowie. 🌟

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

☆ BOWIETOWN FEATHERSTON ☆
⚡Enter the Bowie universe!⚡

This September, Featherston transforms into BowieTown for the very first time – a full weekend celebrating the music, artistry, and magic of David Bowie. Expect live music, dance, creativity, food, and plenty of ways to let your inner Ziggy shine.
Event link https://www.facebook.com/share/1A1dp5NUzJ/

📅 Friday 26 – Sunday 28 September 2025
Featherston, Wairarapa


📍 Here’s what’s happening across the weekend 📍

⭐ Bowie-oke
Last Post Restaurant & Bar (Featherston RSA) 🎤 Friday 26 Sept, 7.30 pm ‘til late
Bowie karaoke to kick things off!
Event link https://www.facebook.com/share/1TdhZKFpvH/


⭐ Bowie Cocktails & Desserts
Brac & Bow 🍸🍰 Friday 26 – Sunday 28 Sept
Sweet and stylish, Bowie-style.


⭐ Featherston Library Display
30 Books Recommended by Bowie 📚 Friday 26 & Saturday 27 Sept.
Discover what the Thin White Duke read.


⭐ Bowie Collage Pop-Up Craft (Family Fun)
Featherston Library 🎨 Saturday 27 Sept, 10 – 11 am.
Kids (and big kids) welcome.


⭐ Bowie Barkers Dog Party
Dorset Square 🐾 Saturday 27 Sept, 11 am.
Walk & Bark + bring/swap/donate/buy dog gear. Hosted by Madame Mutts.


⭐ Bowie Art Bash + Portrait Exhibition
ANZAC Hal l🎨 Saturday 27 Sept 1 – 3 pm
Life drawing with Bowie models (bring your own gear), $10 cash entry. Plus a Bowie Portrait Exhibition with works for sale (free entry).


⭐ Bowie Pizzas
The Last Post Restaurant & Bar (Featherston RSA) 🍕 Saturday 27 Sept from 5 pm
Thin-crust Ziggy-style deliciousness!


⭐ BOWIE BLASTOFF CONCERT + AFTERPARTY
ANZAC Hall 🚀 Saturday 27 Sept 7 pm
Entry $20 (cash only, door sales)
Live performances from Mad Honey, The Davids, Taza Manaza, Tangle Dance Community, Justine Rose Kingdon, Fräulein Sylvia, and Hugo Del Mar.
Followed by the Blastoff Afterparty – put on your red shoes and dance, dance, dance to Bowie + beyond with DJ Nyx. (Alcohol-free event.)
Event link https://www.facebook.com/share/1GKm5wibcF/


⭐ The Davids Flashmob Dance
The Squircle (beside Featherston Fresh Choice Carpark) 💃 Sunday 28 Sept 1.30 pm.
Don’t miss this surprise Bowie moment!


⭐ Bowie Storytime with Penny Griffin
Chicken & Frog Bookshop 📖 Sunday 28 Sept, 2 pm
Bowie books read aloud for kids of all ages – with special guest star “Angus.”


⭐ Bowie Feast
At Brac & Bow 🍽️ Sunday 28 Sept 6 pm
Bowie Roast Dinners, Preprandial Bowie Cocktails, and Bowie-inspired Desserts.

✨ Plus all weekend: check out Bowie-era books in Featherston Booktown and browse vintage Bowie bric-a-brac in local shops.

description:
A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Wellington
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.”
Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland - The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favorite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance

description:
Bodgies to Bogans, Bodgies to Bogans
This Festival event runs from the 18th October to the 9th November 2025.


'Bodgies to Bogans' tells the story of the juvenile delinquencies and teenager rebellion of the 1950s to the Bogans of the 1980s.

Whether you were listening to rock and roll, riding motorcycles and drinking milk shakes at milk bars in the 50s or growing a mullet and thrashing out the leathers to heavy metal in the 80s, this exhibition documents the history of youth culture in Upper Hutt, and New Zealand.

Curated and developed by Whirinaki Whare Taonga.
Proudly supported by The Rimutaka Trust.
Open 10am–4pm, seven days a week.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/bodgies-to-bogans/


Health & Safety:
Staff will be onsite at all times on the front desk to assist in emergency situations.

description:
Bookshop Day 2025, Mark your calendars, Bookshop Day takes place on Saturday 11 October! Bookshop Day is a one-day nationwide celebration of independent bookstores, highlighting the cultural importance of books and bookshops, and the people that bring the two together, our amazing booksellers.
This year marks 10 years of Bookshop Day in Aotearoa – that’s 10 years of dress-up competitions, live music, storytimes, regional bookshop hops, author readings, spot prizes, teddy bear sleepovers, giveaways, arts and crafts, scavenger hunts, delicious baked goods, and many, many more activities and offerings!
Bookshop Day is run by the Booksellers Association of New Zealand to encourage book lovers, like you, to celebrate your local bookshop.
Head to our website to explore our Bookshop Day event calendar and see what your local bookshop has planned this year: https://www.booksellers.co.nz/bookshop-day-2025-events

description:
Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night, Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)

DATES
Wed 27 Aug 2025 - Sat 6 Sep 2025

description:
Strengths & Superpowers, Strengths & Superpowers
Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest.
Welcome to the second conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
This conversation is led by two experts who are empowering other women, and will focus on an often-overlooked asset: personal branding. Whether your sights are set on a project or a promotion, this powerful tool can put you on the radar for the opportunities you want.
Why be part of this conversation?
When you control your narrative, you can ensure that it's accurate, compelling, and unique. Join our interactive session to uncover and learn how to convey the unique value you bring to the table. It isn't about crafting a fake persona, it's about making sure your superpowers get noticed.
You’ll get expert insights into:
Strengths: Understand and use your strengths for impact.
Superpower: Take control of what you want to be known for.
Story: Quick ways to naturally share your value.
Who’s the speaker?
Natalie Ferguson & Kristen Luman are the founders of Powrsuit - a career accelerator for every woman that takes professional development out of to-do lists and into weekly routines. With over 700 members across NZ, Australia, North America and Singapore, Powrsuit's research-backed approach delivers a tangible return on investment. After six months, 82% of members increase self-leadership skills, and 28% take a tangible step forward in their careers.
This interactive workshop is a must-attend for anyone who wants to maximise their visibility and value, regardless of job title.
**All attendees will go into the draw to win a annual Powrsuit membership**
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Powrsuit mini-masterclass
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
18 September: Impactful Leadership - What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Midnight Kitty, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Carnival of Chaos, Myth, chaos, murder, alchemy, mystery, and devils are afoot in this four-night festival featuring six short retellings of classic works with strange new twists! We invite you to THEA 303’s ‘Carnival of Chaos’ in Studio 77, premiering hybrid works from the House of Echoes (1 & 3 October): The Odyssey, Medea and The Devil is a Lover, and the House of Secrets (2 & 4 October): Rope, The Taming of the Shrew  and  God’s Gift.

Each adaptation has been directed, designed, produced, choreographed and managed by the students.

House of Echoes (Season A): Performs on the 1st and the 3rd of October

The Odyssey – An adaptation of Homer’s The Odyssey
Odysseus just wants to get home to his true love, but the journey isn’t exactly smooth. The streets after 2 a.m. and too many beers are alive with obstacles; cops are grumpy, goth girls are tempting, and the help of the Gods is nowhere to be found. Meanwhile, back home, a dangerous polycule is getting cozy with his Penelope…

Medea – An adaptation of Euripides’ Medea
Medea lives her perfect 1950s white picket fence dream! When her husband starts taking new pills “Conservatol, the wonder drug for traditional love” she learns that traditional love means different to what she thought. Betrayal, hurt, and anger push her to the edge making her act in ways she never thought she would. “Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, nor Hell a fury like a woman scorned.”

The Devil is a Lover – An adaptation of William Shakespeare’s Love Labours Lost and Ben Johnson’s The Devil is an Ass
Satan and two devils, Beelzebub and Pug, make a pact to travel to a 1920s speakeasy on Earth and abstain from corruption for 3 years. As the narrative combines absurdist actions with Shakespearean dialogue, the three devils quickly learn of the difficulties present in avoiding corruption and the effect their devilish meddling has on humanity.

House of Secrets (Season B): Performs on the 2nd and 4th of October

Rope – An adaptation of Patrick Hamilton’s Rope (1929)
Not a whodunnit, but a howdoyahideit? Marion and Melanie are sure they’ve committed the perfect murder by killing their friend Norman and hiding his body in a chest, a chest their select group of friends have been invited over to have a murder mystery games night around. It’s foolproof, until the over analytical Constance comes to play…

The Taming of the Shrew – An adaptation of William Shakespeare’s Taming of the Shrew
In 1970's Aotearoa, sisters Katherina and Bianca find their love lives complicated by their father's order that one may not pursue romance unless the other follows suit. The sudden appearance of a charming factory owner and friend of Bianca's beau could mark a new hope for the two, but will this lead to an ocean of love or does something far more sinister lurk beneath the surface?

God’s Gift – An adaptation of Ben Johnson’s The Alchemist
The Carnival has come to town in 1615 London. Lovewit has gone to see the show, leaving her manor in the hands of Jeremy the Butler, the “Alchemist,” and Dol, a hardworking prostitute. Lovewit’s house becomes a place for schemes, with ample opportunities to take money from foolish men. Will Dol be happy with her split of the money? Or will a surprise visitor shake things up?

Content Forecast: mentions of and implied sexual violence and domestic abuse, mentions of drug use, strobe lighting, violence, coarse language, loud noises, haze, and smoke.
label: Festivals

description:
Chilean Independence Day 🇨🇱🇨🇱, Chilean Independence Day 🇨🇱🇨🇱
UPDATE!!!! We’re moving the event to Sunday the 21st because of venue availability.

Vamos a celebrar este 18 de Septiembre como corresponde! ✨

Los queremos invitar a celebrar estas fiestas con la comunidad en el bowling de Seatoun.
Vamos a tener dos parrillas prendidas, juegos tradicionales (gymkana, carrera de sacos, la silla musical, una pichanga y hasta karaoke), además de música y baile pa’ que no falte el zapateo . 🎶⚽🔥
La idea es que cada uno traiga algo para la parrilla y algo rico para compartir: puede ser un postre, unas empanadas, sopaipillas, ensaladas o lo que se les ocurra. En el local se podra comprar bebestibles varios, incluso terremotos!!! 🍷🍻
Y porque no hay primera sin segunda ni segunda sin tercera… 🎉
Este año vamos a celebrar con varios panoramas:
⦁ Sábado 13 de Septiembre: celebración en el restaurant Puro Chile desde las 12pm a 7pm .

⦁ Sábado 20 de Septiembre en la noche: seguimos la fiesta en el barrio con DJ Descontrol.

⦁ Domingo 21 de Septiembre: en el bowling de Seatoun con nosotros desde 12pm.

También para los que quieran ir a apoyar y ver el show de Puku Rangi Tea (Grupo de danza de Rapa Nui) en Wellington.
⦁Martes 16/09: Performance en Scots College Wellington. FREE 7pm.
⦁Jueves 18/09: Presentacion en el musel Te Papa Tongarewa. FREE 1pm

¡Así que vengan con ganas de pasarlo chancho y celebrar juntos este 18 toda la semana!!!

Nos vemos pronto!!!!!!


Let’s celebrate this Chilean Independence day the right way! ✨

We’d like to invite you to join us for our celebration with the community at the Seatoun Bowling Club.
We’ll have two barbecues going, traditional games (gymkana, sack race, musical chairs, a friendly football match, and even karaoke), plus music and dancing so we don’t miss out on some good cueca steps. 🎶⚽🔥

The idea is that everyone brings something for the barbecue and something tasty to share: it could be a dessert, empanadas, sopaipillas, salads, or whatever you’d like. Drinks will be available for purchase at the venue, including Chile’s famous cocktail, the Terremoto.🍷🍻

And because one party is never enough… 🎉 This year we’ll be celebrating several events:

⦁Saturday, September 13th: Celebration at Puro Chile restaurant, from 12pm to 7pm.

⦁Saturday, September 20th at night: we keep the party going in El Barrio with DJ Descontrol.

⦁Sunday, 21 September at the Seatoun Bowling with us from 12 pm.

Also for those who would like to go and support and watch the show by Puku Rangi Tea (Rapa Nui Dance Group) in Wellington.
⦁Tuesday 16: Performance at Scots College Wellington. FREE 7pm.
⦁Thursday 18: Performance at the Te Papa Tongarewa Museum. FREE 1pm.

So come ready to have an amazing time and celebrate this Chilean Independence Day/Week together, not just once but several times!

See you soon. 🎉🎉🎉
label: Festivals

description:
Daffodil Express 2025, Daffodil Express 2025
Carterton’s Daffodil Festival in the early Spring creates a great day out for the whole family. Why not travel there in style by a heritage train, let Steam Incorporated take the stress out of travel as you take the train to the Wairarapa. This year, our train has reduced capacity, so be sure to book in quickly!

Hauled by our heritage locomotives, take a glimpse into the bygone era of train travel as we clear the rush of Wellington, racing through the suburbs of Petone, Lower Hutt & Upper Hutt. After picking up the last of our passengers at Upper Hutt, we will race through the 8.8km long Rimutaka tunnel. This tunnel remains the longest in New Zealand with scheduled passenger trains, and has just been subjected to a full track relay for the first time since it was opened in 1955.

Passing through Featherston, we head east and navigate the rolling hills towards Carterton.

Arriving into Carterton, you'll have a few hours to disembark and go and explore Carterton's annual Daffodil Festival , before jumping on the train for the return journey home.

The Daffodil Fields and Festival
Located in the heart of the Wairarapa, Carterton’s popular Daffodil Festival offers an abundance of activities ranging from the famous Daffodil picking at Middlerun Farm, markets along High and Holloway Streets, the Big Wai Art sale in the events Centre, live music, and loads more family fun.

Shuttle buses will run from the town centre to the daffodil fields. There will be a lot of people for these buses, so please be patient. The bus transfer is free.

Here you can pick your own daffodils for $5 (Cash Preferred) that is a fundraiser for Wellington Free Ambulance and Whānau Āwhina Plunket, Wairarapa region. While stocks last!

The fields are not suitable for walkers or wheelchairs due to uneven grounds.

Prior booking is essential, this is an annual sell out event!

Fares
Adult (13+) - $125
Child (2-12yrs) - $90
Infant - Free

For more information & tickets, head to https://steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/daffodil-express/

All is quiet… the towns near Errens Crossing seem calm – for now…..

A band of adventurers help is sought to solve a mystery and advert the outbreak of war. Are you up to the task?

Come join our group of plucky adventurers and make your mark in Shadows Crossing!

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.
label: Film & Media

description:
Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration, Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration
¡Celebra con nosotros el Día de los Muertos con música, baile, comida tradicional y altares conmemorativos!

About this Event

Welcome to the Day of the Dead - Dia de los Muertos Celebration at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing! Join us for a vibrant and colorful event filled with traditional live music, storytelling, rituals for remembering the dead and delicious prehispanic Mexican cacao drink. Honour your loved ones at our ofrenda, or altar, and learn more from our faciltator, Claudio Escutia, about this rich cultural tradition.
Let's come together to celebrate life and remember those who have passed in a joyful and meaningful way. Don't miss out on this special celebration!
What to Expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.
History of the day of the dead celebration.
Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.
Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).
Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged) 
Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones 
Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot
Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments
Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

description:
Tram 17 Inauguration (Fathers Day 2025), Join us at the Wellington Tramway Museum as we put our latest restoration project into active service at the museum!
Tram 17 was built in 1904 by the Wellington City Council Tramways as a four wheeled box (Palace) style tram. By 1917 the system had grown and 17 was rebuilt into its current form adding a set of trucks converting the tram to 8 wheels. Tram tram saw regular service until the 1940’s where it was eventually use for peak time travel, before being withdrawn in the late 50’s.
It was then sold, and taken to Bell road in Raumati on the Kapiti coast where it served as a beach hutt until the 80’s where it was donated to the Wellington tramway museum for display and eventual restoration.
2014 a conservation and restoration plan was put together, and the tram was shipped out to the Wheelwright Shop in the Wairarapa for a full body overhaul. It was transported back to the museum in 2017 and put on public display until new trucks (wheelsets) could be manufacturedby A&G price in Thames.
Since 2019 the tram has undergone new wiring, and extensive testing and running in and is now ready to take passengers along our museum.
Tram 17 is a wonderful achievement by all
Those involved, and we cannot wait to welcome you this Father’s Day to enjoy a ride on this heritage tram, saved from the scrap heap, and then saved again from rotting away.
Please note: We intend to run tram 17, however due to the nature and style of the tram, its operation is weather dependent. If we deem that the tram cannot run, we will advise accordingly.

description:
Diwali Festival of Lights, Diwali Festival of Lights is an exciting cultural celebration with fun activities for the whole whānau . Experience the colours, tastes, and sounds of India and South-East Asia. TSB Arena and Shed 6 will host a variety of performances and plenty of activities to keep you entertained. Take part in henna painting and lantern-making. Feast on delicious regional cuisine, explore Indian fashion and jewellery, and meet local community groups. Most importantly, enjoy this important and joyous festival. 
At the end of the night, enjoy the fireworks show as the event goes out with a bang. The fireworks display will start at approximately 8:50pm on Wellington Harbour (weather dependent). 
Diwali is a significant annual festival that marks the triumph of light over darkness, good over evil, and knowledge over ignorance. It is celebrated by Hindus, Sikhs, and Jains in communities all over the world. It’s marked with candles, lanterns, and fireworks. It is also known as Deepavali and is one of India’s most widely-celebrated holidays.

There are two guided tours of six newly installed signs that form part of the Porirua Heritage Trails. Come along to hear information and stories relating to the history of Porirua and Ngāti Toa Rangatira.

MaLGRA and Palmy Drag Fest Presents

To start a fabulous week of events with Palmy Drag Fest, get ready for a night of glitter, giggles, and gasp-worthy prizes as the fabulous RubyDax hosts Drag Bingo with special appearances by her local drag friends!

Expect campy chaos, cheeky banter, and dazzling performances woven between bingo rounds that’ll have you screaming “BINGO!” louder than your last breakup. RubyDax will keep you on your toes with her razor-sharp wit, outrageous outfits, and the kind of sass only Palmy’s fiercest queen can deliver.

Whether you’re in it to win it or just here for the vibes, Drag Bingo is the perfect beginning of Palmy Drag Fest week with fix of fun, friends, and fierce local drag. Prizes, surprises, and scandal guaranteed.

Plus the best of all is the amazing Venue! The best Pizza in town is at Tony's Pizza and together with their fabulous drinks you know it is sure to be a good time!

Get your tickets now!

description:
FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL, Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram

description:
Life Drawing Meets Yoga!, Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

A unique experience where movement meets mark-making. We begin with yoga and flow into life drawing until the two become naturally intertwined.

The drawing process is fully guided and inspired by the philosophies and methods of British artist Cecil Collins, encouraging a non-academic, intuitive approach. Through playful interaction with asana, the connection between these two practices becomes beautifully apparent.

Drinks and nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla, owner of Island Bay’s South Coast Studio, and AWHI yoga teacher Lachlan Broughton.

Encouraging expression over perfection, this experience is open to all levels and accessible to both artists and non-artists alike.

Come curious. Leave inspired.

Investment
$75 (includes all drawing materials, yoga, mat hire, drinks & nibbles)

All supplies & props provided — wear comfortable clothing to move in!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL, Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram

description:
Gindulgence Wellington 2026!, Gindulgence Wellington 2026!
Welcome to New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. NOW FEATURING rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other spirits!

On offer is a fantastic line-up of 20 distillers showcasing a fabulous selection of 90+ gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world.

Explore this exceptional range with samples from all distillers included in your ticket price.

Delight your senses in discovering the flavours and botanicals, buy a specialty drink or two or just sit back and soak up the atmosphere.
If you’re looking for inspiration or education, the Gin Theatre will be in action with presentations from a selection of passionate distillers.

Don't miss this afternoon experience of gin-on-the-lawn at the new location of WAITANGI PARK.

description:
Great Sounds Great Festival 2025, Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.

Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon.

Excitingly for 2025, we will be adding three new venues: St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records and 13 Garrett Street (sponsored by Radio Active), as well as a travelling electronic stage curated by Tonic Collective. This means more artists and music to experience in a variety of special and unique spaces throughout the night.

Ticket holders will receive a wristband that will give them access to each of the participating venues throughout the event. Information on how to pick up wristbands will be provided to ticket holders closer to the time.

Tickets are on sale now at eyegum.co.nz/great-sounds-great

When: from 4pm Saturday 6 September 2025
Where: San Fran, Meow, Valhalla, Rogue & Vagabond, Bedlam & Squalor, Hotel Bristol (2 stages), St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records, 13 Garrett St

Who: The lineup will include Anthonie Tonnon, Baby Zionov, Bad Taste, BADTAB, Baeoli, Bathysphere, The Bats, By A Damn Sight, Cindy, Eveline Breaker, Goya, Half/Angel, Hans Pucket, Iris Little, Jazmine Mary, Jen Cloher, JessB, JHL, Jim Nothing, Jordan Hamel, Leah Dodd, LEAO, Louisa Nicklin, The Phoenix Foundation, Reb Fountain, Rebecca Hawkes, Shayne P Carter (solo), Sig Wilder & Friends, Sofia Machray, Space Bats, Attack!, The Spectre Collective: live-scored cinema, Star Time, plus more artists to be announced soon.

description:

Love. Laughter. Gin. This is Valentine’s Day — the GinFlatables way.

Kapiti’s most unique adults-only (18+) festival is back — and this time, it’s bringing the love! The last GinFlatables SOLD OUT in under 24 hours, so don’t wait to grab your tickets. (On Sale From 1st November).

Brought to you by Kapiti Castles, on Saturday 14 February 2026, The Bond Store Distillery will transform into a giant playground for grown-ups. Bounce, race, and joust your way through epic inflatables, giant games, and laugh-out-loud moments.

Your ticket includes a FREE drink to kickstart the night, plus live DJs pumping high-energy tunes to keep you dancing all evening. Whether you’re coupled up, flying solo, or out with your crew, this is the Valentine’s event for fun-lovers.

When: Saturday, 14 Feb 2026, 5pm–10pm
Where: The Bond Store Distillery, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu
Tickets: Limited to 100 only — with a few available at the door.

Love. Laughter. Gin. This is Valentine’s Day — the GinFlatables way.

description:
Heritage Festival - Self-guided Tour of Truby King Park, Discover the hidden history of Truby King Park—scan, stroll, and uncover stories with your smartphone.

Step into a garden full of stories, some inspiring, some surprising. From cherry trees and hospital wards to the people who shaped New Zealand’s early healthcare, follow the QR trail to uncover the layers of Truby King Park’s past.

Health & Safety
This is a self-guided experience. Please explore within your limits. Wear good shoes and dress for the weather.

Parts of the park may be cordoned off for your safety. Please respect the cordons. Paths and steps may be slippery when wet.

Any time during the festival
18 Oct - 9 Nov 2025
Daily, dawn til dusk
Free

description:
Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025, Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025
The Annual Hutt Valley Diwali, organised by the Wellington Punjabi Sports and Cultural Club Inc. (WPSCC Inc.), is a vibrant, family-friendly celebration of light, culture, and community. Held each year in the heart of the Hutt Valley, this non-profit event brings together people of all ages and backgrounds to enjoy the rich traditions of Diwali.

The festival features a colourful mix of cultural performances, traditional and modern music and dance, delicious food, local art and craft stalls, and engaging activities for children and families. It offers a unique opportunity to experience the diverse cultures that make up our region while celebrating the universal values of light over darkness, hope, and togetherness.

WPSCC Inc. proudly hosts this event to promote unity, cultural understanding, and community spirit in the Hutt Valley and beyond.

description:
Tours of St Gerard's Church & Monastery - FULLY BOOKED, Tours of St Gerard's Church & Monastery - FULLY BOOKED
Find out what's behind the facade of this iconic building, one of the most recognisable in Wellington's landscape, and hear about its history.

Mount Victoria Historical Society is running tours in conjunction with St Gerard's Trust to give neighbours and visitors a chance to see the iconic monastery and now-deconsecrated church before seismic and renovation work commences. You will be guided through different areas of the monastery and the church, and learn about its history.


Booking is REQUIRED.
Cost: Free
This event is fully booked.
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/tours-of-st-gerards-church-monastery/


Health & Safety:
There are stairs, so visitors need to be comfortable using these. Numbers are limited.

description:
Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre, Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre
An Evening of Live Mediumship and Healing with Aussie Medium, Simon Hay

Simon is a psychic medium, medical intuitive and healer. He travels throughout Australia and New Zealand doing private sessions and events. His down-to-earth style of mediumship is accurate, surprising, and entertaining.
At these events, Simon shares messages and accurate information from spirit, but he's passionate about educating about energy healing and mediumship so he also answers audience questions about his career. If you’re curious about communicating to spirit and energy healing, you’ll love this event.
Enjoy…
• A demonstration of psychic mediumship readings in the Elwood Room
• Q and A — ask questions about spirit and energy healing
Arrive to be seated by 7:15 pm.
$55/ticket
Re ticket purchasers, we have a no refund policy. Be certain about attending before purchasing.
Not all attendees will receive readings (attendance doesn’t guarantee you’ll get a reading)
This is an adults only (16 years +) event. Parents, be aware that I often talk about topics suitable only for adults.
To be polite and respectful, turn off your phone during the event, and do not video or record any part of the event.
Prior to attending this event, visit Simon Hay's website, read all the information there and the disclaimer in its entirety. Thank you.

description:
Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin, Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin
Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Tickets here!
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98187/Traskforce!-Ft.-Wallace-Gollan-And-Eugene-Wolfin.utr

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.


The performers:

Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.


Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10


Personnel:

Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums

description:
Botanical Blues - Photographic cyanotype, Explore the historic photographic process of the cyanotype and create luminous blueprints of leaves and flowers.

In this workshop, you’ll discover the beautiful 19th-century photographic process of the cyanotype (often called a blueprint), known for its striking Prussian blue tones. In its earliest form, the cyanotype was used to record botanical specimens. During our workshop, you’ll collect plants or foliage from the garden (or bring your own) to create delicate contact prints on watercolour paper. We’ll coat paper with light-sensitive chemistry, expose your designs in the sunlight, and develop and tone your prints with tea (!) to add depth and variation to your series of finished images.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington
Twisted Frequency is teaming up with Keep Hush to bring a slice of Aotearoa’s outdoor festival culture into the city and broadcast to the world.

For the uninitiated, Keep Hush started as an intimate underground club night in London and has grown into a global platform celebrating underground dance music through live streams, pop-ups, and parties in unexpected places.

These folks have such a fantastic kaupapa that resonates deeply with what we are doing down here in Aotearoa and we couldn't be more stoked to work with them and share a bit of the Twisted community's creative passion with the world.

Featuring a carefully selected lineup of talent who are dedicated to creating original homegrown tunes, all representing a unique aspect of the country’s bass music melting pot. This will be a journey of sound from dub-infused taonga pūoro to home mulled jungle breaks and all stops between.

description:
Kingston Calling presents UB40 with Ali Campbell - Wellington, Kingston Calling presents UB40 with Ali Campbell - Wellington
The unmistakable voice behind UB40’s biggest hits is returning to Wellington as part of Kingston Calling 2026 – a brand new summer festival tour presented by Mai FM and Fabrik 💥 R18

Register for Presale now to get access to tickets first! https://arep.co/t/kingstoncallingpresale-25 🚨

UB40 featuring Ali Campbell bring their worldwide Big Love Tour to the capital, performing in the heart of the city at Waitangi Park.

Backed by a powerhouse nine-piece touring ensemble, Ali’s band is widely regarded as “the most authentic realisation of UB40’s original aim of advancing reggae in all its guises.”

“I think I’ve got the best reggae band in the world, and you can quote me on that.” – Ali Campbell

Each show will be a festival experience, also featuring a stellar cast of Aotearoa’s finest performers. Full lineup to be announced shortly ❤️ 💛 💚

description:
Fizzwizard - the Return!!!, Aleister ‘Fizzwizard’ Campbell returns from Tamaki Makaurau (Auckland) to his hometown to inflict all manner of psychedelic-blues-joy upon the good people of Te-Upoko-o-te-Ika (Wellington).

Trained in a jazz conservatory then corrupted in dive bars and on the streets, Aleister James Campbell, with his evergreen love of Charlie Parker & Jimi Hendrix, is known for his spell-binding stage presence and deep connection to the music.

Currently on the run from the Jazz Police for inappropriate Wah Wah use in a straight-ahead jazz context...

For what promises to be a triumphant night, Aleister (on guitar and vocals) will be joined by: Tyson Smith - Electric Bass, Rick Cranson - Drum Kit, Baron Oscar Laven - Alto & Soprano Sax, and Jake Baxendale - Tenor Sax.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Other Futures Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is about multi-disciplinary excellence and celebration of our individual and collective voices in new ways. In this episode, anticipate steaming and reverent swing alongside triumphant soul, dark and scenic textures, and dripped-out golden-age hip-hop cuts. We celebrate artistry with dignity, respect and above all, joy. We swing hard. We groove like humanity depends on it. Groove with us at Meow Nui this Wellington Jazz Festival!
=========
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is where musical dreams come alive. It’s about the spark of true individuality, nestled in the art and community of ensemble. The thrill and drama of the showband era re-envisioned for our time. Selections that signify deeper meanings and secret codes. Turntablism sensibility on a symphonic scale. Streamlined, momentous, nimble, angular, adapting, shape-shifting, pulsating with relentless joy and emotion.
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is an ongoing project by Daniel Hayles that looks to honour elements of the big band tradition while platforming music and artists unexplored within the style. Expect to hear distinct flavour in new interpretations of original music from Aotearoa and the world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Korokoro Glow Worm Walk, This is an easy walk next to the Korokoro stream following an old steel gravity feed water pipe, dogs on leads are welcome.
Definitely requires a torch or head light as there is no lighting on this walk.
We will be returning back to where you park in Cornish street.
Note: This walk will take around 1.5hrs returning back to the parked cars.
