description:
NZIFF: Young Mothers, The Dardenne brothers return with a deeply affecting drama exploring the lives of five teen mothers. Hopes and fears steer the young women towards bettering their lives for themselves and their children.

Young Mothers examines the lives of underprivileged teenagers as they come to terms with motherhood for the first time. Living together temporarily in a group home, they are taught how to care for their babies, while grappling with very different personal circumstances. The Dardenne brothers treat the characters with delicate respect while humanising the tumultuous reality that often comes with teenage motherhood.

Jessica, raised in an orphanage, cannot imagine abandoning her child and desperately seeks closure from her birth mother. Julie considers giving up her daughter for adoption, yet her own troubled mother wishes to raise the child to atone for her past mistakes. Brought up by an alcoholic mother, Perla dreams of a stable family, but her delinquent boyfriend wants nothing to do with her or their child. While Ariane has the privilege of a loving partner, both are recovering drug addicts which presents its own challenges.

This is a story of hope told through characters looking for a future free from their past. — Madison Marshall
label: Film & Media

description:
Pike River: Wellington Brass Fundraiser, We’re excited to invite you to a special advanced screening of the powerful new film Pike River. This exclusive preview is a fundraiser to support Wellington Brass Band as we prepare to represent New Zealand at the World Championships in Kerkrade, Holland.
Pike River: Wellington Brass Fundraiser
Lighthouse Cuba, 29 Wigan St, Wellington
Tuesday 21 October, 5:45pm
General admission: $28.92 each ($25.00 + $3.92 fees) – Book now on Eventfinda
This is a unique opportunity to see the film before its general release. We’re especially proud that the film’s director, Rob Sarkies, and producer, Vicky Pope, have a family connection to our band — their son plays in our Buzzing Brass Youth Band. Vicky will be giving a short introduction before the screening.
We’d love for you to join us for this special night of cinema and music community spirit. Every ticket sold directly helps our journey to the world stage.

description:
Reels for Meals: Wicked: For Good, November's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Wicked: For Good.
Last year’s global cinematic cultural sensation, which became the most successful Broadway film adaptation of all time, now reaches its epic, electrifying, emotional conclusion in Wicked: For Good.
The final chapter of the untold story of the witches of Oz begins with Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) and Glinda (Ariana Grande) estranged and living with the consequences of their choices.
Elphaba, now demonised as The Wicked Witch of the West, lives in exile, hidden within the Ozian forest while continuing her fight for the freedom of Oz’s silenced Animals and desperately trying to expose the truth she knows about The Wizard (Jeff Goldblum).
Glinda, meanwhile, has become the glamorous symbol of Goodness for all of Oz, living at the palace in Emerald City and revelling in the perks of fame and popularity. Under the instruction of Madame Morrible (Michelle Yeoh), Glinda is deployed to serve as an effervescent comfort to Oz, reassuring the masses that all is well under the rule of The Wizard.
As Glinda’s stardom expands and she prepares to marry Prince Fiyero (Jonathan Bailey) in a spectacular Ozian wedding, she is haunted by her separation from Elphaba. She attempts to broker a conciliation between Elphaba and The Wizard, but those efforts will fail, driving Elphaba and Glinda only further apart. The aftershocks will transform Boq (Ethan Slater) and Fiyero forever, and threaten the safety of Elphaba’s sister, Nessarose (Marissa Bode), when a girl from Kansas comes crashing into all their lives.
As an angry mob rises against the Wicked Witch, Glinda and Elphaba will need to come together one final time. With their singular friendship now the fulcrum of their futures, they will need to truly see each other, with honesty and empathy, if they are to change themselves, and all of Oz, for good.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

description:
Reels for Meals: Prime Minister, September's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Prime Minister.
In August 2017, in the lead-up to national elections, Jacinda Ardern unexpectedly became New Zealand’s opposition party leader. She had just turned 37. Two frenetic months later, she was Prime Minister. Just before the final vote was in, she discovered she was pregnant. She would become only the second head of state in history to give birth while in office.
Ardern quickly became one of the most recognisable leaders in the world. She drew global attention from people craving a sensitive and compassionate approach to the critical issues of our time. In private, she struggled with being a mother and proving herself to a public skeptical of women’s leadership. A series of crises - the Christchurch massacre, pandemic lockdowns, and disinformation-fueled protests outside Parliament - would test that leadership and the feminine touch she brought to it. She resigned from office in January 2023, shocking her supporters and critics alike.
Going behind the scenes of her administration and her private life, Prime Minister follows Jacinda for seven years as she is catapulted to the top of New Zealand politics, becomes a feminist political icon, resigns suddenly from office and continues to champion the fight against isolationism, fear, and the distortion of truth. Intimate home footage shot by her husband and audio interviews that Jacinda did while in office give us unparalleled access. Along with in-depth contemporaneous interviews, these form the emotional backbone of the story, giving viewers an unfiltered window into her years in power.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

description:
Reels for Meals: Rocky Horror Picture Show 50th Anniversary Re-Release, October's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Rocky Horror Picture Show 50th Anniversary Re-Release.
The cult classic returns in a stunning new 4K restoration for its landmark anniversary.
Based on the stage musical by Richard O’Brien, The Rocky Horror Picture Show shattered conventions with its bold characters, flamboyant style, and infectious rock ’n’ roll soundtrack.
When a newly engaged couple’s (Barry Bostwick and Susan Sarandon) car breaks down on a rainy night, they wind up in the creepy castle of Dr. Frank-N-Furter (Tim Curry). There, they have an adventure that will thrill you, chill you and fulfil you like never before!

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
label: Film & Media

description:
Brazilian Zouk - Abertura & Soltinho Variations, Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block E (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block E you will get an Variations on Abertura and Soltinho as well as some exercises on Personal body movement technique.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpE
===Location:
Classes are in Footnote dance studio, 60 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)
label: Classes & Workshops

In the flush of news coverage of Tom's seemingly heroic actions, a threatening stranger named Carl Fogarty (Ed Harris) comes to town, fingering the unassuming family man as long-missing Philadelphia mobster Joey Cusack. To the horror of his wife, Edie (Maria Bello), and teenage son, Jack (Ashton Holmes), Tom finds he must confront his violent past

description:
Sophie Thorn – Victoria University Photography Collection, A tour of the photographs from Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection
Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington holds a nationally significant collection of works of art which is under the care of Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery. Known as Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka, or 'the feathers which adorn the waka', over half of this collection can be found on display in the various buildings on the university campuses at any one time.
For this special outing, join the gallery’s Kaiwhakarākei, Curator Collections, Sophie Thorn, for an afterhours tour of the Hunter Building focusing on the photography in the collection.
We will see photographic works by Lucien Rizos, Ans Westra, Peter Preyer, Joyce Campbell, Fiona Pardington, Ann Noble and Chris Corson Scott.
We are meeting at the foyer of the Hunter Building. This is the big set of glass doors off gate 2 between the two sets of lights on Kelburn Parade.
As the tour begins at 6pm we would suggest,that people park in the Hunter Building carpark (coming in Gate 1 (right at the bend between Salamanca Road and Kelburn Parade). While these are reserved spaces for staff after 5:30pm parking is a bit of a free-for-all on campus after hours.
Thursday, 11 September, 6:00pm start, Meet at Hunter Building (Main Entrance off Kelburn Parade)
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, MAMIL 2: GOMIL
The Lycra is back: GOMIL – the hilarious new sequel to MAMIL hits the road across New Zealand!

One of New Zealand’s biggest theatrical success stories is back in the saddle! Following the phenomenal popularity of MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra), which played to over 70,000 people across the country, comes its laugh-out-loud sequel: GOMIL – Grumpy Old Man in Lycra. And this time, it's going national.

From the comedic genius of writer and director Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman) and starring Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG), GOMIL is primed to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s mid-life absurdities to 14 cities throughout New Zealand in a major national tour kicking off this September.

After a critically acclaimed, sold-out debut season in Ōtautahi Christchurch, GOMIL is shifting gears and going full speed ahead across Aotearoa. Audiences who laughed (and winced) along with the unforgettable antics in MAMIL will now follow the journey of our favourite cyclist as he faces a new life stage: grumpier, greyer, and still clad in way too much Lycra.

Hadlow, one of the country’s most beloved performers, reprises his role with impeccable comic timing and emotional depth, bringing to life a story that’s not only hilarious, but also touching, timely, and unashamedly relatable.

Whether you're a weekend warrior, a reluctant spouse, or just someone who enjoys watching others sweat the small (and stretchy) stuff, GOMIL is a must-see. This show digs deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, family, and the undeniable need to keep moving—no matter how creaky your knees may be.

Get ready to laugh, reflect, and maybe even wince in recognition as GOMIL pedals its way across the country this spring. It’s more than a show—it’s a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.

Don’t miss the next chapter in this iconic Kiwi comedy saga. GOMIL is coming to a theatre near you - lycra, laughter and all.

--
For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email or call 04)9740535 during office hours.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Silent Movies LIVE' at the Central Hawke's Bay Museum, As a part of the national tour with Chamber Music New Zealand, the team from ‘The Old Dairy Factory’,
bring three movies to life: 'The Kid', 'The Pawn Shop' and 'A Dog’s Life', all with new fresh music of today, composed by David Selfe.
This magical fusion of cinema and live performance transcends generations, offering both nostalgic
charm and contemporary artistry. The Central Hawke’s Bay Museum provides an intimate, historic
setting for this unforgettable evening where timeless humor meets world-class musicianship.
Witness Chaplin’s genius as you’ve never experienced before - through the alchemy of silent film and the thrilling immediacy of live music.
This event is part of The Spring Fling Festival - a series of standout events through September and October, capturing the essence of springtime in Central Hawke's Bay!
Spring Fling events span from Ōtāne to Takapau, Tikokino to Pōrangahau, and offer plenty of variety for visitors to experience the very best Central Hawke's Bay.
However, you choose to enjoy the Spring Fling, we look forward to hosting you in this beautiful part of Hawke's Bay, with warm Central Hawke's Bay hospitality.

description:
OdESSA - Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show, Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show Oct 26th 5pm San Fran

Two decades ago, OdESSA kicked in the back door of the New Zealand
mainstream with their explosive debut Oak Park Avenue – a landmark
Indie-Funk record stacked with classics such as Bring The Money
Back, Baby Don’t Go Home, Promises Promises, Sugarpop, and I Could
Beat You In A Fight, the album captured the raw energy and swagger
of a band unafraid to push boundaries.

Now, 20 years later, OdESSA are back to celebrate the album that
started it all. On Labour Weekend, the band will take the stage at
Wellington’s iconic San Fran for a family-friendly early show,
performing Oak Park Avenue in full – plus a few surprises from their
wider catalogue. Expect high-octane grooves, infectious hooks, and the
kind of live energy that made OdESSA one of Aotearoa’s most beloved
live acts.

Joining them for this milestone event are rising stars of New Zealand’s
alt-pop scene Love Party. Known for their electrifying performances,
Love Party are the perfect complement to OdESSA’s funk-fueled legacy
– bringing fresh fire to a night that promises to be unforgettable.

Whether you were there in 2005 or discovering OdESSA for the first
time, this is a celebration of New Zealand music history you won’t
want to miss.

Tickets available now from moshtix.co.nz.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Show me the shorts - Aotearoa, New Zealand filmmakers are known for their iconic coming-of-age stories, lush farmland locations and rich cultural traditions. They are also celebrated for their innovative world-building and bold, original ideas.
The short films in this collection demonstrate all of that and more. Classic Kiwi actors Rawiri Paratene, Ginette McDonald, Nathanial Lees and Katlyn Wong headline.
Meanwhile magical realism and science fiction worlds creep into the lexicon of Aotearoa.
Run time: 99 min
Rating: M - Offensive language, domestic violence themes & suicide themes.

description:
Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network, Join Arts Access Aotearoa for a powerful evening of film and purpose as we screen the critically acclaimed movie Sing Sing — based on a true story of redemption, creativity and the transformative power of the arts within the prison system.
Sing Sing tells the story of incarcerated men who find hope and humanity through a prison theatre programme. It reflects the values Arts Access Aotearoa upholds: that the arts can break down walls, build confidence and create change, inside and out.
Tickets are $25 and proceeds support the Arts in Corrections Network.
Before the screening, you will hear from actor, playwright and musician Jamie McCaskill (of the Māori Sidesteps musical comedy group), and playwright and columnist Dave Armstrong. Together, they led a powerful theatre and storytelling course at Whanganui Prison, supporting and transformation behind the wire.
Come along and support us to continue this important work.
About Arts in Corrections
Arts programmes in prisons can be powerful pathways to healing and change. They help people restore their sense of identity, build resilience and develop skills that support rehabilitation and reintegration into the community. By nurturing creative potential and cultural identity these programmes foster personal transformation.
Arts Access Aotearoa leads a national network that supports Corrections staff and community educators and groups to design and deliver meaningful arts programmes in prisons and Community Corrections..
label: Film & Media

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE LONG WALK (NZ Premiere - Wellington), How far could you go? Be the first in New Zealand see the stunning new dystopian thriller/horror THE LONG WALK – from the mind of Stephen King.
“A group of teenage boys compete in an annual contest known as The Long Walk, and keep walking faster than three miles per hour — or risk being shot.”
Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand
Directed by Francis Lawrence, THE LONG WALK stars Cooper Hoffman (‘Licorice Pizza’, ’Saturday Night’), David Johnson (‘Alien: Romulus’), Garrett Wareing (‘Dead Sea’), Judy Greer (‘Halloween’), and Mark Hamill (‘Star Wars’).
Huge thanks to the team at StudioCanal NZ for this exclusive.
label: Film & Media

description:
Healthy Hospo Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo - Christchurch, Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo
Get peak season ready — with tools to take back control of stress.
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and even serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for performance, resilience, and wellbeing?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, there’s no better time to reset and equip yourself with tools that help you stay calm, focused, and in control. No matter how busy it gets.
At Healthy Hospo, we know the pressure this industry faces. That’s why we’re bringing you an interactive session designed to help you and your teams:
·       Understand the science of stress (and how it can work for you)
·       Experience guided breathwork to reset your body and mind
·       Walk away with practical tools you can use in everyday hospo life
Join us for a 2-hour interactive workshop with our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, and discover how to transform stress from something that drains you into something that fuels you.
Yoga mats provided.
What you need to bring:
·       A notebook.
·       A pen.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $35 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited, and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz, Join us for a fun night of trivia and drinks at The Lot fundraiser Pub Quiz - let's raise some money together!

We are a bunch of Maessey University students and we need you help to fund our third year student film The Lot.

The film follows Riley and her boyfriend Jay, as they attempt to purchase snacks for a party. However, their arrogance and lack of communication turns a simple task into the unraveling of their relationship.
The film is a comical narrative that pokes fun at miscommunication and microaggression, and ends (literally) in a big mess. I hope audiences are able to share a laugh and see a bit of themselves in the characters: whether it’s the cashier who’s just trying to make it through his shift, or the partner who’s completely had it with their relationship.

Synopsis: Dramatic comedy that introduces us to Nelsito, a 16-year-old autistic boy. After running away from home, he is the victim of a car accident. From his stretcher and through his imaginary pen, Nelsito reveals the dark and hidden side of all those he lives with and those around him: perverse children, murderous women, adorable swindling girls… Now recovered, Nelsito returns home. There we will meet those same characters, now simple neighbours, real, everyday people, but which are the real ones, those common mortals or the ones he has imagined?

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
LEAO and Romi Wrights, LEAO and Romi Wrights
This October, two of Aotearoa’s brightest talents come together for a one-night-only double headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
On Saturday, October 18th, 60s soul, funk, and R&B revivalists Romi Wrights & the Commotions join forces with fellow "niu-wave" sonic explorers LEAO for their debut headline performances in the capital.
Don’t miss this celebration of era-blending, electrifying Pacific journeys through sound.
🎟 Tickets on sale Friday August 1 at meow.nz


LEAO
Formed from a Pacific heart, LEAO is a Samoan musical project led byguitarist/vocalist David Feauai-Afaese, joined by bassistNavakatoa Tekela-Pule, Hawaiian-steel guitarist Levi Gemmell, and drummer Larsen Tito-Taylor.
With a deep adoration for Pacific musical reference points and a desire to explore new sonic ground, LEAO synthesises non-traditional tonalities with a fa‘asamoa spirit, creating
what some have called “niu wave” and “Pacific neo-psychedelia.”
A creative enigma and phenomenal live act since the release of their critically acclaimed debut GHOST ROADS in 2019, LEAO has continued to expand its vision with the 2024 single TAEAO / MEA UMA - a sparkling glimpse into a significant body of alternative Pacific music currently in development. The group is now actively
working towards the release of a new full-length album, deepening their bold contribution to contemporary Pacific sound.


Romi Wrights
Although she grew up on the sensibilities of US RnB and Hip-hop, when the Tokelauan singer-songwriter Romi Wrights shares her voice, it’s hard not to feel transported back to the spirit of the late 1960s soul/funk era by her incandescent melodies and stirring
stories of love, loss and the confusion that lies in between. Raised between Porirua and the Hutt Valley, Romi started writing diaristic poetry at age eight before beginning to set her words to music during her teenage years.

After finishing high school, she moved to Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland) to study music at the EXCEL School of Performing Arts and pursue her dreams of being a singer. Several years later she formed the gospel, funk and soul band The Elected, who spent three years performing at venues like Portland Public House, Kings Arms and Golden Dawn.

Since 2021, she has been working alongside Mānuka Recordings co-founder Kenny Sterling and a cast of session musicians and backing vocalists, including Julien Dyne, Cory Champion, Olivia Wilding, JY Lee. In December 2023, Wrights opened for soul legend Lee Fields, at the Hollywood Avondale, and has since performed twice at Pōneke
festival CubaDupa. Via Mānuka Recordings, she has released 3 singles; Bring It Back, Without You and Capsized and has an album scheduled for release
mid to late 2025.

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presenTs Rochelle (2024) + Bellbird (2019), Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) & BELLBIRD (2019) – Double Bill | Wairarapa Cinematheque

Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) SHORT FILM
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.

BELLBIRD (2019) FEATURE FILM
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.

Tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night (28 September 2025), you’re covered — just show your card at the door.

Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.

description:
War on Drugs Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the War on Drugs in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of "On the President's Orders" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS THE WAR ON DRUGS?
Spearheaded by the former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, the War on Drugs is a violent anti-drug campaign which killed nearly 30,000 Filipinos, most of which were urban poor (Karapatan, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch).
WHAT ARE EXTRAJUDICIAL KILLINGS?
"Extrajudicial killings, or extrajudicial executions, happen when someone in an official position deliberately kills a person without any legal process" (World Organisation Against Torture).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the War on Drugs, wants to share their experience during the War on Drugs (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

description:
Women's Adventure Film Tour 2025 presented by Mountain Designs - Wellington, Presented by Mountain Designs, the Women’s Adventure Film Tour® (WAFT) returns for its 9th year, celebrating extraordinary women and their thrilling adventures. This year’s line-up features an inspiring collection of short films that highlight stories of courage, connection, and pushing beyond personal limits. From mountain peaks to ocean waves, and from the everyday to the extreme, these films showcase women from all walks of life pursuing their definition of adventure.
Each film has been carefully chosen to show women achieving their personally adventurous goals. Adventure doesn’t always mean being the fastest, going the highest, or doing the most extreme things. For most of us, adventure is about stepping outside our comfort zone and climbing our own Everest. The Women’s Adventure Film Tour shines a light on real stories of women from a variety of cultures and sports around the world, creating an empowering and uplifting experience for audiences.
The Women’s Adventure Film Tour® is an official part of Jean Hailes for Women’s Health – Women’s Health Week, proudly presented by Mountain Designs and supported by Nalgene, Sea to Summit, Capital Brewing, PETZL, Osprey and Big White.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā, Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā
Get your tickets here - https://events.humanitix.com/wtb-fundraiser-screening-of-tina

Join us for this special screening of this award winning Aotearoa-made film - Tinā (2024). If you missed it in the cinemas the first time round, you can now watch it from the comfort of the Newtown Community Centre!

Doors open at 5pm
Film starts at 6pm (running time is 2 hours 4 minutes)

Tickets are just $25 waged / $20 unwaged (all tickets include snacks) and proceeds go toward keeping your Timebank in operation.

About the film:
Award-winning writer/director Miki Magasiva (The Panthers, We Are Still Here) makes his feature debut with Tinā (Samoan for "mother"). Samoan music teacher Mareta (Anapela Polataivao) is plunged into grief after losing her daughter in the Christchurch quakes. Mareta takes a relieving role at an elite private school, where she inspires her students to perform at a big choral competition. In the trailer Mareta faces a condescending interview at Saint Francis, and her growing relationship with "spoiled, rich kids" annoys a family member. Tinā was chosen to open the 2024 Hawai’i International Film Festival.

The Guardian says "It’s a big-hearted tear-jerker about the power of art – and it’s already breaking records in its home country, where it’s received the widest-ever release for a local film and become the sixth-highest grossing New Zealand film of all time."

This film is rated M (contains violence, offensive language and suicide references).

description:
Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā, Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā
Get your tickets here - https://events.humanitix.com/wtb-fundraiser-screening-of-tina

Join us for this special screening of this award winning Aotearoa-made film - Tinā (2024). If you missed it in the cinemas the first time round, you can now watch it from the comfort of the Newtown Community Centre!

Doors open at 5pm
Film starts at 6pm (running time is 2 hours 4 minutes)

Tickets are just $25 waged / $20 unwaged (all tickets include snacks) and proceeds go toward keeping your Timebank in operation.

About the film:
Award-winning writer/director Miki Magasiva (The Panthers, We Are Still Here) makes his feature debut with Tinā (Samoan for "mother"). Samoan music teacher Mareta (Anapela Polataivao) is plunged into grief after losing her daughter in the Christchurch quakes. Mareta takes a relieving role at an elite private school, where she inspires her students to perform at a big choral competition. In the trailer Mareta faces a condescending interview at Saint Francis, and her growing relationship with "spoiled, rich kids" annoys a family member. Tinā was chosen to open the 2024 Hawai’i International Film Festival.

The Guardian says "It’s a big-hearted tear-jerker about the power of art – and it’s already breaking records in its home country, where it’s received the widest-ever release for a local film and become the sixth-highest grossing New Zealand film of all time."

This film is rated M (contains violence, offensive language and suicide references).

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival 2025 | SAMARA JOY, Five-time GRAMMY Award-winning vocalist Samara Joy makes her Aotearoa debut at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
At just 25 years old, Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation, redefining 21st century jazz with her rich tone, refined phrasing, and love and understanding of the Great American Songbook.
Since winning the GRAMMY for Best New Artist in 2023 and earning a spot on Forbes 30 Under 30 list, she has sold out major venues and headlined festivals across the globe - from Carnegie Hall to Jazz at the Lincoln Centre.
Joined by her outstanding seven-piece band at the St James Theatre, Joy will perform music from her critically acclaimed new album Portrait - praised as a “true artistic statement” (The Times) - alongside selections from her back catalogue.
Seamlessly blending the elegance of jazz’s golden age with a modern touch, be sure to secure your seats to see the unforgettable Samara Joy.

Yurt Party are back, fresh out of hibernation and revving up for their biggest Spring tour yet - and a special Halloween show at Meow! (dress up if ya feelin spooky!)

The Ōtautahi crew are hitting the road to celebrate their second album 200, bringing the trademark mash-up of Balkan, Latin and Dub that’s turned backyards, clubs and festivals into full-blown dance floors. There's something about their sound that just makes people lose it in the best way possible.

Honestly, if you haven't experienced the chaos of a Yurt Party show, you're missing out. Pure joy, ridiculous energy, and guaranteed sore legs the next day.

Born in Ōtautahi, Yurt Party have become one of Aotearoa’s most loved festival acts, bringing their fusion of Balkan, Latin and Dub to stages at CubaDupa, Electric Avenue, Twisted Frequency, TSB Festival of Lights and countless clubs and theatres around the country. description:
Teaching Well - A supportive school for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), Growing attention to staff wellbeing has resulted in many workplace mental wellbeing initiatives. Nevertheless, the concept of staff wellbeing is rarely well-defined, with programs focusing on either work-related stressors or staff wellness approaches.

As part of a well school, it is just as essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Don't miss out! Discover the key principles of wellbeing and build a sustainable, impactful plan for your staff.

Join this workshop tailored for schools & kura, exploring how to promote staff wellbeing in 2025. Learn the theory and practice of promoting wellbeing in staff!
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Providing resources or assistance programmes to help staff manage job stress is a single element of an extensive staff wellbeing plan. Schools commonly start at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum, creating welfare or wellness plans. Learning the differences between welfare, wellness, and wellbeing approaches, including their strengths and weaknesses, is important.

Meta-evaluations reveal that many workplace mental wellbeing programmes lack efficacy due to not addressing organisational and systemic factors that impact wellbeing. Effective staff wellbeing programmes must respond to staff needs and reflect the school's cultural values and character.
Utilizing collective impact, transformational change theory, and Te Whare Tapa Whā, we introduce a conceptual model outlining the eight pillars essential for a staff wellbeing plan. This model's strength lies in its specificity to different settings or occupations, necessitating an in-depth analysis of work nature, dynamics, and inter-relationships.
Based on insights from past workshops and participant feedback, this workshop now provides a comprehensive template for developing staff wellbeing plans.
This workshop does not offer a pre-packaged wellbeing programme. Research indicates that externally imposed wellbeing programmes have limited efficacy in schools. Effective staff wellbeing plans must be rooted in insights gained from reflective analysis and staff consultations. Notably, the consultation process itself is a key wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 20% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
AN OPPORTUNITY FOR LEARNING WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MENTAL WELLBEING PRACTITIONER AND SUICIDOLOGIST, BARRY TAYLOR
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 37 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs.  He has worked extensively with schools both here and overseas supporting management and staff in the event of a suicide. He wrote the first suicide postvention guidelines for schools in 1990, developed the first national suicide prevention guidelines for schools in Australia in 1999 and reviewed and updated the NZ guidelines in 2010.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 20% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Forest & Bird: Every Last Bird – Birds of Te Araroa Trail, Every Last Bird – Birds of Te Araroa Trail

Book your place now to reserve a chair.

Between November 2023 and March 2024, Te Papa natural history curator Dr Colin Miskelly walked the length of Aotearoa New Zealand on Te Araroa Trail – counting every bird seen or heard along the way. His talk will cover some of the logistics of walking the trail, as well as a summary of the birds encountered. This included looking at what difference (if any) predator trapping had on the abundance of native birds. For a taste of what the talk will cover, see Te Araroa Trail | Te Papa’s Blog.

Colin Miskelly on Mt Crawford, Tararua Ranges:

We're back for another night of house techno disco bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers dancers and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington she started this project in 2024 and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency Kiwiburn Earthbeat Cuba Dupa Arkadien and other events across the country. www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista
www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.

With his formative years spent mixing vinyl studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's producers and musicians in Aotearoa Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival Cuba Dupa Kiwi Burn Little Monsters Insomnia Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub Laughton Kora Pheonix Foundation) Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia Y SorchalulaYoung Gho$t House MD) Cuba Dupa Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne) Cafe Blue (UK) Castros (UK).

description:
9 September Whisky Tasting, Whisky Tasting: 9 September 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
In September, we'll get back on track, away from the International Whiskies of our August tasting, and on to the Eastern Highlands of Scotland: Glendronach.
Named for the valley of the brambles surrounding the distillery, Glendronach was the second distillery to gain a legal whisky license, and is currently under the stewardship of Dr. Rachel Barrie, a legend in the whisky industry. Dr Barrie has recently revamped the Glendronach lineup, and we're going to see how she's doing: we'll try the previous 12 and 15 year--old bottlings against her new releases. She's worked her magic at Ben Riach, and we'll see how she's doing at Glendronach (I suspect quite well!). Additionally, we'll try the highland peated Glendronach, a departure from the familiar smokey peat of Islay. We'll expect a sweeter, softer style, bolstered by some sherry maturation.
Please join me for this wonderful tasting of Glendronachs:
Tuesday, September 9
7:30pm Start time (arrive early to get a beer and a seat)
$60 per person
Seatoun Clubhouse (16 Dundas Street, Seatoun)
See you then,
Matt
Matt & the Clubhouse Team

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

description:
Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever, Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever
STARTS: 1pm, SUNDAY 5 OCT

In 2004, Georgina Beyer, the first openly transgender Member of Parliament in the world, famously confronted members of Destiny Church during the Enough Is Enough rally on the grounds of Parliament.

Never a bystander, Georgina faced down the bigots, telling them straight, “Your hatred is totally intolerable!” This was just one of many significant moments that shaped the life of the extraordinary Georgina Beyer.

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 5 October 2025

Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street

Ends: Vivian Street

Duration: 90 minutes

Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register here: https://walktoursnz.wordpress.com/book/

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

description:
Wairarapa Word - Fiction x 2, Authors Anna Smaill and Carl Shuker, who are wife and husband, will talk about their life as writers, read from their books, and sign copies of their books.
ANNA SMAILL is the author of The Chimes, which was longlisted for the Man Booker Prize, The Violinist in Spring and most recently, Bird Life.
CARL SHUKER is the author of several novels, most recently A Mistake which has been adapted for film, and The Royal Free.

They will be in conversation with PHILIPPA TUCKER, writer, copy editor with takahē magazine, deputy editor with Shepherdess magazine, and Wairarapa Word committee member.

Nau mai haere mai. Koha. All welcome. No reservations required.
Note the venue is located beside Carterton Library & Wairarapa Events Centre

description:

𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝟬𝟰 𝟮𝟯𝟳 𝟭𝟱𝟭𝟭 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗮𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗼𝗿 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗣𝗮̄𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗿𝗲-𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗵𝗮̄𝗻𝗴𝗶 𝗯𝘆 𝟯 𝗢𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗯𝗲𝗿. Be in quick! (Hāngi will not be available to purchase on the day)

$16 for a hāngi. Two options available:
Original: Chicken drumstick and pork belly, heaps of vegetables and stuffing.

50 years ago, Porirua welcomed thousands of marchers from the 1975 Land March. The marchers along with Dame Whine Cooper were welcomed with steaming delicious hangi and the legendary manaakitanga of Ngāti Toa and the Porirua Community before they delivered their message to Parliament.
To honour this significant time of unity and manaakitanga join us for ‘A hāngi to remember’.
Pick up your hangi, enjoy live music and visit the exhibition Not One More Acre: Remembering the 1975 Land March

description:
Always a Bridesmaid, Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.

description:
Arizona Flashback, Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.

description:
Benefit Show For Displaced Children Of Gaza And Ukraine, So, unless you've been living up in the mountains for the past few years, you may have heard there's a few wars happening.

In the past few years, thousands of children been forced by conflict to flee their home countries & seek safety in refugee camps around the world. But many of these camps lack basics like food and water, they also lack resources necessary to continue the children's education like books, I pads and laptops.

So four Wellington bands have united to raise money for these children.

LUNG
S H E
Electric Tapestry
Antu Marama

Newtown Community center on the corner of Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street

$15 online or $20 on the door
All profits will be donated directly to refugee camps for the displaced children of Gaza and Ukraine.
Come down listen to some sick bands and support children in need.

No Alcohol no drugs and be a dick

You can read more about the causes we are supporting here
https://ucap.help/projects/
https://www.pcrf.net/refugee-food-aid

Stay Sick and see you there

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.

description:
Crochet for Calmness, Crochet is great for settling the mind and encouraging relaxation. Learn to do basic stitches, read patterns and complete projects in a relaxed and friendly space – left handers very welcome.

The repetitive movements of crochet help the brain make more serotonin, which can decrease tension and feelings of depression. We’ll move through all the steps from the starting slipknot to reading patterns and diagrams and making your first crochet projects.

You’ll learn to make a granny square, change colours and how to increase and decrease. You’ll also find out more about the notations and abbreviations of crochet stitches so you can make those awesome crochet projects you've been waiting to make!

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Discuss the benefits of crochet for relaxation and alleviation of mood
- Read a basic crochet pattern and recognise crochet terminology
- Choose yarns and hooks for projects
- Use a range of stitches with confidence
- Complete at least one project of your choice (granny square, keychain, garden decoration)

Suitable for all beginners, both left and right-handers and those who may have struggled to learn to crochet. Initial materials provided but bring along any yarn or crochet hooks you may have at home (don’t buy anything until you’ve discussed this with the tutor).

4 weeks, Thu 5:30-7:30pm
Wellington High School
Presented by Monique Lubberink
$129 incl. GST
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK), We’re back for one last jam - and we’re going out with a bang! Join us for an extended party session at Parrotdog, with special guest DJ Audit from Auckland. The last time we teamed up at The Yotty (RIP) in Raglan, it was the stuff of legend. Let’s make it happen again - see you on the dancefloor!
FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format. The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.” Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon. Now based in Bali, FUNKIN’ DONUTS is going global - relaunching with a fresh, dancefloor-focused energy.
Joining us from Tāmaki Makaurau: DJ Audit
Since 1998, Audit has been crafting an eclectic sound that transcends genres while staying rooted in Hip Hop culture. A lifelong record collector and open-format DJ, his sets seamlessly weave Disco, Hip Hop, Soul, Cumbia, and Latin rhythms into vibrant journeys. With decades of experience, a deep appreciation for musical diversity, and an instinct for reading the crowd, Audit creates electric atmospheres that keep the audience moving.
Host with the most: Flex Webster
Flex Webster lives and breathes music. A DJ, producer, and record collector with a career spanning almost three decades, his journey has taken him around the globe. Flex’s sound blends Afrobeat, Latin, Funk, Hip Hop, Reggae, Disco, and House, reflecting the soulful rhythms of the African diaspora. Don’t miss this rare B2B with old mate Audit - your last chance to catch Flex for a while, as he returns to Bali to bring his magic back to the Island of the Gods.

description:
StudyTime NCEA Revision Workshops, The upcoming October school holidays are a golden opportunity. While rest is important, these two weeks can also be used wisely to build momentum, fill knowledge gaps, and reduce stress heading into exam leave.
That’s where our holiday workshops come in. After a hiatus, Inspiration Education, in collaboration with StudyTime, is running NCEA Level 2 and 3 revision workshops from 1-3 October at Wellington Girls’ College.
Each session is two hours long and covers an entire external/topic, giving students the chance to:
Go over all the key content they’ll need for the exam
Learn exactly what the exam will be testing
Pick up strategies for tackling the harder Merit and Excellence questions
Receive a workbook to use in the session and keep for revision afterwards
Ask questions and get support from experienced tutors who’ve been through it all before
Why Attend?
These workshops are designed to:
Fill any gaps in knowledge
Build exam confidence
Kickstart motivation heading into Term 4
Spaces are limited and workshops often sell out quickly. Register now to secure your spot and head into exams feeling prepared, confident, and ready to succeed.

description:
Cheesy Lovers by Le Marché Français, Calling all cheese lovers!
Looking for a fun and original night out for two? Whether it’s a romantic date, a chill evening with a friend, or a cozy family moment, our Cheesy Lovers workshop is the perfect plan
What’s on the menu:
Roll up your sleeves and make two fresh cheeses from scratch, step by step, with our expert cheesemongers
Discover the magic of artisan cheesemaking — milk, love, and a little bit of alchemy

Then, get creative and build your very own cheese platter for two — beautiful and delicious
A full spread of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be waiting for you, along with expert tips on pairing and presentation. And of course… tasting is highly encouraged
It’s an intimate, tasty, hands-on experience for anyone who loves good food, good vibes, and of course... cheese
Hosted in our cozy shop

description:
Battle of the Wine Regions, The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.

description:
Cheesy Lovers, Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
label: Food & Drink

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
label: Food & Drink

Join us at the awards dinner as we hear from the next generation of business leaders, changemakers and disruptors, where we’ll find out who will take home a share of more than $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships and who will be named YES Company of the Year.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 9th Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

In this class, students will work on a variety of different creative projects that could include but are not limited to printmaking, drawing, fabric and paper Arts and mixed media.

All materials provided.

The works featured have been designed and produced by Textile Design students from Ngā Pae Mahutonga (School of Design), College of Creative Arts, Massey University.

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.

description:
Tree Planting at Mangaroa Farms, Tree Planting at Mangaroa Farms
Our native riparian plantings from 2023 have really started to thrive this winter, visible as you drive past the farm, or walking the local farm trail loop.

These native seedlings planted alongside the river, act like living sponges, slowing any farm runoff, filtering nutrients, anchoring soil and shading the water so that beneficial invertebrates & life forms can thrive. Creating cleaner water, richer habitat and less flooding downstream.

Keen to get involved? We have a few tree planting events coming up this season:

🌳 TREE PLANTING DAYS
- Sat 16th Aug 10am - 3pm
- Sat 6th Sep 10am - 3pm with @forestandbirdwellington

EVENT DETAILS
- Meet at 10am, 298 Whitemans Valley Road, Upper Hutt.
- We will walk 5-10mins to our planting site near te Awa o Mangaroa / the Mangaroa river.
- Come for a short time, or a long time, and join us for a kai and refreshments at 2pm after the mahi is complete.

BRING WITH YOU
- A Jacket and warm clothes - be prepared for a range of weather
- Boots or stout shoes
- Gloves - if you have them
- A spade if you have one
- Water bottle

Register at https://store.mangaroa.org/collections/events

#treeplanting #mangaroafarms #riparianplanting #nativetrees #volunteer #alwaysbeplanting

Register for Presale now to get access to tickets first! https://arep.co/t/kingstoncallingpresale-25 🚨

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

description:
2025 Annual South Coast Cleanup, Welcome to the 16th annual South Coast Cleanup, 10:30AM-12:00PM 13th September 2025.
As well as caring for our coasts and oceans, it’s all about community! Join us at any of our cleanup locations for a morning of litter collection and family fun.

WHEN
We kick off at 10:30am on the 13 September. We host clean up sites at 12 locations between Owhiro Bay to Breaker Bay on the Wellington South Coast. All rubbish will be gathered up around 12.15pm and taken to Lyall Bay by the playground to form one huge rubbish mountain that will be collected by the council.

Pitch in for a rubbish pile up at 12:30 at Lyall Bay playground where we will mound up our rubbish and admire our collective efforts! Then we will head to Parrotdog for a drink / kai after!

WHERE
Our fantastic friendly volunteer groups will be scattered along the coastline between Owhiro Bay and Breaker Bay. You can turn up at any of our volunteer sites:

Site 1 - Owhiro Bay hosted by Project Jonah
Site 2 - Dive Wellington hosted by Dive Wellington
Site 3 - Island Bay West hosted by Mountains to Sea and Island Bay Residents Association
Site 4 - Island Bay Snorkel Trail hosted by Friends of Taputeranga
Site 5 - Houghton Bay hosted by Houghton Valley School
Site 6 - Te Raekkaihau Point hosted by Ghost Diving
Site 7 - Lyall Bay West hosted by Underwater Club Wellington
Site 8 - Lyall Bay Central hosted by Lyall Bay Coastal Care
Site 9 - Lyall Bay East hosted by Earth Science NZ (formerly NIWA)
Site 10 - Moa Point hosted by Places for Penguins
Site 11 - Tarakena Bay hosted by Places for Penguins
Site 12 - Breaker Bay hosted by Breaker Bay Residents Association

description:
Hōkai Tahi Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening, We’re inviting you to a cozy night out with heart.
Our Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening is a special fundraiser supporting Hōkai Tahi.
Based in the Wairarapa, Hōkai Tahi walks alongside women and whānau through pregnancy, baby loss, and the early years of parenting - offering time, space, and resources when they are needed most.
Indulge in a delicious 3-course meal (wood-fired pizza included, of course!) with non-alcoholic drinks provided.
A limited bar menu will be available, or feel free to BYO.
Alongside your meal, enjoy live music, a live auction of locally donated treasures, and for those feeling adventurous, a short glow worm walk through the native bush (don’t forget your torch, sturdy shoes, and warm layers - hot water bottles welcome!).
Details:
Watermill Bakery, 33 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth
Saturday 1st November 2025
5:30–8:30pm
$75 per adult - $20 per child (under 14)
Look out for our friendly parking warden in hi-vis on arrival and simply give your name to be guided in.
Please note there’s no reception at the venue, so make any arrangements before you head our way.
Share an evening of great food, live entertainment, and woodland magic - all in support of a truly worthwhile cause.
Every ticket sold helps Hōkai Tahi continue supporting local whānau through life’s most tender moments.

Honeymoon Around Asia, Honeymoon Around Asia: A Love Letter to Flavour
Pack your bags—Chow’s taking you on a romantic getaway through the flavours of Asia (no passport required

This five-course love affair is a journey through Thailand’s fiery passion, Japan’s delicate romance, Vietnam’s garden-fresh charm, Singapore’s bold intensity, and Korea’s comforting soul. Expect an immersive vibe with house & disco beats, passport-style menus, and cheeky photo ops like our “Just Married to Dumplings

description:
Interislander: Pop-up Burger, Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.
