description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！

description:
Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day, Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.
More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip, Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Honouring Te Tiriti: Totes, What does it actually mean to honour Te Tiriti?

Join Te Waka Huia for a three-part workshop where we will unpack our nation’s constitutional founding document and explore practical ways to honour it today.

The session begins with kōrero facilitated by tauiwi (non-Māori) guides Gaayathri Nair and Krissi Smith followed by light manaaki and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975–2025. After the short break, we’ll regroup for a Q&A session and finish with a tote bag-making activity led by Paekākāriki artist Selina Tuomey.

He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition ends Sunday 12 October.




About Gaayathri

Gaayathri Nair is a double diaspora person hailing from the southwest of India via Malaysia and coming to Aotearoa through economic migration in the 1980's under Rogernomics. She grew up in Tāmaki Makaurau and now lives in Te Awakairangi and works in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She is a counsellor and facilitator, novice gardener, passionate knitter, frazzled PhD student, and shares a home with a delightfully awkward greyhound named Kevin.



About Krissi

Krissi Smith is of primarily Scottish (Clans McColl, Ross, Hogarth, Sutherland, Buchanan, Mactavish), Irish and English descent, but she grew up in Te Upoko o te Ika on Taranaki Whānui land. She currently lives in Te Ngaengae in Te Awakairangi, still on Taranaki Whānui land, and close to Waiwhetū. Krissi is a Tiriti educator, an accredited interpreter and translator, and a teacher of te reo Māori. She co-directs Kūwaha Ltd, with two of her besties: Tāwhana Chadwick and Raihānia Tipoki. She's also a māmā to one kid, one step kid, and Nanna to one moko. She has three dogs and five chickens. She loves growing kai and cooking it for people, singing karaoke, and sewing. She's a lover of learning and is getting pretty damn comfortable with not knowing the answers!



About Selina

Selina Tuomey has an Irish father and an English mother. She came to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa for the love of this land and a man. As a child in England, her most cherished possession was an Air New Zealand green, plastic tiki sent to her by her pen friend.

She is a mother to three sixth-generation, beautiful, young Pākehā people. Selina has a Fine Art BA Hons and is all about art and nature, acting, painting, murals, clay play and drawing. She has a love of colour, growing trees, food and going bush. Selina is a mermaid and loves people. He tangata, he tangata, he tangata.

description:
Thorburn 1K - Community Weeding Competition, Kia ora e te whanau!
We kick off the community weeding season with a competition: The Thorburn 1k. Evergreen buckthorn - or Rhamnus alaternus - is a big threat to te taiao on Te Raekaihau. It prevents native plants from establishing by forming dense stands of salt and wind tolerant bushes that grow on steep escarpments. Join us to help remove 1000 of these plants across two weeding sessions! A point schedule helps you to get motivated and compete for the highly coveted Thorburn 1k medal.
Please meet at the intersection of Te Ranga-a-Hiwi and Ruru tracks. We will provide tools and gloves but please bring your own if you have some. We will finish at the Alice Krebs lodge for hot drinks and kai and there will be time for community consultation.
In the event of bad weather forecast, the day will be moved forward to Saturday.

description:
Body Ocean, Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.

Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025
🐹 New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt

Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers breeders and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.
Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club the show features two major events in one day:
🏆 Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
🐾 Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm personality and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor a first-time participant or simply a guinea pig fan this is the perfect opportunity to:
✅ Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
✅ Learn more about cavy care breeds and showing standards.
✅ Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
✅ See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.

📍 Event Details:
Date: Saturday 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish 1 Benzie Avenue Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome with special sections for junior members and pet owners.
With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!

description:
Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
From rooftop beats to undead streets, the weekend is yours. DJs, shots & finales light up Wellington Oct 31 & Nov 1. One wristband.

About this Event

One weekend. Two worlds. Your Halloween story starts here.
The Nightlife & Horde Weekend Pass unlocks entry to both of Wellington’s wildest Halloween crawls:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Friday, October 31st
Zombie Horde Pub Crawl – Saturday, November 1st
Friday night is for the glam. Step into cocktail lounges, rooftop bars, and dance clubs with DJs spinning Halloween remixes and exclusive themed menus. Saturday night is for the horde. Join the undead as the city’s pubs transform into survival zones filled with zombie shots, blood-red cocktails, and a closing party where the living and the undead collide.
Two nights, two vibes — one wristband.





WHY BUY A WEEKEND PASS?
✨ Double the Halloween – Party both Friday & Saturday with one ticket.
🍸 Curated Drink Specials – Classy cocktails Friday, blood-soaked shots Saturday.
🎶 Non-Stop DJs – Hip hop, EDM, party anthems, and spooky remixes across both nights.
🎭 Two Themes, One Crowd – Dress to impress on Friday, then unleash your inner monster on Saturday.
📍 4+ Venues Each Night – From stylish nightlife venues to pub-packed streets, all within walking distance.


HOW THE WEEKEND WORKS
Check-In: Pick up your weekend wristband at the designated start venue (7:30–10:30 PM both nights).
Choose Your Path: Explore any participating bars, pubs, or clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM.
Final Party: Each night ends at a huge closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


WHAT YOUR PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Admission to both Halloween Nightlife Crawl (Friday) + Zombie Horde Crawl (Saturday)
🚫 Skip the cover charges at all participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights 🎶 DJs + live music at every stop
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drinks and specials each night
🕺 Two grand finale parties to close out the weekend


PARTICIPATING VENUES
Venue lists will be announced closer to Halloween. Expect a curated mix of upscale bars and clubs on Friday, and themed pubs and high-energy party spots on Saturday.
This pass is built for the ones who want it all: Friday for style, Saturday for chaos. Get your crew together, plan your costumes, and claim your spot for back-to-back Halloween madness in Wellington.
🚨 Early bird passes start at $25. Space is limited — secure yours before they’re gone.





EVENT TERMS & CONDITIONS
AGE & ID POLICY
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to join.
No ID = no entry, regardless of ticket purchase.
WRISTBANDS & CHECK-IN
Mandatory Wristbands: A wristband is required for venue access. You’ll receive it at the official check-in by presenting your Eventbrite ticket or QR code.
Check-In Deadline: Wristbands must be collected during the posted hours (before 10:30 PM). If you fail to check in on time, you lose access—no refunds.
Proxy Option: If you can’t arrive in time, you may send someone else to pick up your wristband.
VENUE ACCESS & CONDUCT
Schedule Restrictions: Wristbands and drink deals are valid only during the times listed on the Digital Bar List.
Use the Crawl Map: Always review the Digital Crawl Map Link on event day for updates, venue changes, or closures.
Capacity Limits: Some locations may reach max capacity. You may be required to wait or choose an alternate venue.
Venue Rights: Bars reserve the right to refuse entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Security screening still applies even with a wristband.
TICKETS & REFUNDS
Final Sale: All tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable. If the event is canceled with no new date, a refund (minus fees) will be issued automatically.
Rain or Shine: The crawl happens regardless of weather. Venue participation and specials are subject to change without notice.
Arrival Issues: Late check-ins or showing up at the wrong venue are not grounds for refunds.
COSTUMES & BEHAVIOR
Costume Guidelines: No items resembling weapons. Offensive or unsafe costumes may lead to denied entry without refund.
Respect the Crawl: Disorderly conduct, damage to venues, or harassment of staff or other guests will result in removal with no refund.
LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket and participating, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with the event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related harm, and even death.
You fully and forever release and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, partners, contractors, sponsors, employees, volunteers, and all participating venues from any claims, liabilities, or demands connected to your participation—whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, or any other reason.
You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any expenses, damages, or legal costs arising from your actions or involvement.
By attending, you confirm you have read and accepted these terms and conditions. Your participation is voluntary, and this waiver is intended to be as broad and enforceable as the law allows.

description:
Speed Dating 30-43, 40-55, Speed Daters will be split into 2 age groups which will run simultaneously. There will be opportunity to mix with the other group during the break. We will have a private area of the venue for this event. Price includes a drink and delicious food at the break!

When you arrive you will get a name label and your complimentary first drink, and will have time to settle in and mingle a little.

You will be Speed Dating with around 10 people over the course of the evening. You will have 7 minutes to chat to each person.
You then decide if you want to meet your Speed Dates again and tick interested on your form if you do. Only if the feeling is mutual will we email you each other’s contact details.

There will be an intermission where platters of food will be served, and you can buy yourself another drink if you like.

Speed dating does not have to be stressful or frightening; you will be pleasantly surprised how fun and positive it is.

Our event is designed to respect all boundaries and foster open, honest communication. Not everyone you meet will be your type, but we expect you to be polite. You only have to chat to them for seven minutes!

description:
Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom, Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom
Rose McKenzie & Nicole McKinnon - open your world of wellness!

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Come with curiosity—leave with insight, inspiration, and a deeper connection to the sacred rhythms of nature.

Each guest will receive a complimentary bottle of an acute flower essence formula.
My talk will be supported by a powerpoint presentation Email

Second part of the evening ✨

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

In her upcoming talk, Nicole shares how simple, intentional skincare can become a powerful act of self-care and renewal.

Booking Cost: $30 per person

https://www.artandlivingspace.nz/bookings

For further information contact: Nancy 027 276 2786

description:
Slow Grind Fever [AUS] - Wellington Jazz Festival, Express from Melbourne, Australia and crossing international waters for the first time this October, Meow is excited to welcome the slowest, spookiest, smokiest and swingin-est club night Wellington has ever seen: 'Slow Grind Fever'.
For this one-night-only episode of SGF Wellington, founder Richie1250 (106.7 PBS FM) will be joined by fellow Melbourne radio alumnus Dr. Popalotacorn (RRR, 98.1FM Raglan) and Wellington's own belle of the airwaves Miss Juliet (RadioActive.FM Americana)
Slow Grind Fever was born in 2012 when Richie1250 hired a Russian Cultural Centre ballroom and threw a slow dance party for his 30th birthday, and it's been running as a regular monthly club night ever since. Richie and his friends play the slowest, sleaziest, spookiest, sweetest, swinginest old records they can find, and people dance real slow in a haze of smoke and dim red light. It's a good time.
In the last few years Richie has taken Slow Grind Fever on the road, with regular dances in Sydney, Hobart, Darwin and Alice Springs. They post up a monthly Slow Grind Fever mix in the week before the party every month, and have collaborated with Stag-O Lee Records in Germany on a series of Slow Grind Fever LPs and CDs.
Enjoy the music and if you feel so inclined, get down to Slow Grind Fever - Wellington at Meow on Friday 17th October.
Listening to the MP3 mixes is nice, but when you’re in the room all
wrapped up in smoke with the music sizzling right off the old records, through the speakers and into your brain, well, there's nothing quite like it…
http://www.slowgrindfever.com/
https://www.instagram.com/slowgrindfeverclub

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Magical Dragonflies, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Partial Solar Eclipse - Free event, A rare Partial Solar Eclipse will take place as the Sun (Te Rā) rises on the morning of Monday 22 September. Aotearoa New Zealand is one the few places it will be visible. The last one we had was back in November 2012. At maximum, which takes place just after 7:00 am, 66% of the Sun will be covered by the Moon.
To make the most of this opportunity the Wellington Astronomical Society Outreach team will be at the Wellington waterfront with our solar scopes. Solar eclipse glasses will be available to purchase for $2 each. Please bring coins/cash.
Please DO NOT look at the Sun directly or even with sunglasses. You will damage your eyes. If you don't have access to solar glasses, use a pinhole projector or look at the shadows of leaves on the ground.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Planetary Parade - Free event, Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice

description:
Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Disclaimer: Photo not taken at The Pines, but captures the essence of what we expect to the night to be like.. full of laughter.. and lots of loudness..
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Taste of Croatia: Fritule on Sun 24 Aug, Come along this Sunday 24 August at 2-4pm to enjoy fritule, a traditional Dalmatian festive dessert, often cooked at Christmas.
Fritule are one of the most requested recipes we’ve had for Taste of Croatia, so come down this Sunday when Danica Rudelj will be sharing her recipe!
Danica will be making her dough beforehand, which will mean we will have more time to enjoy eating it.
The event picture is of Jamie Oliver’s version.
Let Dave Guerin know if you’re coming to the 24 August session at dave@ed.co.nz or 021 404 334.

description:
Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens, or the monkey in the tree, and did the pears ever ripen? English comic Eddie Izzard has been spinning wildly funny and surreal tales for 35 years. Her huge and devoted fan base is in for a treat as she embarks on a tour. In Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, she reimagines some of her favourite comedy highlights. She delves into material from the touring show The Ambassadors (1993) through to Wunderbar (2019). For the audience, it’s a glorious chance to hear a new take on classic material and hear another new mad-capped twist to the story. As always, with Eddie, there will be unexpected tangents and hilarious interludes. No night will be the same. 
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career. It will be thought-provoking, intelligent and suitably surreal. Who could resist?
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th November 25, Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.
label: Classes & Workshops

Be prepared to be scared! In a fun way! 15 of Wellington's spooky scary musicians are coming together on stage at the Rogue and Vagabond for one night of thrilling frightening electrifying music, arranged and composed by bassist Seth Boy. What you can expect: costumes, dancing, highly skilled musicians, ghosts, fun music, laughter, pumpkins, excellent drink and food selections, skeletons, good times, all of your friends, twists and turns, extra special guest singers, and you!!!

description:
Family Trusts in 2025: what business owners must know, Are Family Trusts still working the way you need them to?
Join us for a complimentary seminar designed for business owners and sole traders who want clarity around the real role of trusts in today’s environment.
We’ll cover:
Recent tax and legal changes impacting trusts
Rising compliance costs (lawyers, accountants, admin)
Common hassles in day-to-day trust operations
Where the tax benefits really lie—and where they don’t
Succession and wealth planning essentials
Asset protection pros and cons
Smarter alternatives for managing business and family wealth
While this seminar focuses on existing trusts, it’s also valuable for those considering establishing one in the future.
Event Details:
📅 Date: Thursday, 7 October
⏰ Time: 9:30am
📍 Location: GoAccounting HQ
🎤 Presenter: Nathan Silcock
Seats are limited - secure your spot today and take the guesswork out of Family Trusts.
label: Business & Networking

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.

John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s, Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s!
A casual meet up of crafters within the rainbow community
New members welcome.
Bring your knitting/crochet/cross stitch/embroidery/crafting/art or just come and have a chat.
Feel free to come partway through the time or leave early as needed.
Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.
Usually gathered around one of the tables in the lounge area upstairs. Often near the walls for the brighter lights to better see our stitches.
There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
Held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month with a summer break.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Stitch a Still Life, Create your own A4 size Still Life with a vase or a bowl containing three dimensional flowers, fruit and /or leaves.
Linen fabric will be available in a range of colours for you to create your own background textured with simple stitches.
A bowl or vase for your flowers and fruit will be appliqued.
Some threads and fabrics will be provided but if you have something special you would like to incorporate into the Still Life you are welcome to bring it along and we can discuss how to best use it. For example, the bowl for the cherries is from an old, embroidered doily and the cherries are red velvet. A piece of lace may look good on the table.
You may not finish completely, but you will have been taught and practised each step.
Advice and options for finishing your piece of work for display will be given.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Special event - Herd Bathing, A Sharing of my horse herd in a unique experience - enjoying being in amongst a gentle herd of horses and sharing the afternoon, just being together.
Join me for a peaceful experience of being among my 8 horses. Soaking up their special presence, enjoying the country sounds while having a moment away from our busy lives. A moment to slow everything down and connect with a horse in a very different way.
(No horse experience necessary. )
This is 1 hour event, after a safety briefing we will enter the herds space, down by the river. There will be seats available or you can bring your own.
$50 per person, max 8 people in one sitting.
You will be in amongst 8 horses so wear appropriate clothing for the weather, and good footwear ie warm jackets and closed shoes/gumboots. Welcome to bring a blanket to keep warm. Will be postponed if weather isn’t suitable.
Looking forward to this

Message me to register
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Massey University Information Evening - Palmerston North campus, Massey University Information Evening - Palmerston North campus
Looking to progress your 2026 study plans? Join us to secure your enrollment, explore alternative careers or upskill your talent.

About this Event

Whether you're a distance or online learner or planning to study on campus, you are invited to join us for an evening of panel discussions, presentations and workshops to steer you on your way to a successful learning journey in 2026.
School Leavers : A step by step session to take you through the course enrolment process to enable you to select your 2026 courses seamlessly (bring your laptop); or if you're still not sure what you're studying with us we'll be sharing what we can offer via distance or campus learning;
Career Changers: How to change careers using your existing degree. Have you been thinking about Nursing, Planning, Social Work or Teaching as the next step in your career? Come along to our presentation to find out how you can begin a new career.
Mature learners and Up-skillers: Thinking about something new for 2026 or building on your current degree into Postgraduate study? We'll be sharing what we can offer via distance or campus learning.
You'll find us in the Social Sciences Lecture Block, Massey University.
Light refreshments will be provided.
label: Education & Learning

description:
NZ Brewers Fest, NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!
Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!

TICKETS ON SALE SOON!

Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!
Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!
New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.
We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.
Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!

Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.
Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
label: Festivals

description:
Suny Siide Up, Suny Siide Up
Step into the industrial heart of Duncans for one unforgettable night where pulsing beats meet craft beer excellence. Our warehouse-style brewing space transforms into an intimate underground dance experience.

This isn't your typical night out – it's a carefully crafted sensory experience where brewing artistry meets electronic soundscapes.

Dance among the fermentation tanks in this uniquely atmospheric setting.

LIMITED CAPACITY: Get in quick as the last show sold out and numbers are strictly limited.

Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/suny-siide-up-september-6th-2025

📍 Location: 4B Sheffield Street, Paraparaumu, KAPITI COAST 5032
🕒 Time: 7pm - midnight
💵 Entry: $20 (online) $25 (door)

Set times:
19:00 - 20:00 Dusa Deep House
20:00 - 20:00 D:UNK House
21:00 - 22:30 Mapper Melodic House
22:30 - 24:00 D/Angelo Melodic Techno

description:
The Haunted Hop | Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl | Friday, October 31st, The Haunted Hop | Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl | Friday, October 31st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Crawl in Wellington on Friday, Oct 31st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event
https://vimeo.com/1111730489?share=copy


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the craziest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join The Haunted Hop - Halloween Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, 2025, and access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, Cavern Club, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're creepy, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be a part of on Halloween night.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your ghouls and take over the city with The Haunted Hop Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Haunted Hop Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and make Halloween a night to remember!


🚨 Get Your Haunted Hop 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this Haunted Hop Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
Cavern Club
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 22 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:





🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀




A SPOOKTACULAR HAUNTED HOP PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
The Wellington Brick Show 2025 (LEGO®), The Wellington Brick Show 2025 (LEGO®)
Wellington's largest display of LEGO® builds is back — and its bigger than ever!

This year, over 150 passionate exhibitors from across the country are coming together to showcase their newest, most mind-blowing LEGO® creations at the Wellington Brick Show 2025. From towering cities to pop culture tributes, from amazing spaceships to fanciful unicorns, we have something to inspire and amaze LEGO® fans of all ages.

When:
Saturday 13th and Sunday 14th September

Where:
Walter Nash Centre in Lower Hutt.

How much:
Adults $10 | Children $7 | Family ticket $28
Door sales will also be available.

More information on www.well-lug.nz/upcoming-events

Low sensory admission:
Wellington Brick Show 2025 has a low sensory hour on Sunday 14th September 9-10am, before the doors open to the public. Low sensory hour tickets are intentionally limited - if you are interested in purchasing, please contact

------------------------------------

The Wellington Brick Show is proudly brought to you by Well-LUG - Wellington LEGO® User Group. We are a group of LEGO® fans of all ages from across the lower half of the North Island. New members are always welcome. Find out more about us at www.well-lug.nz

description:
Tui Express, Tui Express
Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.

Timetable:

Depart Plimmerton 7:45am Return 6:35pm

Depart Paraparaumu 8:25am Return 6:10pm

Depart Otaki 9:15am Return 5:25pm

Depart Levin 9:50am Return 4:55pm

Depart Palmerston North 10:50am Return 4:05pm

Depart Mangatainoka 2:25pm

Please be at your boarding station 10 minutes prior to departure with your tickets ready.

Tickets Prices

From Plimmerton or Paraparaumu: Adult $145. Child (under 16) $85

From Otaki or Levin: Adult $125. Child (under 16) $65

From Palmerston North: Adult $85. Child (under 16) $50

Tui Brewery BBQ Lunch and complementary drink: Adult $45. Child (under 16) $20

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Our carriages may not be suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us at: or 04 233 8131.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

description:
WOW Train VIP Experience ex Christchurch : SOLD OUT, Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing Friday 26 September, 2025

Beginning in Christchurch or Kaikoura, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the pacific coastline aboard the Coastal Pacific WOW Train and Interislander Ferry. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with an accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience, journeying along the coastline and over the strait past marine habitats aboard the Coastal Pacific and Interislander. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with the Gold ticket to see the World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Saturday 27 September and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train aboard the Coastal Pacific (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!) and VIP Ferry journey on the Interislander on 26 September
Onboard WOW entertainment and a goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Whangārei - Wild Viola, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Ōtari Glow Worm Tour, Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.

This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.

Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.

This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/

description:
Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025, Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025
The undead rise in Wellington! Join the Zombie Horde Pub Crawl on Nov. 1 for 4+ pubs, specials, & a monstrous finale!

About this Event


Zombie Horde: Halloween Pub Crawl – Wellington 2025 🧟‍♂️

On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, the undead rise in Wellington. The Zombie Horde Pub Crawl takes you through 4+ pubs and bars, each with their own specials and Halloween themes. Walk with the horde, grab exclusive drinks, and end the night at the ultimate zombie party.




What’s Included
Admission to multiple participating pubs
Crawl wristband for entry & specials
No cover charge at participating venues
Digital crawl map for navigation
DJs and live entertainment at select stops


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the opening pub.
🍺 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Gather at the last venue for the closing zombie party.



Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices increase closer to Halloween.
🧛 Costumes encouraged — whether you’re a fresh zombie, survivor, or something in between, you’ll fit right in.
📍 Venue lineup announced soon. Full details will be available on the Digital Crawl Map on event day.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
Schubert Octet with Aroha String Quartet and Friends, For this programme we are joined by four wonderful guest artists - Nick Walshe (clarinet), Justin Sun (bassoon), Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double bass) - to present a programme enlivened by the varied timbres of wind instruments.

Beginning with the Mozart String Quartet in B-flat K589 we move on to 'Serenata in vano' for Clarinet, Bassoon, Horn, Cello & Double Bass by Danish composer Carl Nielsen. This characterful work depicts a short and unsuccessful attempt at seduction. We finish with Schubert's mighty and virtuosic Octet, a work filled with jaunty dances, singable melodies and heart-rending moments.

Aroha String Quartet:
Haihong Liu & Konstanze Artmann - violins
Zhongxian Jin - viola
Robert Ibell - cello
Acclaimed as demonstrating "accomplished brilliance, soulfulness and sublime intensity in perfect balance and tonal unity" (The Dominion Post), the Aroha String Quartet is firmly established as one of New Zealand's finest chamber music ensembles. Founded in 2004, this versatile Wellington-based quartet is known for its passionate musicality, impressive technique, and multicultural innovation.

Nick Walshe - clarinet
Nick Walshe is a clarinettist, music teacher and arts administrator based in Te Whanganui a Tara/Wellington. He is currently section principal clarinet with Orchestra Wellington, and co-principal clarinet with the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and also maintains a busy studio of clarinet and saxophone students, privately and in high schools.Nick works as a freelance musician for organisations such as the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Stroma New Music Ensemble, and the Capital Theatre Trust.

Justin Sun - bassoon
Justin was born and raised in Canberra, Australia, and began playing the bassoon at age 12. After completing his studies in 2018, he was appointed Principal Bassoon of the Aarhus Symphony Orchestra in Denmark, where he worked for 3 years before being appointed Associate Principal Bassoon of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2021. He has performed as guest principal with many orchestras worldwide, including Sydney Symphony, Australian Opera and Ballet, Scottish Chamber, Royal Philharmonic and BBC Symphony.

Alexander Hambleton - horn
Before joining the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Alex studied and worked in the UK and Sweden.
Alex spent eight years as a member of the Gothenburg Opera Orchestra, in addition to touring and recording with the Swedish Chamber Orchestra.

Oleksandr Gunchenko - double bass
Oleksandr was born in Kiev, Ukraine, where he studied at Lysenko School of Music and Tchaikovsky Conservatory. He became a member of the National Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra at the age of 19 and at the age of 20 gained a position with the National Chamber Orchestra of Ukraine. Oleksandr joined the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2007. He is a member of the contemporary ensemble Stroma, and also regularly performs solo recitals.
