description:
Draw it Out - Re-finding Your Spark, Guided drawings to re-find your spark and what it is that's driving you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making. Materials supplied.

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington
label: Markets & Fairs

Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day, Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day
✨ Erskine Chapel Open Day & Craft Market ✨
📅 Sunday, 2 November 2025 | 10:00am – 3:00pm
📍 Erskine Chapel, 31 Avon Street, Island Bay, Wellington

Nestled high on the hillside in Island Bay, Erskine Chapel is a breathtaking and iconic landmark, with sweeping views across the hills and ocean, and a gothic charm that has captured hearts for generations.

Now in its third year, this much loved annual event returns as part of Heritage Month, celebrating the beauty, history, and cultural significance of one of Wellington’s most treasured buildings.

Foxtail Events and The Wellington Company are once again partnering to open the chapel’s doors for the community, inviting everyone to experience this remarkable space brought back to life.

Join us for a special Community Open Day and Craft Market, where you can:

* Explore a curated market of local artisans and makers
* Discover the chapel’s rich history and stunning architecture
* Enjoy live music, freshly brewed coffee, and delicious baked goods

Whether you're drawn by the history, the creativity, or the peaceful atmosphere, this is a day to celebrate local talent and honour the legacy of a true Wellington landmark.

🗓️ Mark your calendar and don’t miss this enchanting day at Erskine Chapel. A place of stories, memories, and timeless beauty, reawakened for a new generation to enjoy.

Myth busting facts –
installation and warranty requirements

Lazer and Zip models explained, live demonstration of Lazer operation, sequence of operation explained to help with fault-finding
Refreshments will be provided.

description:
Heartland Flyer, Heartland Flyer
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

Fares
Adult (12+yrs) - $139
Child (3-12yrs) - $89
Infant (0-2yrs) - Free

Tickets available at steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/heartland-flyer/

description:
Track Day- 2025, Track Day- 2025
🚗💥 START YOUR ENGINES! 💥🚗

We are beyond excited to announce Forged Development's First Ever Track Day at Manfeild Motorsport Park-Circuit Chris Amon!

📅 SAVE THE DATE: 27th September 2025!

In celebration of our founder and owner, Sameer Kumar’s 40th birthday, we’re kicking things into high gear with an action-packed PlayDay on Track event!
Forged Development, in collaboration with PlayDay on Track, we’ve been working tirelessly to deliver an unforgettable track experience. Whether you're a seasoned track enthusiast or just looking to enjoy a fun day on the tarmac, we’ve got you covered.

What’s in store:

A thrilling day on the iconic Manfeild Motorsport Park.

Designed for all skill levels, with three distinct Speed Groups to ensure a safe, exciting experience for everyone.

Maximum track time with minimal racing traffic, so you can make the most of every lap!

Track Entry Tickets now available:

Show and Shine Entry: Now Live

Spectator entrance free!


Competitor Information:

WOF or Reg aren't required, however 3rd Party insurance is preferred as Forged Development Limited and PlayDay on Track takes no liability for any damages or loss at the event.

What you need to bring: (You will not be allowed on track without the minimum safety requirments)
- Driver’s license
- Overalls (minimum 1 layer Cotton)
- Closed top shoes
- Helmet

Not mandatory however highly recommended:
- Neck Restraints/Hans device
- Fire extinguisher

No passengers unless a full MSNZ approved caged. (Expect in familiarization laps for non-caged vehicles)
Passengers wishing to go in a caged car must sign an indemnity form available from the documentation/registration area.

Garage sheds are on a first come, first serve basis.

Pitlane Garages are available for hire, limited available for purchase along with your ticket.

Vehicle Safety:
Participants are responsible for ensuring their car is safe. This includes:
- No fluid leaks (oil, fuel, coolant, brake fluid)
- Brakes in good working condition with sufficient pad material
- Tires in good health
- Lug nuts torqued to spec; all must be present
- Battery securely mounted
- Seat belts or harnesses in working condition
- No loose items inside the vehicle (tools, bottles, etc.)
You will be asked to sign a self-tech form during registration.

On-Track Rules:
- Passing allowed only in designated zones (straights) and with ownership on the driver overtaking to execute a safe pass.
- No hard-overtaking under braking/corners.
- Yield to faster vehicles; use mirrors frequently.
- If you spin or leave the track, rejoin only when safe or return to the pits.
- When on track, do not leave your vehicle unless if fire.
- Aggressive driving, unsafe behaviour, or reckless manoeuvres (e.g., drifting, tailgating) will result in ejection from the event.
- Obey all flag signals and track officials immediately.
- Pitlane Speed limit: 10 kph
- No tire burnouts, speeding, or aggressive driving in paddock/pit areas.

Weather Policy:
- Track day runs rain or shine unless deemed unsafe by organizers.
- Participants must adjust driving style to suit conditions.

Liability Disclaimer:
- All participants must sign a waiver of liability.
- You are responsible for any damage you cause to your vehicle, other vehicles, or track property.
- The track and organizers are not liable for injuries, mechanical failures, or accidents.

Refunds:
There are no refunds but you can transfer your entry to someone else (You can do this via contacting us directly)

Advertising release:
As a condition of entry, each entrant for themselves, as agent for accompanying adult and as parent or guardian for an accompanying child, grant the event promoter, Forged Development Limited, the exclusive right to photograph, video or film, or portrayal without names or credits as the event promoter may in their absolute discretion think fit.

We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti

Join us for a morning, hosted at Awhi Studio, to give you a chance to de-stress and set yourself up before the peak season.

10.00am: A chilled out yoga session with Julie Sayasane, local Wellinton hospo legend and yoga teacher.
10.45am: A workshop and breathwork session with resident Healthy Hospo Presenter Josh Fankhauser where you’ll learn more about stress and experience the physiological effects of working with the breathe.
11.30am: Relax, and connect with other hospo over Havana Coffee and The Oatery Breakfast Bowls.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $40 per person is fully sponsored.
Yoga Mats are provided but please bring a notebook and pen.
Spaces are limited to 30, and as these are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
Ask an Astrobiologist, Are we alone in the Universe?  Ask a NASA astrobiologist! 
Event Overview
In 2025, we mark a decade of astrobiology in Aotearoa New Zealand—a field of science that asks the biggest questions of all:
How did life begin?
Are we alone in the Universe?
What is our future beyond Earth?
We also mark 150 years of US-NZ scientific partnership. What better way to honour these two milestones than with a public talk by three eminent NASA astrobiologists and science communicators!
Join Dr Sanjoy Som, Dr Graham Lau, and Sarah Marcotte as they tell us about exciting current developments in astrobiology, plus get a chance to ask YOUR burning questions about life, aliens and the Solar System. 
Guest Speakers
🔹 Dr Graham Lau – “The Cosmobiologist”
Dr. Graham Lau, “the Cosmobiologist,” is an astrobiologist, science communicator, and host of NASA’s Ask an Astrobiologist. As Director of Communications at Blue Marble Space, he blends research, outreach, and education, inspiring global audiences. His Arctic geomicrobiology work informs life-detection strategies for Mars, Europa, and beyond.  
🔹 Dr Sanjoy Som
Dr. Sanjoy Som, planetary scientist and founder of the Blue Marble Science Institute of Science, studies planetary environments from early Earth to Mars. His work combines geochemistry, field expeditions, and science communication, fostering global partnerships in astrobiology while inspiring public engagement with the science of planetary habitability.  
🔹 Sarah Marcotte
Sarah Marcotte is NASA STEM Engagement Network lead at JPL, managing the Solar System Ambassadors Program. A specialist in Mars and planetary mission outreach, she makes complex space science engaging for public audiences through events, media, and educational programs.  
Proudly Presented By
New Zealand Astrobiology Network (NZAN)
Victoria University of Wellington
SpacewardBound New Zealand
With generous support from the US Embassy in New Zealand
🎟️ Reserve your seat now and be part of the conversation about life in the Universe!
label: Education & Learning

description:
Wellington Timebank Spring Clothes Swap!, All welcome!
Wellington Timebank will be hosting a fun social event for Spring - a clothes swap! Come along to meet and hang out with other Timebank members, and take this opportunity to sustainably refresh and/or clear out your wardrobe for Spring!
Sunday 19 October
10am-1.30pm
Te Aro Zero Waste Centre
2 Forresters Lane, Te Aro
--
How it works:
10am-11am:
Drop off your clothes/accessories etc to swap (washed and in good condition please!).
We welcome clothes and accessories from/for everyone - including kids clothes and pet clothes (?)!
~ Have a hot drink while our team sort out the clothes
~
11.30am-1.30pm:
Swap is open! Go and get yourself a whole new wardrobe!
--
Timebankers receive 1 time credit for bringing clothes, or spend 1 time credit to pick up some new (to you) clothes (if you do both, it's free!).
Non-timebankers can attend for koha, so please feel free to bring your friends and whānau. And encourage them to join the Timebank
All clothing remaining after the swap will be donated to charity op-shops - Aunty Dana's and Opportunity for Animals.
If you would like to do some baking or volunteer (we need some clothes sorters!) for this event, your support would be very much appreciated! Please send me a message/email me on info@wellingtontimebank.org.nz.

description:
PANEL TALK: BALLROOM CULTURE, Ballroom is a queer subculture. The Ballroom scene today was created by Black and Latinx trans women in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Since then, ballroom has taken over the world with scenes in Europe, Asia, Africa, South America and Oceania.
The Aotearoa Ballroom scene was ignited by Māori and MVPFAFF+ youth in Tāmaki Makaurau over 10 years ago, and has since inspired other leaders across the motu to forge their own Ballroom communities in their respective cities. 
In preparation for The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, hear from influential figures who have made significant contributions to their own scenes. With international Icons and Legends coming to Aotearoa for the first time, there has never been a better time to learn and enhance our own knowledge and experience of Ballroom. 
Featuring ballroom leaders Arturo Mulan (NYC, USA), Matyouz Royalty (Paris, EU), Jaycee Iman (Auckland, NZ), Karamera Marama and Romé Marama.
Panellists
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the International House of Miyake-Mugler) (he/him) is a ballroom Icon and Legend from the beating heart of Ballroom, NYC. Arturo has been involved in Ballroom since 1996 and has established himself as a visionary choreographer and community leader, with the title of NYC father of the international mainstream House of Miyake Mugler. His influence spans competitive wins, global workshops, and has dedicated his time to bringing diverse artistry into ballroom culture, and ballroom culture into diverse arts opportunities; such as Legendary - Season 2 (HBO Max), Brooklyn Nets performances, Cats the Jellicle Ball on Broadway and more.
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the International House of Gorgeous Gucci) (he/she/they) is a ballroom Icon and Legend from the Paris Ballroom scene and is the creator of the ‘Fashion Killa’ category. They discovered voguing and ballroom culture in 2009 during a trip to New York which they believe changed their life. Their impact within ballroom spans several categories: Commentator vs Commentator, Hands Performance, Runway and Fashion categories. Matyouz has become a staple commentator and music artist within the ballroom community, with a repertoire of modelling and influencer opportunities in their resumé.
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman aka Jaycee Tanuvasa (she/her) is an inter-disciplinary Sāmoan artist and choreographer of fa’afafine, femme queen & trans experience. Born and raised in South Auckland, Tāmaki Makaurau, her work is firmly rooted in community as she places autonomy and story sovereignty at the core of each of her projects. She celebrates the fullness of young, queer, brown life and works collaboratively to create empowering and responsive reflections of this across a range of media such as theatre, film and activations.
Founding Mother Karamera Marama (he/they) is an emerging multi-disciplinary, queer and Māori artist professing in Graphic Design, Dance and Performance Arts. They are the Co-Founding Mother of the trailblazing Kiki House of Marama, Co-Director of Pōneke-based queer arts collective OVĀ and member of the Aotearoa Ballroom council. Karamera has been involved in Ballroom since 2020 competing in Performance and Fashion categories and winning numerous grand prizes across Aotearoa & so-called Australia respectfully; most notably within Vogue Fem categories.
Founding Mother Romé Marama (he/him) whakapapa to Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Hineuru, and Ngāti Tūwharetoa. He is an emerging multi-disciplinary performing artist, as well as the Co-Founding Mother of the House of Marama and Co-Founding Director of OVĀ. For the past five years, he has been a prominent figure in Aotearoa Ballroom, both competing and facilitating events. Renowned in the RUNWAY category, Romé has secured multiple Grand Prize titles across Aotearoa and so-called Australia.
Facilitator: Kasi Marama (he/him/barb) 
Kasi Valu ('Eua, Ma'ufanga, Lapaha / Tonga) Full-Time sergeant of Gag city #Barbz Part-Time hater of the Rihanna #Navy and Casual staff member of the #Beyhive. Retired Hater of the #swifties and founding member of Azealia Banks support group. Actor, Writer, and Producer. His work currently centres on the experiences, wit, complexities, and universality of Pacific peoples, all whilst being an all-time fia botz, professional guesser and self-deprecating in this miserable world.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Album Release | Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra, After receiving glowing international reviews for his debut album ‘Questions in Red’, flamboyant saxophonist / multi-instrumentalist Oscar Lavën is excited to release another exciting album, drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof in thrilling new original music, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock & roll saxophone.

Prepare to be swept into a surreal cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous album release not to be missed.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market
✨ Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market! ✨

Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.

As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.

But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.

With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.

Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.

Koha entry. Refreshments available.

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show, It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.


When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
B.M.I : Bad Mōmona Individual (Playreading), Created by Īhaka Martyn. Play read by Kaisa Fa'atui

Tired of having no room for self love? Maybe burning 50kgs in 50 minutes will change that.

Join our inspiring fitness guru as he shows the audience how to shed your ego and excess fat. By utilising the power of manifestation, you too can change your pathetic little impulses. In fact, when was the last time you went to the gym? Maybe you should just skip this show and hit the treadmill instead, yeah?

Filled with self-helpless tips, banging tunes and kōrero hōhonu, this playreading will dissect the fraught relationships we have with our tinana, and where those nasty thoughts are really coming from.

Audience care: Contains body image themes and reference to “Fatphobia.”
label: Arts & Theatre

Queensgate Night Market, What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

description:
Love in Scent, Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

description:
The Casual Dram: 19, It’s time for another Casual Dram, and this time we’ll be taking a look at distillation rates - with double, partial-triple and triple distilled whiskies all making an appearance.
If you’ve ever looked at the flow chart for partial triple distillation, you’ll know that this sort of thing can be pretty complex!
But fear not, I promise we won’t be getting too scientific - and we’ll taste an interesting mix of official and independently bottled crackers, across a multitude of ages from some all-time fave distilleries; Mortlach, Benrinnes, Bunnahabhain and Amrut.
Here’s the lineup…
Bunnahabhain 12 years old 2023 Cask Strength Edition 60.1% (Sherry casks) WB 87.27
Mortlach 'Signatory Symington's Choice' 2007 / 17 years old #205 56.6% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt Finish) WB 88.23
Benrinnes Adelphi 13 years old 55.5% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Hogshead) WB 88.19
Amrut Triparva Triple Distilled 50% (casks as yet unknown) WB 87.19
Mystery whisky WB 88.11
I hope you can join me for another tilt at five tip top drams!

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!, The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!
And now for something completely different…
Prepare yourself for a day of absurd antics, ridiculous competitions, and nonsensical fun as The Bond Store descends into Monty Python–inspired mayhem.

💰 Entry is FREE!
But to join the day’s silliness, games, and glorious nonsense, we will be asking for a donation to Kāpiti Golf for Good – a Lions & Rotary initiative.

👑 Gather your knights, twits, and lumberjacks for:

🕺 The Ministry of Silly Walks Competition

🩸 The Black Knight’s Limb Toss (just a flesh wound)

🎩 The Upper-Class Twit of the Year Race

🐴 The Two-Person Coconut Horse Race

🌲 The Lumberjack Song Karaoke (he’s okay!)

🧠 The Monty Python Quiz (bring your brain, or a dead parrot)

🏆 Prizes to be won, dignity to be lost.

But that’s not all! Beware of French guards at the gate, pop into the Argument Tent (“This isn’t an argument!”), and expect confusion, silliness, and possibly a Spanish Inquisition (though nobody expects that).

Plus: Market stalls and Monty Python–themed drinks at the bar.

Plus Steve Poulton live music from 4.30pm.

So grab your coconuts and gallop to The Bond Store for a day you won’t forget (no matter how hard you try).

Kindly stuff your pockets with good old-fashioned cash (none of that funny monopoly money) to hurl generously at the ‘Golf is Good’ charity in exchange for your entry into the day’s utterly ridiculous games

WE ARE LOOKING FOR TEAMS AND INDIVIDUALS TO ENTER THE EVENTS - IF YOU ARE KEEN - YOU NEED TO BE QUICK:

a BIG THANK YOU!! to Coastlands for sponsoring great prizes for the day!

description:
Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening, The Wellington Rowing Club Annual General Meeting (AGM) and opening of the season will be held on Sunday 24 August 2024, 12 noon, at the WRC Function Centre.
We look forward to seeing you all at the Club at 9:30 for Lotto 8’s (weather permitting).
Following the meetings, a light lunch will be provided. This is also WRC’s opportunity to unveil the Function Space renovations to the membership.

Information about the AGM
The WRC AGM will commence at 12noon, in the WRC Function Centre. There will be provisions for online attendance.
At this year’s AGM, we have several board and committee positions that we will be seeking to fill. Many hands make light work, and we all depend on volunteers to keep the club growing and thriving. A variety of experience levels, skill sets, and perspectives are needed for a well-functioning club.
The positions to be filled this year are:
-Club Captain (2-year term, Officer role)
-Vice President (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Treasurer (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Secretary (2-year term, Officer role)
-3 Committee roles (1-year term, non-Officer role)
-3 Board members (2-year term, Officer role)
Officers of the must consent in writing to being an officer and certify that they are eligible and not disqualified from holding office as described under section 36B of the Charities Act 2005.
The Club by-laws outline the current role descriptions, can be found here, note that the roles can be tailored to suit individuals’ skill sets and experience. Mentoring and support can be provided to develop individuals in these positions.
If you are interested, but have further questions- please reach out to the people holding the current role or any of the board or committee members to discuss.

description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair, Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

description:
AlterCOP30: Climate Fresk Workshop in Wellington, Do you want to be part of the solution to tackle climate change but don’t have the time to become a climate scientist? Join us for a 3-hour interactive workshop to explore the causes and consequences of climate disturbances.
Based on the IPCC report and played by over 2 million people worldwide, this collaborative workshop allows you to understand the key issues of climate change to empower you to take action.
How it works:
The workshop is based on a 42-card game. Each card represents an element, a cause or a consequence of climate change.
In teams, guided by your facilitator, you are encouraged to find the cause-effect relationship between the different components of climate change. Collective intelligence will get you from one deck of card to the next!
This step-by-step reconstruction provides keys to understand the complexity and develop an overview of climate change.
Agenda:
Introduction, 15 mins
Fresk Card Game, 1 1/2 hours
Debrief and Actions, 1 hour 15 mins
Climate Fresk is an excellent opportunity to understand the key elements of climate change and what you can do to be part of the solution. No previous climate knowledge is needed.

Tea, coffee and snacks will be served during the short break. Workshop run by Climate Training Co. Ltd.
Donations are welcome to support climate education and action!
In solidarity with AlterCOP30, this November we’re running a series of climate events across Aotearoa - bringing communities together to learn, connect, and take action for a just and sustainable future.
AlterCOP is a Global Initiative founded by The Matcha Initiative and The Transmutation Principle, locally brought to you by Climate Club, Climate Crew, and Climate Training Co.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Pottery: Evening Classes, This course caters to absolute beginners to advanced abilities in clay. Beginners will be guided through basic hand building techniques, while more experienced potters are encouraged to bring along their ideas and projects for assistance. On day 1 we collectively decide on a few focal techniques for the term, meaning every term will give you different skills to add to your working knowledge of clay. We have 3 potters' wheels, open for use to those who’ve done a prior course on the wheel. ‘

In this course you will:

- Gain a wide working knowledge and understanding of clay hand building, decorating, and basic glazing techniques
- Have the opportunity to work on your own ideas and projects
- Take home a variety of finished and ready to use pieces.
- Have access to equipment, a suitable amount of clay to learn the techniques taught in class (more available for purchase), selection of glazes, fired and finished pieces to take home

Bring an ice cream or used plastic container for collecting your clay scraps

Teenagers must be 16 years or older to attend this course.
label: Classes & Workshops

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans while creating opportunities to engage with Wainuiomata’s community and identity.

description:
Wairarapa Farmers' Market, The Wairarapa Farmers’ Market is held every Saturday from 9am to 1pm (rain or shine!) at the Solway Showgrounds Masterton. Entry is off State Highway 2 or the by pass, onto Judds Rd. There is plenty of car parking and a camping ground for NZMCA Members

Picnic tables are situated underneath the majestic Redwood Tree for you to sit and enjoy a coffee and something to eat while listening to live music. Plus you get to take home quality, delicious produce grown seasonally within the Wairarapa region. It makes for a great morning's outing.

Enjoy breakfast, brunch or lunch and pick up your dinner items with locally produced coffee, eggs, meat, berries, bread, jam, fruit, olive oil, pastries, pies, pickles, slices, cakes, soup, vegetables and more. Shop for plants, seedlings, seaweed, artisan goods including wood turning, Māori weaving, children’s and baby clothes, aprons, peg aprons, tea towels, knitted and crochet toys and hand dyed knitting wools.
Sign up for our regular Wairarapa Farmers' Market newsletter here https://mailchi.mp/d99e1ad65a18/newsletter-sign-up or join us on Facebook to get updates on all the Market goodness! Dogs are welcome to the market and a dog bowl can be provided. See you on Saturday!

"From Paddock to Plate Since 2006"

We will be offering one race, with two distances:
- short race (9 km) = $25 per person, and
- long race (16 km) = $30 per person.
Both races will start at 10am and be open to the following divisions (open, masters, senior masters, golden masters), craft type (W1, W2, W4, and W6) and genders (men, woman and mixed).
This event is open to moderate to experienced kayakers. If you would like to register as a single or double kayaker please email the club email: taitonga41@gmail.com
We welcome you and your whānau to join us for this event.
EVENT SCHEDULE

9.45am: Karakia and race briefing
10.00am: Racing starts

description:
Urban Wine Walk | Pōneke Wellington (NZ), ON SALE TIMES
Presale Access - Thursday 11 September, 12pm NZT - Register Here
General Access - Thursday 11 September, 2pm NZT
----
The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.
HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.
With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!
PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)
*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.
TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)
WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass
EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.
📍 Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
🗓️ When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm
Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!
REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.
GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.
**Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!
----------
Neighbourhood Events Co. recognises the unique role of Māori as Tangata Whenua and embraces Te Tiriti o Waitangi recognising Māori as Tino rangatiratanga of Aotearoa/New Zealand while embracing the three guiding principles of the Treaty – Partnership, Participation and Protection. We will endeavour to implement bicultural policies and practices that incorporate and value Māori cultural concepts, values and practices.

description:
Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th February 2026, Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.

It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton Councilor at Large -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

Hear wonderful stories from our colonial past as well as a reminder of the disruption caused by the construction of Wellington's Urban Motorway. Settlers and Māori were buried in this beautiful heritage cemetery, and their headstones can give us intriguing information.

description:
Other Futures Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is about multi-disciplinary excellence and celebration of our individual and collective voices in new ways. In this episode, anticipate steaming and reverent swing alongside triumphant soul, dark and scenic textures, and dripped-out golden-age hip-hop cuts. We celebrate artistry with dignity, respect and above all, joy. We swing hard. We groove like humanity depends on it. Groove with us at Meow Nui this Wellington Jazz Festival!
=========
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is where musical dreams come alive. It’s about the spark of true individuality, nestled in the art and community of ensemble. The thrill and drama of the showband era re-envisioned for our time. Selections that signify deeper meanings and secret codes. Turntablism sensibility on a symphonic scale. Streamlined, momentous, nimble, angular, adapting, shape-shifting, pulsating with relentless joy and emotion.
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is an ongoing project by Daniel Hayles that looks to honour elements of the big band tradition while platforming music and artists unexplored within the style. Expect to hear distinct flavour in new interpretations of original music from Aotearoa and the world.

2025 Big Bash with Orchestra Wellington, 2025 Big Bash with Orchestra Wellington
✨REGISTRATION IS OPEN!✨

Follow this link to register for the 2025 Big Bash:

Complete the registration form and check your E-mail to receive the link to music PDFs.

ABOUT THE BIG BASH

First held in 2020, Orchestra Wellington's Big Bash is an annual mass play-in event which brings together hundreds of instrumentalists from across the Wellington region in a glorious afternoon of music-making.

Conducted by Orchestra Wellington's Music Director Marc Taddei, together we will rehearse then perform a selection of much-loved works. This year's repertoire includes Tchaikovsky's Romeo & Juliet Fantasy Overture and 1812 Overture!

Anyone is welcome to come along and watch both the rehearsal and the performance entirely for FREE. Rehearsal runs from 1-3pm with the concert starting at 3:30pm.

FOR PARTICIPANTS:
There are some important things to note before you arrive for this year's Big Bash:

👉 Location: Lower Hutt Events Centre at 30c Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010.

👉 Timings: Please arrive no later than 12:45pm. Rehearsal runs from 1-3pm, then a short break before our free concert for community, family, and friends at 3:30pm.

👉 Bring with you: Your instrument(s), a music stand, a pencil, and any mutes or accessories that may be required (as per your part).

👉 This year's repertoire includes Tchaikovsky's Romeo & Juliet Fantasy Overture and 1812 Overture! Complete the registration form and check your E-mail to receive the link to music PDFs.

description:
Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden, Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden
DATE: Sunday Sept 28
TIME: 9:30am-1:30pm
LOCATION: Cobblestones Museum, Greytown
AGES: Over 18
COST: $135 per person. Max 5 people.
Come and have a go at wet-plate collodion photography, using authentic materials to produce your own heirloom image as were made 170 years ago. This almost lost art produces one-of-a-kind images on tin or glass plates, which you create and have an image you’ve crafted to take away.

Brian Scadden will be your instructor for this workshop. Brain has been passionate about photography for over 40 years, beginning his career at the National Film Unit in the 1970s before joining Park Road Post Production as Head of Laboratory, Head of Picture, and Restoration Manager. His work in film sparked an interest in early photographic techniques, prompting him to master wet-plate collodion photography. In 2006, he was invited to assist leading wet-plate experts in the USA and has since taught many New Zealanders this challenging process. Jane, who attended Brian’s workshop in 2014, later married him in 2019 and completed a photographic project in Carterton in 2016.
Although Brian retired in 2015, he returned for short-term assignments at Park Road Post and part-time work at Archive NZ, supporting film archiving until mid-2023. Both Brian and Jane continue to shoot with 35mm and 120mm film using vintage cameras from their collection.

NOTE: Link for booking tickets coming soon.

Email:
www.greytownarttown.com

description:
Aroha Quartet and Friends, The popular Wellington-based Aroha String Quartet (violinists Haihong LIu and Konstanze Artmann. violist Zongxian Jin and cellist Robert Ibell) will be joined by four colleagues from the NZSO and Orchestra Wellington to present a rare performance of Schubert's famous Octet for Wind and Strings. This very substantial work of just under an hour's length has six movements, all of them brimming with warmth, charm and glorious melody. There is a wide variety of tonal colour as each of the instruments in turn shares the limelight, with delightful solo lines from violins, viola, cello, clarinet, bassoon, horn and double-bass. The clarinetist will be Nick Walshe, Justin Sun the bassoonist, joined by Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double-bass).

Also on the programme will be a string quartet by Mozart (No 22 in B flat, K589) and a humorous light-hearted piece by Danish composer Carl Nielsen called "Serenata in Vano" in which a group of musicians attempt. unsuccessfully, to attract the attention of a young woman.

Door sales will be available for this concert, or tickets can be bought from Waikanae New World or Moby Dickens Books in Paraparaumu Beach. For booking enquiries go to www.waikanaemusic.org.nz or phone 021 147 4859.

description:
Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano, Leo Smit - Divertimento

Ginastera - No. 2 from Danzas Argentinas, op. 2 - "Danza de la moza donosa"

Ravel - Sonatine, M. 40, Movement I - Modéré

Schubert - "Lebensstürme," Allegro in A minor, D 947

Amanda Bunting is a graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, completing her Bachelor of Music with Honours in 2019 in solo piano performance with Dr. Jian Liu; small group ensemble with Dr. Rolf Gjelsten; and performance and embodiment studies with Dr. Hamish Robb and Dr. Margaret Medlyn. Prior to that, she completed a Graduate Diploma in Music in performance piano, performance studies, and pedagogy.

After previously studying with Gillian Bibby at the Conservatorium of Music and graduating in 1996, Amanda chose to return to study to further develop performance skills, enhance her own piano performance abilities and to gain further knowledge that can be shared with her piano students. Amanda is an Associate of the Institute of Registered Music Teachers New Zealand, a member of the Wellington Branch and currently works both as a Piano Teacher and a Human Resources Adviser at Victoria University of Wellington.

Kris Zuelicke grew up in a theatrical and musical family, accompanying shows and choirs from high school onwards. In the USA, she gained degrees in Music (BA Miami University) and Music Theory (MA Indiana University) and taught music along with other subjects at the Bloomington Montessori School.

In Karlsruhe, Germany Kris taught at the Landau Montessori School, Berlitz Language School, courses on theatre and music at the Teacher’s College and piano privately. She studied with Annemi Egri and Sariel Maler during this time.

Kris currently teaches in five schools around Wellington, maintains a thriving private piano and cello studio and accompanies students at the New Zealand School of Music. Her most recent degree is in harpsichord performance (DMA NZSM), including study and research in Boston with Mark Kroll. Kris enjoys performing regularly with other musicians, including piano duets, chamber music and has enjoyed projects with Stroma, the Queen’s Closet and a fun stint as a harpsichordist extra in the recently released Time Bandits.

BADGER will be bringing his unique musical approach to Wellington at San Fran on Thursday 11 December, and Auckland at Studio The Venue on Friday 12 December.  

Tickets for all shows go on sale at 11am local time on Tuesday 23 September. 

One NZ customers can be among the first to secure tickets during a 96-hour presale starting Friday 19 September at 10am. Head to one.nz/music. 

My Live Nation members may also secure tickets first in the pre-sale beginning on Monday 22 September at 10am and ends on Tuesday 23 September at 10am. 

For complete tour & ticket information, visit: www.livenation.co.nz

label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brank Bjork Trio: Christchurch, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

Secure your tickets today!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton, Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand's best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables.
Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ's best known folk songwriters. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma­cLean. A guitarist, he is known for both his open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle style and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.
From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing and the perfect foil for Bob's lyrical songs.
Don't miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their footstomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.
Tickets $25 from Eventfinda or book by text to 02102361951
label: Music & Concerts

description:

Feel free to bring a bag lunch to enjoy during the concert. Koha.

description:
Bryn Van Vliet - Wherever You Are Single Release Show, Bryn van Vliet is a Pōneke-based multidisciplinary artist, best known for his work as a saxophonist, his tenure with TOI, and as the creator of the disco collective Boogie Wonderland and the jazz orchestra Brynzilian Big Band. Bryn is a vibrant and dedicated performer who is deeply woven into the Wellington and wider Aotearoa music scene.

An established songwriter and vocalist, Bryn’s songs capture the melancholy of life, with a voice that delivers each lyric with honesty and transparency.

This special performance celebrates the release of his new single, Wherever You Are — a poignant reflection on the cycle of heartbreak, heartache, and the naivety of a former life. It is the first track to be released from his upcoming album and serves as a long-awaited follow-up to his self-titled EP, released in 2019.

Joining Bryn on stage are Callum Allardice (guitar), Leonardo Coghini (keys), Scott Maynard (double/electric bass), and Olivia Campion (drums). Opening the evening is the one and only Iris Little.

If you enjoy poetic songs and thoughtful playing that carry deep meaning and are delivered with grace, join us for this special night celebrating Bryn’s new music.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brant Bjork in Wellington, Brant Bjork in Wellington

🎶 Get Ready for Brant Bjork Live at Valhalla on Thursday, September 25, 2025! 🎶
This is not just a concert—it's a moment you'll talk about for years. Brant Bjork is set to light up Valhalla with their unforgettable sound on Thursday, September 25, 2025. With fan-favorite hits like Lazy Bones, Too Many Chiefs - Not Enough Indians and Automatic Fantastic and 110.4K+ devoted followers, this is the kind of show that leaves you speechless.

With multiple shows on their tour, this event promises to be a high-energy, emotional rollercoaster where Brant Bjork brings their signature style to life. Get ready to dance, sing, and possibly experience a music-induced euphoria (seriously, bring tissues).

Event Details:

📅 Date: Thursday, September 25, 2025
⏰ Time: 8:00 PM
📍 Venue: Valhalla

Expect a live set packed with your favorite tracks and some exclusive surprises you've never heard before. Whether you're here for the iconic bops or just discovering Brant Bjork, you're in for a wild ride.

Why attend? (Uh, that's not even a question)
With over 167.5K+ tuning in every month and viral singles dominating the airwaves, Brant Bjork is at its absolute peak. You're not just attending a concert—you're witnessing greatness.🥰

Tickets are flying—grab yours now!
This is your chance to experience Brant Bjork in their prime. Don't miss out—secure your spot at Brant Bjork in Wellington before the tickets are gone!

description:
Burlesque The Movie: The Burlesque Show, Burlesque The Movie: The Burlesque Show
Step into the lush sanctuary of Whisky & Wood for an evening of glamour, debauchery, and whatever a wagon wheel watusi is.

Our performers will be serving you all the hits from your favourite movie about burlesque that kind of doesn't really have much burlesque in it.
To be clear, this is not a movie screening - it's a feast for the eyes and ears, featuring spellbinding burlesque, draglesque and vocal performances from our multi award-winning cast.

Sweeten the experience by getting dolled up and arriving early to grab drinks and nibbles from the bar!
Doors open at 7pm, show starts at 8pm.
Seating is not allocated, and will be a mix of seats at tables and theater-style seating.

Starring:
Velma Cherry
Robin Yablind
Diamante Doll (Whakatū - Nelson)
Ginger Velour
Tenacious Venom (Papaioea - Palmerston North)
Lou Handsome
Aracella
Shania Came
Tryst'n Oliver-Town
JoJo Bellini
Victor Victorious

Accessibility
The event is held upstairs at Whisky & Wood, with lift access (note there is a small bump as you enter). Staff will be ready to help if needed. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly at .
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington), Celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2025, the Takács Quartet are among the world’s top tier chamber ensembles.
PROGRAMME
* Joseph Haydn | String Quartet in G minor, Op. 74, No. 3 “The Rider”
* Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow
* Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No. 9 in C major, Op. 59 No. 3
ARTISTS
Edward Dusinberre, Violin
Harumi Rhodes, Violin
Richard O’Neill, Viola
András Fejér, Cello
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op. 74, No. 3, known as The Rider – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No. 9, Op. 59 No. 3, Razumovsky.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.
Come in and out of silence
Tone swirling in the balance.
Nothing, then everything
Waving into space.
Then light
And after a longer while
Air.
And now sixteen strings manually animated
Vibrating through time.
Nokuthula Ngwenyama
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Christine Wang and Rachel Thomson -- Violin and Piano, Join us for Ravel's Violin and Piano Sonata No. 2 and de Falla's Suite Populaire Espagnole based on “Siete canciones populares españolas,” along with Ginastera's hauntingly beautiful Pampeana No. 1, Op. 16 - Rhapsody for Violin and Piano.

Christine Wang, violin

Christine has been a member of the second violin section of New Zealand Symphony Orchestra since 2022. She holds a Bachelor of Music from Eastman School of Music and Master of Music at Rice University, studying under Oleh Krysa and Kathleen Winkler respectively. Before coming to New Zealand, Christine was Assistant Concertmaster of San Antonio Symphony and has worked in orchestras in the United States and Australia.

Rachel Thomson, piano

Rachel Thomson was born in Dunedin, New Zealand, and grew up in Wellington where she began her piano studies with her mother. She went on to study with Judith Clark, graduating from Victoria University of Wellington before continuing her studies at the Cleveland Institute of Music in the United States, where she gained a doctorate in piano performance. Rachel regularly performs with some of the country’s leading musicians. She has toured on numerous occasions for Chamber Music New Zealand and is a member of various chamber ensembles including the Koru Trio. She has worked as an orchestral pianist with the NZSO, Orchestra Wellington, and the Christchurch Symphony Orchestra. Rachel is also active as a teacher, adjudicator and accompanist, and is a music examiner for Trinity College London.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Age on the Go 2025, Age on the Go 2025
Organised by Horowhenua District Council, the 2025 Age on the Go Expo is the largest event of its kind in the region, featuring dozens of stalls offering information and education for the hundreds of visitors who attend.

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. The event promotes positive ageing by showcasing activities and services that support good health, connection and wellbeing for older residents.

The expo will take place at the Horowhenua Events Centre, 33 Victoria Street, Levin, from 10am to 2pm.
label: Health & Wellness

description: Scriptwriting with Andrew Thomson | Island Bay Community Centre, Calling all young playwrights and theatre enthusiasts! Perfect your writing skills with Andrew Thomson of The Academy of Dramatic Arts. In this workshop tamariki will work in small groups to write a script based on a one-page prompt. You bring the enthusiasm and creativity, we bring the pencils!
label: Family Friendly

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour
Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder.

Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.

This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”

A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.

With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.

For updates, and behind-the-scenes glimpses, visit www.coletteriversmusic.com or follow @colettemusic on Instagram and Facebook.

Opening for Rivers are artists:

Phil Masters
Phil Lively-Masters is an experienced, well travelled singer songwriter who specialises in writing the sort of Sun Kissed West Coast Laurel Canyon Americana that made Neil Young, Stephen Stills and the Byrds famous. With a powerful, honey soaked voice that has won praise and support slots from legendary American country rock pioneers like The Jayhawks and original cosmic cowboy Steve Young, Phil has 20 years worth of road worn original songs to pull on, including tracks from the critically acclaimed CANYON RYDE album 'Free To Be' and some choice country rock covers to weave a spell on any listener.

Saali Marks
A singer, songwriter, guitarist and multi-instrumentalist, Saali Marks hails originally from the
South Island, but has made Wairarapa his home for the last 20 years, where he lives on a farm
with his family and teaches music at Kuranui College.
Saali has played in numerous bands over the years, in a wide range of styles from proto-punk
to psychedelic dub, covers, originals and fully improvised music with no discernible genre, on
stages throughout Aotearoa since 1991. Currently he fronts the Wellington ska band Battleska
Galactica.
Throughout and alongside it all Saali has indulged his love for songwriting and solo
performing, developing a unique style, rooted in folk and blues, and inspired by greats from
across the decades. A skilled guitarist, Saali rarely plays straight ahead chords, and an
education in jazz has informed his ear for harmony, the beauty of dissonance, tension and
resolution, with unconventional song structures, alternate tunings and intriguing melodies.
Although not adverse to penning the odd love song, most of Saali’s lyrics tend to focus on
other aspects of the human condition, from religion and politics to our relationships with the
environment and our own minds.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert 6 - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble to benefit Kaibosh, Comfy Concert 6 - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble to benefit Kaibosh
Comfy Concert Number 6 � Saturday 20 September, 4 - 6PM
� Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View �
Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music from The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, to benefit Kaibosh Food Rescue.

Location:
