The hall is on the hillside overlooking Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location. You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington
Tāmaki Makaurau jangle rockers Cowboy Dan are releasing their debut full length album; Dreams That Feel Like Falling. The album drops 19 September on streaming & vinyl.

Never overblown or overproduced, Dreams That Feel Like Falling is direct and intimate. 11 tracks of warmth, sincerity and brashness that strike a balance of breeze and overdrive.

To celebrate the release, Cowboy Dan are heading out for a run of shows throughout Te Ika-a-Māui in September and October.

This Te Whanganui-a-Tara will be the second outing in the capital for Cowboy Dan, who are delighted to bring Echo Children along for the ride from Tāmaki to share their special tunes and infectous harmoines, along with Te Whanganui-a-Tara local legends Search For Yeti...STACKED!

Once aptly described as The Bats on the right amount of Red Bull, Cowboy Dan has been treating audiences across the motu to energetic, emotionally charged tunes since 2015. Their live shows have consistently delivered good times to fans and new friends alike.

Off the back of two delightful EPs: We Will Hesitate, When We Eventually Wait (2017, Mixed by Jonathan Pearce); Sentimental Now That We're Leaving (2021, Mixed by Rohan Evans), the debut LP, Dreams That Feel Like Falling, is a continuation and a few steps forward, showcasing the bands expansive sonic pallet, with a mix of distortion, introspection, heart and bite.

Search For Yeti draws from a deep range of influences to create a sound that achieves the difficult feat of being hugely atmospheric and diverse while also being hook laden. This is an act that captures people with their onstage energy — and gets them talking afterwards about the songs that they just heard.

Following in the long tradition of innovative Aotearoa indie bands, Echo Children craft a distinctive sound by melding psychedelic pop harmonies with sharp alt-country songwriting.

Gather your pals and get ready for good times! A thursday, sure, but what a chance to digest some upbeat goodness hailing from the big smoke and with some local goodness to boot.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, Cowboy Dan: Dreams That Feel Like Falling Aotearoa Album Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington
Tāmaki Makaurau jangle rockers Cowboy Dan are releasing their debut full length album; Dreams That Feel Like Falling. The album drops 19 September on streaming & vinyl.

Never overblown or overproduced, Dreams That Feel Like Falling is direct and intimate. 11 tracks of warmth, sincerity and brashness that strike a balance of breeze and overdrive.

To celebrate the release, Cowboy Dan are heading out for a run of shows throughout Te Ika-a-Māui in September and October.

This Te Whanganui-a-Tara will be the second outing in the capital for Cowboy Dan, who are delighted to bring Echo Children along for the ride from Tāmaki to share their special tunes and infectous harmoines, along with Te Whanganui-a-Tara local legends Search For Yeti...STACKED!

description:
Jewellery Making Intensive - Beginners' Workshop, Join us for a fun day learning the skills to make your own jewellery, using sterling silver and copper or brass. All materials included in course fee.

Description
Learn the essential skills and techniques needed to make your own creations. The morning will begin with simple design examples and techniques using specialist jewellers’ tools, working with copper or brass. In the afternoon you will form and craft your own ring from sterling silver.

All materials included in course fee. Please bring pen and paper and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment. Limited to nine participants.
Please note you cannot be late for this one-day course, you must be there from the start of the course when health and safety matters are covered.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Create a silver band
- Demonstrate techniques for soldering sterling silver
- Perform metal forming, piercing and texturing skills
- Use essential jewellery-making tools accurately

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Wholesome Introduction to Foraging + Healthy potluck Wellington, Wholesome Introduction to Foraging + Healthy potluck Wellington
Foraging and Growing Workshops coming to Wellington all the way from Chch. No need for prior knowledge we will learn everything from scratch.
I'm hitchhiking all the way from Chch to Whangarei and back to Chch with a purpose to pass on some knowledge while visiting my dear friends.
Workshop description:

During this workshop we will learn to substitute our salads, teas, seeds for the rest of our lives, save a lot of money while contributing to nature thriving again, with incredible insights all through life while reconnecting with nature everytime a bit more. A contribution to mental and physical wellbeing while having an excuse to go outside, treasure hunting with your family, neighbours, friends or solo💚
No prior knowledge is necessary. Just your enthusiasm to learn, ready ears and ready to try new things and sense of humour😊
We will have a very necessary 30-40min introduction talk with some unique understandings of what plants are, how we can help them and how they can help us. All with good scientific attitude. We will also learn some tools/attitudes to foraging and then walk around and learn about 10-12 plants that can be found nearly in every backyard during this workshop, which out of my experience have proven to be most practical and easiest to remember.
3 hours is a must to do all the above.
_______
Come with your family,friends, neighbours and furry companions, please share this event.
_________
I encourage everyone to walk, cycle or bus to the event as part of the experience and help not to impact the environment. I will have some special gifts for the ones who do 🌻💚
________
Please allow enough time to immerse into the workshop with no rush"
_______
REGISTRATION IS Essential the event is number of registered people dependant.
30$ per person per workshop, 50$ for 2 ppl within a family, children are free, animals are welcome. Volunteers of non profit organization's and community gardeners are welcome to come for free or koha or vegetables/produce from their gardens if you prefer. please indicate upon registration, numbers are limited. Please register here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JDsUTlOZYvF870A1bJ7JNxR5-eGL3tlCX3PZtMRRjV0/viewform

🚶‍♀️ Walk, bike, or bus to the event for a special thank-you gift!
📢 In case of rain, we’ll reschedule to the next available day—keep an eye on the announcements!
🔗 Learn more about my work:
https://www.facebook.com/share/163J1Sccjg/
Registration is essential, helps to keep our events clear, organized and respectful.
Warning: an hour before the workshop we are having a healthy food potluck, bring your cuppas and a spare one in case someone forgets and a healthy food platter to share with others if you re joining. I will have some interesting edibles to share ❤

Also - On the 15th Sunday we will start the day with another highlight workshop - Wild coffee, forage, cook and grow! at 11 - 2pm

+ at 3pm - 5:30 pm grow your own Fungi workshop
Looking forward to seeing you there!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Bloom with Sarah Hodge of Horrobin and Hodge, Join us on Friday, 19 September for a morning of creativity and inspiration with Sarah Hodge of Horrobin and Hodge (horrobinandhodge.co.nz). Discover how she transforms spaces into unforgettable experiences using the beauty of botanical design.
Start your Friday off by connecting with like-minded fellow creatives, enjoy a light breakfast with great coffee, and soak up some inspiration at this free event during our 'Bloom' theme as we enter into spring.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jina (Mahsa) Amini's Third Anniversary - Movie Screening: Reading Lolita in Tehran, On 16 September 2022, Jina (Mahsa) Amini was killed in state custody after her arrest by Islamic Republic's morality police, sparking the Woman, Life, Freedom movement.
Join us for a free community screening to mark the third anniversary of Jina Amini. The Iranian Solidarity Group NZ will screen Reading Lolita in Tehran — a 2024 feature film exploring courage, literature, and resistance in Iran.
Event Details:
• Date: Saturday, 13 September 2025
• Time: Doors open 3:45 pm· Programme begins 4:00 pm· Film starts 4:30 pm (sharp).
• Venue: two/fiftyseven Community Centre
• Address: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington (Entry via 70 Victoria Street)
• Ticket fee: Free
• Film: Reading Lolita in Tehran (feature, approx. 108 minutes)
• Light refreshments will be provided.
 Note: 
We have a one-off online streaming permission for the film. In case of any internet outage on the day, we will screen Parastoo Ahmadi’s Karvansara concert and a previously held panel discussion on "Woman, Life, Freedom: Pathways to Justice.”
label: Film & Media

Dead Kennedys in Wellington, Dead Kennedys in Wellington

🎶 Don't Miss Dead Kennedys Live in Wellington on Wednesday, September 17, 2025! 🎶
Are you ready to experience Dead Kennedys like never before? With chart-topping hits like Police Truck, Holiday in Cambodia and California u00dcber Alles and 835.4K+ devoted fans, Dead Kennedys is taking over Meow Nui this Wednesday, September 17, 2025, and trust us, you don't want to miss this.

With multiple shows lined up, this one ensures to be the ultimate musical experience, where the energy of Dead Kennedys will make you dance, sing, and maybe even cry (in a good way).

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival, Soul, funk, jazz, fusion, rhythm and blues — it’s a celebration of sound across the city this spring. The annual Wellington Jazz Festival is back. The event packs over 100 gigs into five days in venues around the city. 
The festival features two major international acts making exclusive New Zealand debuts. Wellington will see two-time Grammy Award-winning jazz vocalist and bandleader, Gregory Porter and five-time Grammy Award-winning jazz singer, Samara Joy. Gregory Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul, and gospel. His influences include Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole. At just 25 years old, Samara Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation. She’s redefining 21st-century jazz with a rich, mature tone and refined phrasing. 
The treats in the programme continue with Australian First Nations soul singer Bumpy, and a commissioned work by New Zealand/Congolese drummer, composer, and rhythm master  Myele Manzanza. He’ll be performing with international supergroup, lvdf. The Rodger Fox Big Band returns with a tribute to Ray Charles, and the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra has its inaugural performance with a Duke Ellington arrangement of Tchaikovsky’s The Nutcracker Suite. Many of the hospitality venues in Courtenay Place and its surrounding streets are planning intimate jazz gigs across the festival. Follow the sound of saxophones to find a spot to park up for the night.
label: Festivals

description:
Elvis An American Trilogy, ELVIS AN AMERICAN TRILOGY
Presents
ALOHA FROM HAWAII”

Starring 3 best Elvis tribute artists in the world: Steve Michaels, Louis Brown and Arron Walker

Due to overwhelming demand, Elvis: An American Trilogy, the show that embodies the essence of ‘The King’, is coming to NZ. The show that takes the audience on a spellbinding journey through the many eras of the legendary Elvis Presley.

The show begins with Louis Brown who captures the audience with his raw rockabilly sound and signature dance moves.

Arron Walker takes the role of Elvis in his movie years and the ‘68 Comeback Special as he effortlessly recreates the straight-out-of-the-army look and into the black leather, personifying this period with all the songs and sex appeal that was Elvis.

Steve Michaels is also arguably the greatest exponent of Elvis ‘Aloha from Hawaii’-era in the world, the look, the sound, and the moves, combined with the shy and charming Elvis’s disposition will make ‘Elvis and American Trilogy’ THE Elvis show to see in 2025

If you only see one Elvis show in 2025 make it …Elvis: An American Trilogy

description:
Advanced Game Design (ages 8-10), Advanced Game Design (ages 8-10)
Dive into game development these September school holidays!

In this advanced four-hour course run by Joe Chang from Kids Game Dev, tamariki learn about the multi-layered process behind game development, including programming, 3D modelling, game art, animation, and heaps more.

This course is great for tamariki who have already completed 3D Game Design or a similar course, and is also open to novices looking to learn game design from scratch.

Tamariki are encouraged to bring a small packed lunch and a water bottle.

Places are limited and bookings are essential for each tamariki that wishes to take part.

Book now: https://www.capitale.org.nz/event/advanced-game-design-8-10/

Also see our workshop for ages 11-13.
label: Family Friendly

description:
FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK), We’re back for one last jam - and we’re going out with a bang! Join us for an extended party session at Parrotdog, with special guest DJ Audit from Auckland. The last time we teamed up at The Yotty (RIP) in Raglan, it was the stuff of legend. Let’s make it happen again - see you on the dancefloor!
FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format. The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.” Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon. Now based in Bali, FUNKIN’ DONUTS is going global - relaunching with a fresh, dancefloor-focused energy.
Joining us from Tāmaki Makaurau: DJ Audit
Since 1998, Audit has been crafting an eclectic sound that transcends genres while staying rooted in Hip Hop culture. A lifelong record collector and open-format DJ, his sets seamlessly weave Disco, Hip Hop, Soul, Cumbia, and Latin rhythms into vibrant journeys. With decades of experience, a deep appreciation for musical diversity, and an instinct for reading the crowd, Audit creates electric atmospheres that keep the audience moving.
Host with the most: Flex Webster
Flex Webster lives and breathes music. A DJ, producer, and record collector with a career spanning almost three decades, his journey has taken him around the globe. Flex’s sound blends Afrobeat, Latin, Funk, Hip Hop, Reggae, Disco, and House, reflecting the soulful rhythms of the African diaspora. Don’t miss this rare B2B with old mate Audit - your last chance to catch Flex for a while, as he returns to Bali to bring his magic back to the Island of the Gods.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Funky Fridays Vol. 7 - Not My Sister, Libby K, Ben-Jammin, We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K, Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista

www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington, Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform, Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor, where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting, emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo, house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love xx
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic

https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj
BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol, UK, Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl, studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks, he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's, producers and musicians in Aotearoa, Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival, Cuba Dupa, Kiwi Burn, Little Monsters, Insomnia, Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub, Laughton Kora, Pheonix Foundation), Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia, Y, Sorchalula,Young Gho$t, House MD), Cuba Dupa, Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne), Cafe Blue (UK), Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive, comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new, classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
https://soundcloud.com/ben_young_2000
label: Music & Concerts

Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.

description:

description:
Funky Fridays Vol. 7 - Not My Sister, Libby K, Ben-Jammin, We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K, Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista

www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington, Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform, Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor, where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting, emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo, house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love xx
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic

https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj
BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol, UK, Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl, studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks, he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's, producers and musicians in Aotearoa, Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival, Cuba Dupa, Kiwi Burn, Little Monsters, Insomnia, Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub, Laughton Kora, Pheonix Foundation), Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia, Y, Sorchalula,Young Gho$t, House MD), Cuba Dupa, Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne), Cafe Blue (UK), Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive, comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new, classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
https://soundcloud.com/ben_young_2000

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

"This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude"

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz in Martinborough 2025, Big Band Brings Back the Swing
Jazz in Martinborough 2025

Jazz in Martinborough is thrilled to be bringing you the Royal New Zealand Airforce Jazz Orchestra as our feature act on Saturday at the festival for 2025.

“We’re delighted to be able to fill the stage with a full-sized big band of fabulous musicians, and the Town Hall with the fantastic sounds of the big band era,” says Jazz in Martinborough Music Director Lee Quayle.

Jazz in Martinborough is back for their 13th edition during the first weekend in September with ticketed shows on Friday 5th and Saturday 6th and other gigs around town as usual. “The RNZAF Jazz Orchestra will be one of our ticketed gigs, featuring on the Saturday evening,” says Lee. “And on Friday night we invite you to Be Transported back in time to a speak easy club with the superb swing and blues combo that is April’s Fools,” adds Lee.

Staying true to the tradition of swing and improvisation the RNZAF Jazz Orchestra draws on their own rich history dating back to the original ‘swing era’. The Orchestra is a national trailblazer in big band history and features New Zealand compositions, and a classic repertoire from the golden era of big band swing jazz of Ellington and Basie.

The band benefits from a depth of talent that most military bands around the world would only dream of and is made up of Wellington’s most exceptional musicians.

“The line-up will be a who’s who of the Wellington jazz scene,” says Lee. “It’s a while since we had a big band at the festival, so we’re elated to have the Airforce Jazz Orchestra back with us again. They last played at the festival in 2014. Many of the band members have been here since, but not as part of a big band,” says Lee.

Be Transported by April’s Fools
Imagine stepping back in time to a speak easy club. A smoky, dimly lit room where the anticipation is electric but the vibe is laid-back and relaxed. . .

From the stage a jazz swing and blues band begins to play, their instruments blending seamlessly in a harmonious symphony of sound. The rhythm section, with its upright bass and snare drums, lays down a groove that's impossible to resist, while the saxophone punctuates the air with soulful notes.

At. the forefront stands a captivating female singer, her voice rich and velvety, weaving tales of heartache, joy, and everything in between. Her vocal prowess brings both swing and blues to life, effortlessly moving from sultry, slow blues ballads to energetic, foot-tapping swing numbers.

This band doesn't just play music; they create an experience that transports the audience to another era, where the essence of jazz and blues reigns supreme.

Welcome to an evening of superb swing jazz and blues brought to you by the band that is April’s Fools. “We’re absolutely wrapt to be bringing this ultra-talented and experienced combo to the festival,” says Music Director Lee Quayle. “Whenever, and wherever this group of musicians have played reviewers have to search the thesaurus for new superlatives to describe the show, and audiences leave reluctantly, but happy.”

April’s Fools are April Phillips (vocals), Greg Crayford (drums), Zak Dikvert (guitar), Nicholas Bauke-Maunsell (saxophone), Miles Crayford (keyboards) and RoryMacartney (bass). They will be playing at Jazz in Martinborough on Friday 5 September 2025 as the opening of the ticketed festival gigs to be held in the Town Hall.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jake Baxendale: Trio and Quintet, Jake Baxendale: Trio and Quintet
Two new bands featuring saxophonist and composer, Jake Baxendale:

The trio (with Andy Wright and Isaac Smith) has been working on a vibe for the last 3 years and this will be their first gig!

The quintet will be a happy meeting of awesome musical minds (Ruby Solly, Tom Callwood, Dan Beban & Andy Wright), who will play some of Jake's tunes from a new set called "Sky Meets Country".

As featured in the jazz orchestra composer series, these new compositions utilise tools Jake developed for his Gardening Music ensemble: but where that music takes a granular approach to musical cells, simulating the inward posture of grubbing around in the earth, this new work expands outward to capture the feeling of vastness that open landscapes, bush canopies, and wide, blue skies can inspire.

--

Ruby Solly (Waitaha, Kāi Tahu, Kāti Māmoe) is a musician, taonga pūoro practitioner, and writer living in Pōneke. She has played with musicians such as Yo-yo Ma, Whirimako Black, and Marlon Williams, as well as composed for small group and orchestra such as the Auckland Philharmonia. Ruby is currently working on a book exploring the use of taonga pūoro in hauora, which was the focus of her PhD in Public Health.

https://rubysolly.bandcamp.com/album/p-neke

-

Tom Callwood (double bass) is an improvisor and collaborator who has performed throughout NZ and the UK. He’s a regular in the local experimental and popular music scenes with bands including The Phoenix Foundation, Teeth & Devils Gate Outfit.

-

Andy Wright - Fueled by the Exploration of non verbal shifting time space vector energy zones, Andy is a multidisciplinary visual artist, drummer, keyboardist and regular log on the fire of improv at the Pyramid Club.

-

Daniel Beban is a musician and sound artist who performs on a number of different instruments and builds sound sculptures and invented instruments out of found objects and recycled materials.

-

Isaac Smith is a bassist who also works with electronics. After spending several years in Columbo and Sri Lanka, Isaac is currently based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Isaac has a strong commitment to improvisation as a vehicle in the pursuit of awareness and balance.


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

At a young age he became a student of Keith Johnstone, (author of “Impro” and creator of TheatreSports), and a Loose Moose Theatre alumni which saw him through a life as a street performer and cabaret act throughout festivals in Canada, Australia, Europe, and NZ. description:
Karanga taonga, karanga tangata, karanga whenua |Reversing Cultural Amnesia: Activating Māori Practice in Museums, In 1947, Māori leader, politician, and scholar Apirana Ngata spoke to his scholarly peers at the Polynesian Society, announcing his greatest desire to revive Māori culture as a living force within communities, not be relegated to dead exhibits in museums (Ramsden 1948, 85).
This lecture acknowledges the concerns of visionary leaders and champions of cultural practice and their activation within museums. Through her work as a Māori curator, writer, cultural practitioner and post-doctoral researcher, Awhina Tamarapa advocates for cultural restoration as a form of liberation in a museum context. In her research, Tamarapa is exploring strategies for the recovery and reclamation of taonga puoro (singing treasures) and karetao (animated storytellers) for new generations.
There are challenges regarding taonga held by overseas museums. Concepts such as keeping taonga warm, and mana taonga, recognises the connection and authority of descendants to their taonga, that underpin this work.
The focus on the reclamation of Indigenous practice has been bolstered by working with First Nations, Canada BC. Led by Professor Bryony Onciul, University of Exeter, UK, Tamarapa was privileged to be part of a research project “The Future of Indigenous Rights and Responsibilities: Ancestral governance, environmental stewardship, language revival, and cultural vibrancy” funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK.
_________
The Michael Volkerling Lecture series is a partnership event with the Museum and Heritage Studies programme at Te Herenga Waka | Victoria University of Wellington, National Services Te Paerangi and Te Papa Tongarewa. This annual public lecture series recognises the legacy of the late Dr Michael Volkerling who was one of the principal architects of New Zealand's cultural and creative sectors.

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

description:
Messie - *New Show*, Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills, has announced additional dates for the TEETH TOUR, now performing DJ sets in Gisborne and Christchurch, with an additional All Night Long date added in Wellington due to high demand. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’, which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.

Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying All Night Long sets in Auckland and Wellington until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, 13 September, will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, for a sold-out show on 20 September. She’ll return for a second San Fran show on Friday, 26 September, before continuing the TEETH TOUR at Gisborne’s Smash Palace on Friday, 7 November, and Christchurch’s Hide Club on Saturday, 8 November.

MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East already this year, there is no slowing her down.

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Danica Bryant, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Danica Bryant
Danica Bryant is a force to be reckoned with. A pop-folk singer-songwriter with a gritty rock-edge, her music tackles provocative themes from celebrity culture to neurodiversity through an unabashedly queer feminist lens.

Her “playful indie pop” (Rolling Stone) has seen her open for legends like Elton John and Robbie Williams, hit #2 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart with her 2024 release ‘Acid’, and undergo mentorship with Kiwi icon Bic Runga. Bryant has undergone multiple successful New Zealand tours and played festivals including Gardens Magic, Outfield and Cuba Dupa.

With her debut album 'Feast' out this August, Bryant is “venomous yet passionate” (Ambient Light), “cynical but emotional” (NZ Musician), and an unapologetically fresh voice on the pop music scene.


About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors at 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission. As a season pass holder you will be reserved seats near the front of the audience.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

With thanks to support from Creative NZ's Creative Communities Fund administered by Kāpiti Coast District Council.

description:
Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!

September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only

Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard

TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz

PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.

Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.

www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer
www.facebook.com/wormrot
www.swdpresents.com

description:
Niels and the Cartertones an evening of Leonard Cohen, Join us for the special opening night concert of Greytown Art Town weekend. An evening of Leonard Cohen is a collaboration between four extraordinary, Wairarapa-based musicians. They will cover many of Leonard Cohen’s best loved pieces. This performance is an alliance between:
Niels Gedge, fingerstyle guitar and lead vocals, a well-known singer-songwriter on the folk scene, with two albums of original songs. He has also performed extensively in cafes and bars and at events in the UK and throughout NZ. Niels' vocal range is very similar to Leonard Cohen.
Kate Marshall, multi-instrumentalist and vocals. As well as singing in a duo with her partner Bob Cooper-Grundy at clubs, pubs and festivals, Kate is a key member of the much-loved Raven Mavens, the all-woman Boogie/Blues band that plays regularly around the Wellington Region, and beyond.
Bob Cooper-Grundy is an Americana/blues musician who plays finger-picking guitar, mandolin, and slide guitar. Bob has opened for Americana Greats: Guy Clark, Townes van Zandt, Tom Russell, and Jimmy LaFave.
Steve Trotman, vocals and acoustic guitar. Inspired by the bands of the 1950s and 1960s and singer/songwriters, such as James Taylor and Paul Simon, Steve fronted various Wellington groups in the 1970s. He co-founded Verandah Band in the early 2000s, playing a mix of genres in every Wairarapa venue (and beyond) for the past 20-odd years, including Toast Martinborough and Summer Hummer.
The Offering is fully licenced and will be serving snacks and drinks from 6.30pm

description:
Abstract Painting, Abstract painting offers many facets and values. One of the most interesting is its versatility as a means of direct expression.
In this course students will explore the elements that contribute to making this form of expression more effective. The focus will include investigating 'sources of inspiration' as well as:
- Colour and form
- Composition
- Brushwork and materiality

This course is for all levels - beginners to advanced. Basic materials provided.

Monday evenings, 5:30 - 8 pm, 13 October - 8 December.

description:
The Greatest Story - A Group of Wise Teachers Returning, Public Talk & Workshop

Throughout history, especially at times of crisis, great spiritual teachers have emerged to show humanity the next step forward.

According to British artist, author and esotericist Benjamin Creme, a group of such spiritual teachers is now living in the modern world. Maitreya, the World Teacher, and his group The Masters of Wisdom are here - not as religious teachers - to inspire all people to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; and for humanity to act to do the work to share and save our world.

Humanity at spiritual crossroads

Humanity is at crossroads. One path into the future leads to increasing social and economic division, environmental destruction, war and planetary peril. The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.


Maitreya’s priorities

To help humanity in its task of global transformation, Maitreya has formulated certain priorities. They cover the essential needs of all people, every woman, man and child: an adequate supply of food; housing for all; healthcare and education as basic universal rights. Other top priorities include the restoration of the environment and the establishment of peace.

The key to achieving these goals requires a major shift of present mind-set and thinking, structures and systems – and more equitable sharing of the world’s food and resources. To realise humanity is one global family and the planet is a living being. According to Maitreya: “Without sharing, there can be no justice; without justice, there can be no peace; without peace, there can be no future.”

~ followed by short Transmission Meditation session ~

Share International New Zealand. Contact (021) 261 2749
Access - entrance from Raumati Road/ walk - drive past Te Raukura ki Kāpiti / Kāpiti Performing Arts Centre
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Nick Baucke-Maunsell Quintet, Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet — reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York.
The two first played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Programme under the mentorship of the legendary Rodger Fox and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher.
The set will also feature compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.
Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt performance live.

description:
Renaissance Gold - in celebration with Manawatū Sinfonia featuring Bach's Magnificat, Renaissance Gold - in celebration with Manawatū Sinfonia featuring Bach's Magnificat
On Saturday 13 September, at 7.00 pm in the Cathedral of the Holy Spirit on Broadway, PN, the choir under Christine Archer-Lockwood is to be joined by the Manawatu Sinfonia and soloists, Caroline Hickman, Jennifer Little and Lindsay Yeo with choristers Nigel Tongs and Bronté Hodgetts also singing solo in Bach's Magnificat. The Magnificat is a world favourite, arguably Bach's best choral piece that has transcended the ages, celebrating Luke's description of Mary's pregnancy.

In addition, the choir and orchestra perform Ritchie's Then I Understood. When a child of seven to nine, Laura Rangers sketched eight poems centred on summers at Otaki Beach, Ritchie seized the opportunity to add the musical dimension and the result are dual choirs - the Renaissance Singers split - accompanied by the Sinfonia to set off Rangers' delightful insights, so elegantly displayed. The magic that can be childhood.

The concert has a celebratory theme, it being the 50th anniversary of the choir. Thus the inclusion of Forrest's Three Nocturnes that express the wonderment involved when examining the heavens and the universe full of stars. Throughout this piece the percussionists alone from the Sinfonia provide whimsical accompaniment with a celeste providing the heavenly tones - a hit when played on the last occasion the choir sang the piece.

Opening the concert will be Carl Orff's O Fortuna from his popular Carmina Burana. While O Fortuna laments the role of fate it is set in the larger piece that celebrates life with gusto.

With the performers in great form (two choristers just back from singing with the world's best choir) this concert will no doubt build the sense of celebration - full of life and wonderment.

General Admission $25, Concession $20, Secondary School $15,
Under 13 Free.
label: Music & Concerts

Raise your glass to Halloween in Wellington! The Beer & Spirits Crawl brings cocktails, craft beer, costumes, and DJs on November 1st.

About this Event

🍺🥃 BEER & SPIRITS: HALLOWEEN BOOZE CRAWL 2025 – Wellington 🥃🍺 Halloween Saturday in Wellington is about to get boozier. The Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl is your pass to explore the city’s best pubs, breweries, and nightlife spots in one epic night of costumes, cocktails, and craft beer.
On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, hundreds of party-ready crawlers will gather to toast the spookiest night of the year. From seasonal ales and spiced lagers to spooky-themed shots and signature cocktails, every stop on the crawl will be serving something worth raising a glass to.



EVENT HIGHLIGHTS
🥃 Beer + Spirits Combo: Enjoy the best of both worlds with craft beer options and premium cocktails at every venue.
🎶 Live Music & DJs: Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-worthy beats all night long.
📍 Venues: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3 — hand-picked Wellington bars and breweries offering exclusive specials for crawl guests.
🎟 Your Ticket Includes: Wristband for entry, drink specials at each stop, and access to the official crawl map.

HOW TO JOIN THE FUN
1️⃣ Check-In: Pick up your wristband at the starting venue between 7:30–10:30 PM.
2️⃣ Crawl at Your Own Pace: Visit participating middle-stop venues between 8:30–11:30 PM.
3️⃣ Last Call for Halloween: Everyone meets at the final venue at 11:30 PM for the Saturday night send-off party.



PARTICIPATING VENUES The lineup will be released soon — each location is chosen for great drinks, great atmosphere, and great music.
📍 On event day, click the to view the full venue list, drink specials, and schedule.

🎭 Costume Friendly: Whether you’re dressed as a beer-loving ghoul, a whiskey-wielding pirate, or a spooky pop culture icon, you’ll fit right in.

🚨 Saturday-Only Tickets: This is a one-night-only Halloween party. Early bird tickets start at just $15 — secure your spot before they’re gone.

What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🍺 Entry to 4+ pubs, breweries, and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover at all participating venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Booze Crawl wristband
📱 Digital crawl map to navigate each stop
🎵 Live DJs & music at every venue
🕺 Closing party to end Halloween Saturday in style



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED

Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.

description:
SHADY NASTY TREK TOUR (WLG) w/ DEATHTRIPPA & HALF/ANGEL, SHADY NASTY TREK TOUR (WLG) w/ DEATHTRIPPA & HALF/ANGEL
SHADY NASTY | TREK NZ TOUR
WITH SUPPORT FROM DEATHTRIPPA & HALF/ANGEL
Presented by Goose Garden & Select Music

Following the release of their debut album TREK and a string of sold-out shows across Sydney (Eora), Brisbane (Meanjin), and Melbourne (Naarm), Sydney post-punk trio Shady Nasty announce their debut tour in Aotearoa/New Zealand this September. A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes. Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh. Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.

• Valhalla, Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, 12th September
• Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau / Auckland, 13th September

Tickets available at www.undertheradar.co.nz

description:
Secrets, Orchestra Wellington’s 2025 season, The Dictator’s Shadow,
follows Dmitri Shostakovich’s career, tracing his trajectory as a
brilliant young composer catapulted to early fame and then hurled into danger.
The next chapter in our story is Secrets, featuring an array of bold works and exciting talent! As we continue our exploration of Dmitri Shostakovich's journey 50 years after his death, we present his fourth symphony. The work, was meant to be his boldest statement yet — but the composer withdrew it before its premiere. Why? The whispers were clear: this music would not please the authorities. It stayed hidden for decades, a secret too dangerous to share.
We partner with At The World's Edge Music Festival (AWE) to present the stunning talents of soloists Benjamin Baker (violin) and Yura Lee (viola) in a performance of Mozart’s luminous Sinfonia Concertante. This work offers a moment of balance — a conversation between violin and viola, full of warmth and understanding, reminding us of beauty even in troubled times.
With generous support from the Orchestra Wellington Foundation we also reveal a brand-new secret: the world premiere of "House of the Faun" by WIlliam Philipson, the 2025 SOUNZ Commission for Orchestra and Sistema Youth Orchestra | Te Tono Mahinga a SOUNZ mā te Rāngi Puoro me te Rāngi Puoro Taiohi a Sistema. The work is designed to showcase the young musicians of Arohanui Strings+ by setting their playing against the full orchestra in a rich and immersive musical landscape.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026, Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

Well Made Craft Festival is in October 🎉

description:
Slow Jazz Ensemble w/ Antipodes Quartet, Two of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s favourite ensembles have teamed up for an exciting cross-genre! Antipodes’s innovative textural approach to string quartet playing meets the explorative improvised landscapes of Slow Jazz Ensemble.

Tickets go on sale Friday, 7th of August at 12 pm.

Slow Jazz Ensemble
Slow Jazz Ensemble is an atmospheric jazz group aimed at creating new improvised textural landscapes. Inspired by the likes of Lucien Johnson, Alice Coltrane, and Jasmine Myra, Slow Jazz Ensemble brings together some of Pōneke’s favourite musicians to bring to life a unique expression of heart-stirring cinematic compositions.

Antipodes Quartet
The Antipodes Quartet was founded in 2025, bringing together the brightest emerging string players of New Zealand. Named after the Antipodes, a term that signifies New Zealand’s geographical position on the opposite side of the world from Europe, the quartet embraces a unique perspective on classical music. From the Southern Hemisphere, they approach the rich traditions of the string quartet with fresh energy, drawing from their diverse experiences across the Asia-Pacific and Europe while remaining deeply connected to their musical roots at home in Aotearoa. With a commitment to innovation, accessibility, and artistic excellence, the quartet explores diverse repertoire, from beloved classics to contemporary works.

Their upcoming engagements include side-by-side performances with the New Zealand String Quartet and Orchestra Wellington, as well as appearances at the 2026 Adam Chamber Music Festival. Antipodes champions a bold, engaging approach to performance, education, and outreach, fostering meaningful connections with audiences across Aotearoa.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Techno Taster, Techno Taster
This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.

We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.


ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM

Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.

Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com


HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven

Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.

https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9


LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective

Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.

https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s-rizzo/416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus


SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands

Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.

Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.

https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/album/ech009-bracing-set-pace-u-dont
https://soundcloud.com/1shli
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, ‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.
‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.
‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.

SET TIMES:
7pm - Doors Open
7:30pm - Half/Angel
8:30pm - IVY
9:50pm - The Beatniks
label: Music & Concerts

The objective of this working-bee is weeding tradescantia. Please park in Kiwi Crescent and walk up the shared driveway to the reserve entrance, we are about 50m up the main track from the gate.

description:
The Cattlestops, The Cattlestops
Celebrating twenty-one years of fine musicianship, this cowboy jazz country quartet are back on the road sharing their excellent songs and performance with and all.

With three CDs under their belt, of all original songs, and having performed on and contributed music for the NZ film ‘Secondhand Wedding’, featuring none other than the celebrated John Rowles, this band from the Kapiti Coast are performing the last in their latest mini cluster of great shows.

James Cameron on bass, Wayne Mason on keys, Evan Williams on drums and Andrew London on guitar will have you rocking and singing along to their stellar collection of songs.

RNZ NZ Live: The Cattlestops “Dance in the Rain”


To book: simply email
Include your name, phone contact and the number of tickets required
and you’ll be booked once you receive a reply to your email.

Come for dinner before the show!
Abandoned Taproom Petone have plenty of tasty treats, and grab a drink (or two) as well.

There is paid parking beside the venue in a monitored carpark at $2 per hour.
Alternatively free parking in any adjacent street.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Electrify Wellington: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey, It keeps getting more expensive to heat our homes and water, cook our meals and get around. But there is a way to avoid those rising costs and Electrify Wellington will show you how.  
Most Wellington homes could be saving thousands on their energy bills each year, while also slashing emissions, simply by upgrading their gas and petrol machines to the electric equivalents available today - and ideally powering them with solar and batteries for more self-sufficiency in case of power cuts or natural disasters.
Wellington has crossed the “electrification tipping point” where homes, farms and businesses can now save money and reduce their emissions by going electric. It’s a massive win-win and a lot of people don’t know about the potential savings that are hiding in their cupboards, kitchens and driveways. 
Rewiring Aotearoa is trying to change that and we’re supporting grassroots action across the country. Community electrification groups are popping up all over the place and helping to raise awareness about the benefits for their local region and helping locals through the process. Now, it’s time to bring the buzz to Wellington.
Come along to hear from Mike Casey, who is saving tens of thousands a year on his all-electric solar-powered cherry orchard, and find out how electrifying Wellington is the smartest, cheapest, and healthiest way to power our lives.
label: Conservation & Environment
